loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.  She also earns additional income from selling food and farming rice. 

Amy is requesting her 22nd loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and noodles.  She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Sherkuzi

texts.en:
Sherkuzi is an industrious person who is married and has 2 little children. He is 39 years old. He has been involved in animal husbandry and has been growing agricultural crops for more than 7 years. Little by little, with the passing of time, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the good condition of his animals, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market.

Sherkuzi is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, thereby providing his household with good earnings. He is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy young cattle for developing his business further. Each month he will make his payments on time. Sherkuzi awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy young cattle for developing his business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, 62 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for 21 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. Annie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock such as bread, coffee, soap, sugar, etc. to sell in her store.

Annie has previously borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as bread, coffee, soap, sugar, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba, 48 years old, lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, known for producing fish on the Liberian local market. She is married and has seven children, aged 4 to 22, who live at home. For the past 14 years, Kumba has been selling palm oil, rice, etc. in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. Kumba is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, etc. to expand her business. In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, etc. to expand her business

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 24-year-old single young man. He is a taxi driver and his salary is not enough to cover all of his needs. Alaa wants to improve his living conditions at home, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture and living room seats. Taking this loan will offer Alaa suitable home furniture and enable him to enjoy living in his house.

loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture and living room seats

loans.name: Varmah

texts.en:
Varmah  is 29 years old, married, and has two children. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County. She stopped her education at the 6th Grade, but she is good at managing her home and business. Varmah has been involved in the sales of peanuts, dry bush meat, and beans in the local market, which she learned from her mother. 

Varmah is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase peanuts, dry bush meat, and beans to sell.  She has many customers and her daily profit is high. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, dry bush meat, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 30-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead, as he is the one working the most in the business. 

Abeer is the mother of two boys and one girl. They have a cattle business and use the milk for making yogurt and cheese, or they sell it as milk.They also sell sheep and goats. Now they have 20 goats on their small farm.

Abeer has applied for this youth loan to increase the number of goats they have to get more milk and increase their sales number.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is an 18-year-old single guy living with his five siblings after one of the sisters got married. He is a university student who is still in his freshman year, majoring in child education and behavior. 

Hamzah is now applying for this educational loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is married and has three children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. His wife is housewife. Bahodur’s parents and two brothers live with him. His parents earn small salaries, which is why Bahodur is the main breadwinner in the family with his transportation business, which he has been doing for three years. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. He works hard but his income is not enough to buy all the necessities. 

Bahodur is requesting a loan for 3,000 somoni, which he will use to buy coal as well as for his treatment as he is ill.  This loan will help him to provide his family with coal for the winter and to improve his health.

loans.use: to purchase coal for use in the winter.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 29-year-old single man. He has one older sister. Four years ago Mohammad managed to open his barbershop and worked in it alone. He recently employed another person to help as the number of customers has increased. Mohammad is now working on improving his shop by adding new barbering tools for the shop and expanding the shop's inner space. He has applied for a youth loan for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy new cutting and shaving tools.

loans.name: Vugukora A / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Madame Anastasie fait l’agriculture des pommes de terre. Elle fait partie du groupe solidaire VUGUKORA A / RBV.  Elle est mariée et  âgé de 54 ans. Elle  a 6 enfants dont le plus âgé  a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 12 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école et  a une autre personne  en sa charge.
Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’enseignement primaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2009 et est au deuxième  cycle de crédit.
Ce crédit va lui permettre de louer le champ, d’acheter 300 kgs des semences,  des engrais chimiques et fumiers et le reste l’utilisera pour payer la main d’œuvre.
Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Elle va chercher les marchés pour pouvoir vendre en grande quantité. Ceci constitue une stratégie qui va permettre la croissance de son activité agricole.
Pour son affaire, elle a l’ambition d’être l’agricultrice professionnelle  des pommes de terre.
Pour sa famille, elle a l’ambition d’éduquer ses enfants jusqu’à l’université.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anastasie grows potatoes. She is a member of the Vukugora A/RBV solidarity group. She is married and 54 years old. She has six children, the oldest of whom is 24 years old and the youngest 12. Two of her children are in school, and she also has one other dependent.

She was born in Rwanda and has finished six years of primary school.
[She] has started collaborating with ACB Ltd in 2009 and is on her second loan cycle.
This loan will allow her to rent a field, to buy 300 kg [661 lbs] of seeds, chemical and natural fertilizers and use the rest to pay the cost of labor. She does not anticipate any difficulty repaying this loan.

She will go through the markets in order to be able to buy in large quantities. This is her strategy for growing her agricultural business.
Concerning her business, her goal is to become a professional potato farmer.
Concerning her family, she would to provide for her children’s education, all the way through college.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy 300 kg of seeds, buy chemical fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make pottery, including a variety of clay, dyes, and firewood for her pottery oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ink, paper products, notebooks, and pens

loans.name: Alonso Edison

texts.es:
Alonso Edison tiene 35 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en Ventanas provincia de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Alonso Edison se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave, arroz ademas se dedica ala crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas y balenciado para los pollos

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para los cultivos y dar alimento a los pollos. El sueño es poder mejorar el estilo de vida teniendo mayores ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y reunirse con los amigos del barrio a conversar.
texts.en:
Alonso Edison is a single 35-year-old who does not have any children. He lives in a relatives' house in Ventanas, in the province of Bolívar.

He is a member of the El Recreo Communal Bank, which is located in the rural community of San Vicente Las Lomas, which is in the canton of Ventanas. This communal bank focuses on the fishing and agricultural industries. 

Alonso Edison works in agriculture in the sowing of soft corn and rice, and he also raises chickens. He is applying for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, insecticides and balanced feed for the chickens. With the help of the loan, he could buy fertilizers for the crops and feed for the chickens. His dream is to be able to improve his lifestyle with increased profits. 

In his free time he likes to play sports and meet with his neighborhood friends to chat.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, insecticides and balanced feed for chickens.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus  hijos en casa propia, Ella posee una venta de refrescos naturales naranja, horchata, tamarindo entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, se encuentra ubicada en un lugar estratégico que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades comerciales, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que elabora, es hecho con material de primera calidad, con mucha higiene y lo vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; Ana es una mujer muy enérgica  siempre se encuentra activa en el trabajo, nunca desaprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que lo más importante para llegar al éxito es la perseverancia y el amor a la labor, es así como se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas, agua, hielo, azúcar, utensilios etc. Ana Leticia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que así podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia is 34 years old and lives with her life partner and her children in her own house. She has a stand that serves natural beverages made of oranges, horchata, and tamarind, among others. She has had this business for several years, which has given her valuable experience that allows her to achieve the best earnings. 

Her stand is located in a strategic place that has proved to be very good for her commercial activities. She has many customers because everything that she makes is made of the finest-quality materials, in a very hygienic way and at very reasonable prices. In addition, the service she provides is excellent.  

Ana is a very energetic woman. She is always active when she works, and never fails to take advantage of the opportunities that present themselves to her. She thinks that the most important thing in achieving success is perseverance and the love of work. This is how she came to apply for a loan through Integral to buy fruit, water, ice, sugar, utensils, etc. 

Ana Leticia has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures that she can repay the debt and at the same time has the confidence that in doing so, she will be able to arrive at a place of personal economic security.

loans.use: to buy fruit, water, ice, sugar and utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television to get information for his personal development.

loans.name: Dilcia Aracely

texts.es:
La Señora Dilcia tiene 32  años de edad,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del municipio de La Másica, Departamento de Atlántida.
Dilcia siempre se ha dedicado a los negocios propios, ella tenía una cafetería y decidió cerrarla momentáneamente para dedicarse a la venta de abarrotería y granos básicos a través de una pulpería.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 16,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de verduras, condimentos, arroz, fríjoles, manteca, harina, azúcar, refrescos, lácteos, carnes y medicamentos de uso común.
Su meta es lograr posesionarse con su clientela y luego retomar el negocio de venta de comida en el mismo local aledaño a la pulpería.
texts.en:
Sra. Dilcia is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in a community in the town of La Másica, Department of Atlántida.

Dilcia has always managed her own businesses. She has a cafeteria, but she decided to close it momentarily so that she could devote more time to selling groceries and basic grains at her convenience store.

Dilcia is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 16,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of vegetables, condiments, rice, beans, lard, flour, sugar, soft drinks, dairy products, meat, and medicines that are commonly used. Her goal is to establish her clientele so that she can return to selling meals at the same location that is next to her store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, rice, beans, lard, flour, sugar, soft drinks, dairy products, meat, and medicines.

loans.name: Dallendyshe

texts.en:
Dallendyshe is a 48-year-old Egyptian and grandmother of two children whom she just adores; she chose to be photographed at her home with one of her grandchildren instead of at her business activity. The family lives in a major city in southeastern Albania.

Dallendyshe has been buying and selling secondhand clothing and other items in the city’s market for the past six years. “As for the profit, it hasn’t been that bad,” she says. “I have been feeding all my family with this income,” she continued. Dallendyshe is requesting a loan of approximately $2,350 to buy more secondhand items and resell them. She hopes that she will get the financial support she seeks from Kiva lenders. Please note that Dallendyshe has been a VFA client for a long time has proven to be very responsible.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of secondhand items to resell

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 25 years old, married, and has three children between 2 and 8 years old. They all live in Buchanan Ground, Bassa County. That is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. 

All of her life Edwina has not been to school, but she said she is good at managing a business. She has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. in the local market. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business. 

She likes her business because it helps her to save money. Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal 46 years old, married, and has four children.  He husband works in a bakery. Recently Amal opened a small toy shop to help improve their living conditions.  She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more toys and other items for children to sell.

loans.use: to purchase toys and other items for children.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is 43 years old and widowed. She works in tailoring business to support herself.  She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fabric,  threads, and another electrical sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, threads, and another electrical sewing machine.

loans.name: Hyam

texts.en: Hyam is a 37-year-old married woman.  She is the mother of three daughters and two sons. A few years ago, Hyam started a beauty salon business at home using one hair dryer and few tools.  She also sells makeup products.  Recently, she was able to enlarge her business by adding beauty salon seats and got more hair dryers and a straightener. She still needs some hair tools and wants to add some facial products, for which she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to get hair tools and facial products.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. In 1996, she opened her own grocery store to help her husband in making their living. Lina is a hard worker with a very good reputation. Her aim is to help her husband in making their living, although at the beginning he was against the idea, because he didn't want his wife to tire herself in business life and wants her to stay relaxed and take good care of their child.  But, at the end he accepted the fact that she has to spend her spare time in something useful that is productive at the same time.

Today, Lina is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, and this is her ninth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower.  She wants to buy new merchandise for her business, in order to increase the variety of products she sells. Lina is always responsive to her customers requests to keep them loyal and pleased.   She hopes to turn her shop to a Super Market, and she is willing to open a bakery in the future.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for her business in order to increase the variety of products she sells

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en: Fathiya 34 years old and single. She started her own business selling and renting engagement and wedding dresses a few years ago. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more bridal accessories such as tiaras and veils.

loans.use: to purchase bridal accessories.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 25 years old and single. Her father is supporting three other children. Their only source of income is the stationary and office supplies shop that her father has. 

Manal has decided to help her father by requesting a youth loan, which she will use to purchase products and do maintenance on the copy machine. She is conservative so she asked her father to appear in the photo

loans.use: to do maintenance on the copy machine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business. She is thankful for the previous loan that enabled her to have an increased income. She says that her business is doing well thanks to her efforts and the support she is getting from Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva. 

With this new investment, she will be able to buy more clothes and shoes for resale since she wants to take advantage of the December festive season in which sales are high. Thanks for your support!

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is 35 years old, married, and, has three children. While her husband is serving with the military, she looks after her children and makes baskets and trays using hay straws. Recently she started making mirrors frames and tissue boxes. 

Bayan is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more raw materials such as hay and glue.  This loan will help to increase her productivity so she would be able to have her own gallery for her crafts in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as hay and glue.

loans.name: Darcy

texts.es:
Darcy, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer decidida y emprendedora, que le gusta el  trabajo y sabe que con esfuerzo se logra progresar. Está casada  con Jhon  quien es policía en actividad, ellos se esfuerzan por tener una  mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa, la cual compraron antes de casarse. La actividad que realiza Darcy  es la venta de medicamentos en pequeñas cantidades desde su casa, atendiendo principalmente a sus vecinos quienes la solicitan. También en sus tiempos libres realiza trabajos manuales como manicure y pedicure. Además cuenta hace 03 años con un empleo rotativo de atención en una farmacia privada donde aprendió sobre medicamentos.
Se inició hace más de 03 años en el negocio de los medicamentos en casa,  haciéndose conocida por la necesidad de los vecinos de su barrio por  de medicamentos que vende, ambas actividades lo realiza sola con mucho entusiasmo y carisma que es lo que le caracteriza.
Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la facilidad para realizarlo.
Decidió empezar su negocio, por los deseos de contar con un ingreso adicional y el conocimiento sobre el negocio.
Por tanto y  viendo lo buenos resultados desea con las ganancias invertir e incursionar en un futuro desde su casa en la venta de parrilladas solo los domingos para aumentar sus ingresos. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, de esa manera obtener la confianza de institución y tener acceso a créditos en el futuro. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de medicamentos de primera necesidad, de esa manera aumentar el stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Darcy is 25 years old and is a very determined and enterprising woman, who likes work and knows that with effort she will succeed in making progress. She is married to Jhon who is a policeman for work. They strive to have a better quality of life. Together they live comfortably in their own home, which they bought before getting married. Darcy sells medications in small quantities from her home, serving mainly her neighbors who request her. In her spare time she also does manual work such as manicures and pedicures. In addition since 3 years ago she counts on a rotating job of customer service in a private pharmacy where she learned about medications.

She started the business of selling medications from home more than 3 years ago, making herself known because of the needs of the neighbors of her neighborhood for the medications that she sells. She carries out both businesses alone with much enthusiasm and charisma which characterize her.

She considers her business profitable because of the profits that it leaves her and the easiness to make them.

She decided to start her business, because of her desire to rely on an additional income and her knowledge about the business.

Therefore seeing the good results she wants to invest with the profits and penetrate into a future through her home with the sale of barbecue only on Sundays to increase her income. Therefore this will be the loan number 2 with the microfinance institution. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since in this manner she feels sure of advancing with her business. In addition she commits to be punctual in her payments. In this manner she will obtain the trust of the institution and have access to loans in the future.

With the amount requested of 1,000 PEN, she will invest it in the purchase of medications for primary needs. In this manner she will increase the stock available for sale, seeking low prices for her volume purchases.

loans.use: to buy basic medications.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, which is known for producing fish on the Liberian local market. She is 38 years old, is married, and has four children ages 2 to 15 who all live at home.

For the past 14 years, Rebecca has been selling products like palm oil and rice in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother, She is requesting a loan to purchase rubber dishes (spoons, bowls, plates, cups, tubs, etc.) to expand her business. 

In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes to expand her business.

loans.name: Kulthum

texts.en:
Kulthum is a very hardworking 24-year-old married woman and has two children. Her store mainly sells food items especially flat breads and dumplings. She needs this loan in order to be able to continue stocking her food kiosk with more products, since the season in which she has more sales is getting close, and she wants to by ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil, and food flavors.

She appreciates the opportunity that she is once again receiving, since in this way she will be able to grow and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to by ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil,and food flavors.

loans.name: Naweh

texts.en:
Naweh is 25 years old, a high school graduate, married, and has two children ages 7 months and 4 years old, and they all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.  She has been involved in the sales of slippers in the local market.  She learned this way of selling from her friends, and said she is good at managing her business.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers to resell.  She likes her business because it helps her to save money, and her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase slippers to resell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 36 years old, married and  has four children.  She lives in Paynesville, South Community. She stopped her education in the 5th Grade. She sells soft drinks and mineral water in her community, which she has been doing for five years. She sells from 6 AM to 7 PM. She makes a profit  when she sells, because her soft drinks and mineral water are always cold. 

Sophia is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more soft drinks and mineral water to sell.  One of the difficulties she faces is low sales during the raining season.  Her  future plan is to give her children a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and mineral water.

loans.name: Altho 3 Group

texts.en:
Nina, 28 years old, is the group leader of Altho 3. A married mother of two children, Agung, five, and Aditya, one, Nina has been operating a kiosk in front of her house selling children's snacks and bottled tea since 2006. The money earned enables her to pay her children's school fees and meet her family's daily needs.

Nina and the other members of the Altho 3 group are requesting their second loan from VisionFund Indonesia so they can increase their working capital. Nina will use her portion to buy children's snacks and soft drinks for her kiosk. She hopes she can open a grocery store in the market near her house and eventually send her children to the University of Indonesia.

The other group members will use their loan portions to further fund their businesses. Sriyah has an enterprise selling cooked food; Novian has a business selling clothes on credit, and Sri has a venture buying and selling rummage.

loans.use: buy bottle packaging, tea, soft drinks, and children's snacks.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is a 22-year-old man. He has seven siblings. Nayef is a third-year university student, majoring in Managerial Information Systems. He wants to go through his fourth year to be able to graduate and look for a suitable job to support himself. 

To assist with that, Nayef applied for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
El señor Gaspar tiene ya más de 25 años dedicándose a su negocio de peluquería. Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en equipo ya que desea a condicionar otro local y así tener en diferentes partes de la ciudad su negocio ya que tiene clientes de diferentes colonias y le están solicitando que este mas cerca de ellos.
El señor Gaspar vive con su mama quien es una persona de edad avanzada y es quien esta bajo la responsabilidad de señor Gaspar.
Desea mejorar sus ingresos y con esta inversión de tener varios negocios de peluquería en la ciudad aparte de que le ayudara a tener más ganancias, podrá ayudar a otras personas dándoles trabajo.
 Con las ganancias que obtiene de su salón de belleza es para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Gaspar has had a beauty salon for over 25 years.  He is requesting a loan to invest in equipment, because he wants to open up another location to expand his business to another part of the city.  He has customers from different neighborhoods, and they have been asking him to open a location closer to them.

Gaspar lives with his mother, who is an elderly woman, and he provides for her.  

Gaspar wants to increase his earnings.  With this investment, enabling him to have various beauty salons in the city, not only will he obtain more income but he will also be able to help other people by giving them work.

Gaspar will pay off this loan with the earnings he obtains from his beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new generator and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tenneh is 35 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 9 and 17 years. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She has not been to school but says she is good at managing her business. She has been selling body creams, sprays, powder, hair grease and underclothes in and around the local market, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She requests a loan to purchase more of these items for her business, which she enjoys because it helps her save money. Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase body creams, sprays, powder, hair grease and underclothes for her business.

loans.name: Korpu

texts.en:
Korpu lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.  Korpu is 36 years old, married, and has four children aged between 7 to 14 that live at home.  

For the past seven years, she has been selling palm oil, rice, sugar, flour, salt, etc. in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice,sugar, flour, salt, etc., to expand her business.  In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice,sugar, flour, salt, etc., to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
27-year old Fatuma is a hardworking woman.  She is married, has three children, and has a great desire to get ahead in life. She lives with her husband and helps pay for household expenses. Together they are able to have a stable life.

Fatuma earns her living selling adult clothing to her customers whom she visits in their houses and offices. The prices she charges are affordable, and the style of clothing attractive--both of which help her have reasonable sales. 

She is seeking a loan from Kiva so she can have enough money to buy shirts, skirts, and shorts as well as shoes and sandals during this festive season due to increase in demand. In this way she will be able to increase sales at year end, a time when clothing and footwear are in great demand.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, and shorts as well as shoes and sandals for sale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel es todo un caballero, y un excelente ser humano él vive en la ciudad de Otavalo junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, desde pequeño le gusto la agricultura a lo que hoy se dedica completamente, Manuel se define como una persona tranquila, alegre y muy trabajador que ama a su familia y quiere darles todo lo que ellos necesiten.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de semilla de frutilla, además en la compra de equipo de riego para el mantenimiento de las plantas, ya que se va a realizar un riego a base de goteo y se necesita inversión, pero los resultados son excelentes mayor producción y mejor calidad de fruta.

El sueño que Manuel tiene es tener un terreno grande donde pueda sembrar y cosechar frutillas en grandes cantidades, y ser un productor mayorista para la ciudad de Otavalo, además piensa producir derivados de frutilla como mermelada y distribuir a los supermercados. Manuel cree mucho en Dios y le agradece todos los días por tener una familia unida, Manuel sabe que con fe y trabajo el camino al éxito será positivo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a complete gentleman and a wonderful human being who lives in city of Otavalo with his wife and their four children. Since he was little he liked farming and he makes a living off of it today. Manuel can be defined as a calm, happy and very hard working person that loves his family and wants to give them all that they need. 

The loan requested from Fodemi will be used to invest in the purchase of strawberry and and irrigation equipment to maintain his plants. He is going to use a drip irrigation system and needs this investment. The results of this system will be greater production and greater of the fruit. 

Manuel's dream is to have a large plot of land where he will be able to plant and harvest strawberries in larger quantities and to be a wholesale producer for the city of Otavalo. He also plans to produce strawberry products like marmelade and distribute them to the supermarkets. Manuel believes firmly in God and is thankful to him everyday for having a united family. Manuel knows that with faith and hard work the path to success will be positive.

loans.use: to buy strawberry seeds and to buy irrigation materials for his harvest because he needs a special irrigation system in order to produce more.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.  She is 43 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 1 and 26 that live at home.  For the past twenty years she has been selling palm nut, cassava, pepper, oregano, etc., in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm nut, cassava, pepper, oregano, etc., to expand her business.  In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm nut, cassava, pepper, oregano, etc., to expand her business

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima, is a 26-year-old resident of Mombasa, Coast Province, Kenya. She is single. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses and provides for her siblings through a grocery stall she owns and manages. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands the business. 

She hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams that all her siblings will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Saturdaymah

texts.en:
Saturdaymah is 28 years old and lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.  She is married  and she did not attend school.  She has a one year old child that lives with her at home.  

For the past six years she has been selling rice by the cup, and oil in the local market.  She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers, and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice and oil for her business.  She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice and oil for her business

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam is a 25-year-old, hard-working housewife and a responsible mother of two daughters and a son. Since 2011, her husband has been running a vegetable and dried fruit shop. He is interested in purchasing dried fruit and vegetables from the market, but due to financial contraints, he has found it difficult.

To help her husband, Ghulam, as member of a six-person lending group (Ghulam's Group), has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will allow Ghulam's husband to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and net income. Ghulam desires of her family’s bright future. 

Note: In the picture, Ghulam holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and dried fruit for her husband's business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old. She sells food items and has spent seven years in this business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be put aside as savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 27 years old. She sells fruit and has spent six years in this business.  With the loan, she wants to buy more fruits for sale. She plans to use the profits as savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Maria Genara

texts.es: María Genara de 52 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, madre soltera con dos hijos mayores de edad de 27, 32 años. María se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de champo, cigarros por unidad, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, huevos, sal, frijoles, pan.  El negocio inicio  con el objetivo de tener una fuente de trabajo para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para satisfacer a sus clientes. María ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. María Genera agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Genara is 52 years old and lives in the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is a single mother of two children who are 27 and 32 years old. María is characterized as a responsible and hard working woman who has a great desire to improve herself personally. She has a convenience store located in her house, which she has had for 10 years when she started making a living with this business. A "pulpería" is a small store that sells daily consumption products in small quantities including coffee packets, shampoo packets, cigarettes sold individually, rice, sugar, oil, soap, eggs, salt, beans and bread. 

She began the business with the goal to have a job so that she could take care of herself and support the household expenses. The loan's purpose is to invest in working capital and stock the business in order to satisfy her customers. María has worked with the Foundation and has demonstrated her responsability in paying on time and in full. María Genera is thankful to the Kiva investors for providing support to those of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified form of working.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her convenience store with basic consumption products including coffee packets, shampoo packets, cigarettes sold individually, rice, sugar, oil, soap, eggs, salt, beans and bread.

loans.name: Sundayway

texts.en: Sundayway, age 41, lives in the Congo Town community. She is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 15. They live at home with their mother; only two of the children are attending school. She stopped her education in the 5th grade, and her husband is a contractor. She has been very hardworking and determined with her business for the past seven years. She sells (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, blouses, and head ties. Because of the quality materials that she sells, she makes a profit every day. She sells 12 hours a day. She purchases her goods from wholesale dealers, and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, and blouses for the business. She is grateful to all the lenders for the support they have given her in her business. Her dream is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, and blouses for the business.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 38-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two daughters and three sons. Her husband is a laborer. One son is an auto mechanic, while the others are a laborer and student respectively. Parveen's husband's income is insufficient to meet the household expenses; therefore they are going through a very difficult time.

Parveen is a very hardworking and independent woman. She has an excellent skill of making bangles. By selling handmade bangles, she helps her husband to meet the family's needs and her children's education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 20 years. Her clients always love her work and appreciate her a lot for her excellent skills.

Parveen, as a member of a six-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing some material to make more variety of bangles. 

As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of building her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education for her children. Parveen and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase material to make a variety of bangles for her handmade bangles business.

loans.name: Mwanangano

texts.en:
Mwanangano is a married woman with six children under her responsibility. She is originally from Likoni, a place that is located in the southern zone of the Coast Province. This woman is characterized as being a hardworking and responsible person with a desire for personal improvement. 

She has a financial business running a food stall, and has been in this business for two years. She has therefore demonstrated her responsibility in paying on time and in the right manner. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business with the purchase of ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, oil and flour.

She is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, oil and flour.

loans.name: Rabiqa's Group

texts.en:
Rabiqa is a 22-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband.

Since 2007 her husband has been running a DVD shop which is the only source of income for the family. He is a very energetic and hardworking person. He is interested in purchasing new DVD's for his shop to offer his clients more variety. This will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. 

For that as a member of 6-person group Rabiqa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the DVD's.

She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new DVD's for her husband's video shop.

loans.name: Siperathe

texts.en: Siperathe is 25 years old. She is married to a farmer. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for the past three years. She would like to get a loan to buy more sorghum to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family and for savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma considers herself to be a happy person, of good character, friendly, and above all very responsible in her work. She lives with her husband and their five children in the town of Msambweni.

Fatuma works selling food items in a small food stall. It’s going very well, and she is very popular among her customers. In order to improve service to her customers, Fatuma needs to invest in the purchase of wheat flour, rice, maize flour,etc. With this loan, she will improve products for her customers and improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, maize flour, etc

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 38 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has five years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Theogenie

texts.en: Theogenie is 29 years old. She owns a store, which she has been running for the past year. She would like to get a loan for buying more sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 61 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa  y trabajadora, además de amable y solidarias, esta separada de su conviviente. Vive en compañía de 03 de sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad para esto cuenta con una bodega instalada en local en el frontis de su propia casa, la cual abrió por la necesidad económica que atravesaban ya que con los ingresos de su ex pareja no les alcanzaba, ahora cuenta con un ingreso que le da un alivio, además de verlo crecer en estos 10 años que lleva funcionando su negocio.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso adicional con lo cual cubre los gastos de su hogar, además de poder estar en casa y cuidar de sus nietos a quienes quiere mucho y están cursando sus estudios. Por lo contrario no le agrada cuando algunos de sus clientes le solicitan crédito por sus compras a lo que ella se niega ya que considera que su negocio está en crecimiento y no le conviene este tipo de venta. Por otro lado, el resultado positivo que evidencia  su negocio,  tiene planes de hacerlo crecer y ampliar sus productos. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, considera que es un grupo responsable y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en comprar de abarrotes en general a precio por mayor buscando así tener mayores ganancias y surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Isabel, 61, is a dedicated, hardworking woman in addition to being kind and supportive.  She’s separated from her spouse and lives with three of her children who she loves very much in her own house.  The activity Isabel carries out is selling basic staple grocery items.  To do so, she has a store installed in the front of her house that she opened due to the economic need she was going through because her ex-husband’s income was insufficient.  Now she earns her own income which is a relief and she’s also seen it grow in the ten years it’s been in operation.

She likes her business because it allows her to earn additional income to cover household expenses and she can be at home to care for her grandchildren who she loves very much and are attending school.  On the contrary, though, she doesn’t much like it when some of her customers request their purchases on credit; she refuses because she believes her business is in the growing phase and this type of sale is not to its advantage.  On the other hand, the positive results her business is having leads her to plan to expand it and widen her inventory.  

Therefore, this will be her fourth MFP loan and she’s hoping for your collaboration so that she can solidify her plans.  She also feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers it to be a responsible, supportive group.  She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy grocery items at wholesale prices to earn higher profits and stock her store.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta de 64 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Vicenta se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, amable, respetuosa. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 18  años que se dedica a dicha actividad. Una pulpería es una tienda donde venden productos en cantidades pequeñas  como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sobre de café, sobre de champoo, pan, leche, aceite, huevos, detergentes. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con el objetivo de mejorar sus ventas y satisfacer a su clientela. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de vida para su familia. Vicenta agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Vicenta, 64, is married and has three adult children.  She’s from Chinandega Department, a place located in the west of the country.  Vicenta is noted for being a very hardworking, kind, respectful person.  Her economic activity is a grocery store located at home.  She’s been in this business for 18 years.  This type of store is one that sells items like rice, beans, sugar, coffee packets, shampoo packets, bread, milk, oil, eggs and detergents in small quantities.  The objective of the loan is to act as working capital and stock the business in order to improve sales and meet customer demand.  The business arose because she needed a source of family income.  Vicenta is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified source of employment.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 43  años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora empeñosa y decidida con muchas ganas de sobresalir, esta separada de su conviviente. Tiene 02 hijos de 13 y 01 año de edad, habitando  cómodamente en la casa de su mamá. La actividad que ejerce Julia consiste en la de venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar,  harina, entre otros. Su actividad la realiza en un local en el interior de su propia casa. Comenta que se inició en esta labor  ya que ha visto la experiencia de sus amistades que tienen el mismo negocio y viendo que les resultaba muy  rentable, decidió invertir en esta actividad y poner todo de su parte para a hacerlo progresar. Su hijo mayor la ayuda en sus ratos libres con la atención de los clientes que cada día se incrementan. Le gusta este negocio pues lo ve tranquilo, y sin mucho esfuerzo genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos del día. Además que le permite tener horas libres para dedicarlos a otras actividades, igualmente le permite estar en casa donde puede ver  y atender a sus menores hijos. Con un buen manejo de sus ganancias,  trabajo y paciencia desea hacer crecer su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP., por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues ha observado que es un grupo unido y colaborador logrando tener bastante apoyo por sus partes.
Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles los piensa invertir en su nuevo negocio comprando abarrotes a precio más cómodos, para así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia, age 43, is a hard-working, dedicated and determined woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. She is separated from her common-law husband. She has two children, aged 13 and 1, who live comfortably in their mother's house. Julia's work is selling general groceries, such as rice, sugar, flour, and other items. She does her work in a shop which is inside her own house. She comments that she started this work because she had seen the experience of friends who had the same kind of business. Seeing that it was very profitable for them, she decided to invest in this activity and put everything she has into making it a success. Her older son helps her in his free time by serving customers, who become more numerous every day. She likes this business because it seems comfortable, and without too much effort she can generate income to cover her daily expenses. It also lets her have free hours to dedicate to other activities. Equally, it lets her be at home where she can watch and take care of her minor children. With good management of her earnings, hard work and patience, she wants to make her business grow. Accordingly, this will be her first loan with the MFP institution. She hopes for support to continue toward her goals. In addition, she enjoys being in her communal bank, since she has observed that it is a united and cooperative group which has been able to provide a lot of support for its members. 

With the amount requested, 600 new soles, she plans to invest in her new business, buying groceries at a more economical price so that she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy staple products to stock her store.

loans.name: Leidy

texts.es: Leidy es la propietaria de un negocio donde vende muchas variedades y artículos de cacharrería; ella inició esta actividad desde hace 1 año, pues había construido su  experiencia,  cuando fue empleada de un almacén que se dedicaba a la misma actividad y como su propietaria no puedo continuar, decidió vendérselo a Leidy, quien lo ha sostenido, haciéndolo crecer poco a poco. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y también a crédito, mientras sus compras las hace diariamente y su horario de trabajo inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. El  mercado de Leidy esta concentrado entre sus vecinos del barrio y de zonas aledañas que conocen la actividad y frecuentemente se acercan a comprarle, pues encuentran todo lo que ellos necesitan. Aprovechando que se acerca la temporada navideña y de año nuevo, Leidy está aplicando a un credikiva,  para comprar juguetería, ropa y calzado, que es lo que mas requiere su clientela y le han hecho encargos sobre los que planea comprar. Esto es justamente,  en lo que radica el éxito de su credikiva, además de los muchos descuentos que aprovechará de sus proveedores, que conduce  a que los precios que ofrecerá a su clientela sean muy competitivos y gane la fidelidad de sus queridos compradores..
texts.en:
Leidy owns a business where she sells much variety and low-cost novelty items.  She started this activity a year ago because she’d acquired experience working in a store that sold the same kind of merchandise and since its owner was unable to continue with it she decided to sell it to Leidy who has kept it going making it grow little by little.  She sells for cash and also on credit while she makes her purchases daily; her work schedule is 8am to 6pm.  Leidy’s market is concentrated among her local neighbors and from adjacent areas that know about her activity and frequently come by to buy from her because they find everything they need.  

Taking advantage of the approaching Christmas and New Year’s season, Leidy is applying for a Kiva loan to buy toys, clothes and footwear which is what her clientele most requires; they’ve placed orders for the merchandise she plans to buy which is precisely where her Kiva loan’s success rests in addition to the many discounts she’ll get from her suppliers which leads to her offering very competitive prices to her customers which in turn leads to her dear buyers being loyal to her.

loans.use: to buy toys, clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Али живет в городе Норак. Ему 30 лет. Он женат, имеет 2 детей. Али занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он хочет взять кредит и отремонтировать свою автомашину и дом.
texts.en: Ali lives in the city of Norak. He is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. Ali offeres taxi services. He would like to use this loan to repair his car and home.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and home

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Халима очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 64 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Всю свою прожитую жизнь она проработала от всей души для содержания семьи. 12 лет она занимается вязанием корзинок из ветки деревьев. Она продает на местном рынке и имеет своих клиентов. Полученный доход она использует для содержания семьи. Для получения дополнительного дохода Халима хочет организовать новый бизнес.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес переработкой и продажи косточек абрикоса. Переработанные косточки имеет большой спрос на местном рынке и Халима вполне может развевать свой новый бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1000 сомони для покупки оборудования для переработки косточек, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Halima is a very hard-working woman.  She is 64 years old and is widowed with two children.  Throughout her whole life, she has worked with all her soul to support her family.  For 12 years she has been a basket weaver - she sells her products at the local market and has her own clients.  She uses her income to support her family.  To earn a bit of extra money, Halima wants to start a new business.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  She wants to start a business processing and selling apricot seeds.  Processed seeds are in high demand at the local market and Halima is fully capable of developing her new business.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy equipment to process seeds so she can start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy apricot deseeding equipment

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 47 years old and widow with five children.

Lorelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct-selling business selling Avon products and ready-to-wear in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Lorelie has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct-selling business selling Avon products and ready-to-wear for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Lorelie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment for watering her crops

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional duck eggs for her fertilized duck egg business.

Rosa has been in this business for 10 years. Rosa earns additional income from food vending and raising chickens.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional duck eggs for her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 24-year-old married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as a responsible man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the 5,800 KES loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his six family members. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 31-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working in selling vegetables, fruits, conserves and sweets for ten years. His business is expanding and increasing gradually, since his shop is located in a special area facing the university where the students have a big effect on his increase in income.

Haytham is a hard worker who seeks perfection in everything.

Haytham applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy new merchandise requested by his customers, especially goods for the coming winter season.

This is his third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing in paying-back history. His previous loans helped a lot in increasing his income and improving his living.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise requested by his customers.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, 49, is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has seven children. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Halima operates a market stall, where she sells cashew nuts in the community market. She buys a quantity of this commodity and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

To help her continue operations of her business, Halima is requesting a KES 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities of cashew nuts to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. 

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Ana Marie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulls to sell

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Agueda, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Cesar quien es empleado, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos de 09, 06 y 04 años de edad a los que quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Agueda es la venta de comidas rápidas como salchipapas, juanes, y otros, para esto instala todos los días  su freidora  con sus mesas y sillas por las tardes en una esquina en el centro poblado de Manantay, desde donde atiende muy amablemente  a sus clientes contando con el apoyo de su conviviente y su hijo mayor quienes le apoyan en la preparación y atención en sus ratos libres.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su pareja. Por lo contrario le cansa tener que instalar y desinstalar todos los días su puesto de ventas, por eso quisiera poder alquilar un local donde tendría todo listo para la atención  a sus clientes, por eso viendo las ganancias  que le deja y cotando con el apoyo de su pareja tiene planes de alquilar un local y colocar más mesas y sillas para que estén más cómodos sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar bien don su banco comunal pues pudo observar que es un grupo unido y espera que sigan de la misma manera. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Agueda is 31 years old; she is a hardworking and focused woman with the drive to get ahead in life. She lives with her partner, Cesar who is a salesperson, out of their union they have 3 children of 9, 6 and 4 years of age. She loves them very much and they live comfortably in their own home. Agueda works selling fast food like salchipapas (fried potatoes and sausages), juanes (a traditional chicken and rice meal) and other items. Everyday she prepares her fryer, along with her tables and chairs in the afternoons in a corner in a central area of the Manantay town. She kindly cares for her customers with the support of her partner and eldest son who help her prepare and in their free time.

Agueda enjoys her business since she gets enough income to pay the household expenses and support her partner. However, she gets tired of having to set up and take down her stall everyday, which is why she would like to be able to rent a place where everything will be ready for her to take care of her customers. She has looked at her profits and with the support of her partner, Agueda plans to rent a place and have more tables and chairs so her customers will be more comfortable. This will be her first loan with MFP that is why she hopes for a small loan to be able to realize her goals. Besides being in good standing with her communal bank, she has seen that it is a very united group and hopes that they will continue on the same path. With the 1000 nuevos soles she will buy tables and chairs as well as ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs as well as ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene muchas ideas que desea realizar. Es conviviente con Ignacio quien jubilado, comerciante y padre de sus  03 hijos de 24, 20 y 18 años de edad y desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Manuela es la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas de diversos sabores  y marcas, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos a temperaturas heladas al gusto de sus clientes por lo caluroso de la zona. Atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente desde su casa. Iniciándose hace más de 18 años, comprando en pocas cantidades con su propio capital, y viendo la buena acogida que tuvo su negocio se decidió continuar y hasta el momento sus hijos la ayudan en la atención de los clientes. 
Considera que su negocio es rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Antes tenía problemas económicos ya que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaban y con la llegada de su hija los gastos aumentaron, tomando la decisión de iniciar su negocio, que ahora le saca de los apuros económicos.
Viendo los buenos resultados y la acogida que continúa teniendo su negocio tiene planes de aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías,  así ver crecer su negocio y aumentas sus ganancias económicas. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que contará con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para tener acceso a más créditos en el futuro. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en compra de más mercaderías para su negocio como bebidas gaseosas y cervezas de diversos sabores, aumentando el stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Manuela, 55, has the ideas and the desire to get ahead. Her live-in partner Ignacio is retired, a merchant, and father of three children, ages 24, 20, and 18. They want to offer their children a better life. They live together in a house they purchased as a result of hard work. Manuela sells a variety of brands and flavors of sodas and beers and has a refrigerator where she keeps the beverages chilled to her customers´ liking in the hot climate. She offers friendly service in her house. She started the business 18 years ago, puchasing small lots with her own funds. Excellent sales persuaded her to keep going, and today her children help wait on customers.

The business is profitable. Previously, she had financial difficulties because her partner´s income didn´t cover their expenses. After the children were born, expenses increased, so she started her business. Today, the business keeps her out of financial trouble. Since it is successful and busy, Manuela wants to increase her inventory to grow her business and earn more income. This will be her first loan cycle with MFP, and she is pleased to have a line of credit to grow her business. She promises to be a responsible payer so that she can have access to future credit. She will use the loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy more flavors and brands of sodas and beers to sell. She will look for the best prices when she buys her wholesale stock.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers.

loans.name: Zulianita

texts.es:
Zulianita, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ilusiones y ganas de progresar a base de su propio esfuerzo, siendo amable y cordial con las personas. Es conviviente con Fernando quien se dedica al transporte. Tienen 03 hijos de  16, 14 y 06 años de edad a quien quiere mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Zulianita  es la venta de frutas regionales y refrescas por las mañanas, para lo cual instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa  donde atiende a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial. También trabaja lavando ropa de sus familiares y vecinos generando ingresos adicionales. Se inició en su negocio con un préstamo de MFP, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
 Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por ser la única en la zona con ese negocio siendo bastante solicitada. 
Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía los deseos de ser una persona productiva y generar sus propios ingresos para no depender completamente de su pareja y apoyarlos con los gastos de su hogar. Por tanto, viendo los resultados de su negocio, desea continuar y con las ganancias más algún préstamo futuro abrir una pollería cerca a su casa pues lo ve como una oportunidad de negocio ya que no hay ninguno de ese rubro por la zona. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero necesario para concretar sus planes. Además está a gusto con banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de sus productos para su negocio de frutas y arreglos de su casa, para acondicionar un espacio para un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Zulianita, 32, is a woman with many dreams and a strong desire to make progress based on her own efforts and being kind and courteous to people.  She lives with Fernando who works in transportation.  They have three children who are 16, 14 and 6 years of age who she loves very much.  They all live together comfortably in her own house.  The activity Zulianita does is selling regional fruit and fruit drinks in the morning.  To do so, she sets up a table in front of her house where she tends to her customers kindly and courteously.  She also works taking in laundry for her relatives and neighbors earning extra income this way.  She started her business with an MFP loan and to date has been managing it alone.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the profits it yields and because she’s the only one in the area with this type of business so she’s quite sought-after.

Before starting her business, she wanted to be a productive person and generate her own income to not depend completely on her spouse and to help him with household expenses.  Therefore, seeing the results her business is having, she wants to continue and with her profits and another future loan open a chicken shop near her house because she sees this as a new business opportunity since there are no businesses of this type in the area.

This will be MFP loan #2.  She’s happy to know that she can continue to rely on financial support needed to solidify her plans.  She’s also comfortable in her communal bank because she considers it to be a unified, supportive group.  She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy products for her fruit sales and to do some home improvements to set up the space for her new business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and building supplies.

loans.name: Bunyod

texts.ru:
Бунёд проживает в Яванском районе. Он женатый молодой человек. Ему 25 лет. Бунёд имеет среднее образование. Он уже несколько месяцев хочет заняться своим делом, работать таксистом. Чтобы начать работу ему необходимо купить автомашину. Как только Бунёд обратился в МКО "Хумо и Партнёры", и узнал, что может получить кредит по очень низким процентам он захотел получить кредит, и начать совою деятельность. 
Бунёд берет кредит для приобретения автомашины.
texts.en:
Bunyod lives in the Yavan district.  He is 25 years old, married, and has a high school education.  

For a few months already, he has been thinking of starting his own business and of working as a taxi driver.  In order to start working in this field, he needs to buy a car.  When Bunyod contacted MLO Humo and Partners, he realized that he could receive a loan with a very low interest rate, so he decided to apply for a loan and start his own business.  

Bunyod is taking a loan to purchase a car, so that he can start working.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
56-year-old Silvard lives in Arevadasht village of Armavir region with her son. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. More specifically, they own a plot of land where several kinds of vegetables are grown. Silvard and her son work hard in order to get a good harvest and then sell it in the local markets. 

As winter has come and they should wait for spring to sell their harvest, Silvard wants to expand her agricultural business and start raising pigs. For that she needs some financial support, so Silvard has applied for this loan. With the requested loan, she will purchase three pigs and forage for feeding them. With the help of her son, Silvard will work hard to raise the pigs and sell them for a higher price. This will significantly increase their income and they will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 54 лет, вдова, у Анаркан есть один сын который активно помогает ей в бизнесе. По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный, целеустремленный. Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Анаркан её бизнес очень хорошо развивается. Она занимается откормом с последующей реализацией скота. Начав этот бизнес в 2005 году с 3,000 KGS сейчас у неё имеется 10 голов овец, 1 теленок и две коровы. Ежемесячный доход Анаркан составляет 10,000 KGS Сом. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 100,000 KGS сом. На полученные средства она собирается закупить коров.Анаркан поделилась с нами что в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en: Anarkan is 54 years old.  She is a widow and she has a son who actively helps her in her business.  Anarkan is kind, calm and focused.  Thanks to her efforts and diligence, her business has grown nicely.  She feeds livestock for resale.  Having started this business in 2005 with 3,000 KGS, she now has ten sheep, one calf and two cows.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som.  On receiving the funds, she plans on buying cows.  Anarkan told us that her plans for the future include renovating her home and improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages three and six. His wife is working as a journalist. Three months ago Goran started his own business.  He opened a restaurant. He sells mostly grilled meat. He has a lot of experience, because for a long time he used to work for others, then after that he worked as a partner, and now he managed to open his own restaurant as a owner.  In his restaurant in addition to the Serbian community he also serves Albanians and other communities who live in Kosovo. He really enjoys what he does, since he has always liked to cook. He has many plans for his business, but for the time being, only wants to gather enough capital to expand it. 

The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy meat for his restaurant. Goran believes that the loan will help him to have more customers because he will have enough products to prepare different foods. In the future he hopes to hire another employee. His goal is to improve the living conditions for his family. 

Goran is very happy for the financial support that Kiva gives him, because this way he is certain of making progress in his work. He is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy meat for his restaurant

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en:
Joanes is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya and runs a food cafe which has been in business for three years and employs two other people. He is married and has two school going children. In this business he sells cooked food. He also owns a timber workshop.

Despite the challenge of perishability and lack of capital for expansion, Joanes aspires to own another larger business space from where he can sell the food. Joanes learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of food stuff such as  wheat/maize flour, rice, beans etc. He also desires to move to a new venue such as a carry out business, and establish a hotel in the future. 

Joanes believes the additional income from this loan will help him provide a good form of education for his children.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of food stuff such as wheat/maize flour, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be a disciplined woman. 

Miriam operates a retail stall where she sells "mabuyu" in the local name (baobab seed candy) and other confectionery items such as sweets, biscuits, crisps, etc. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Miriam will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by her five family members for lighting at night.
