Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. Previously, she took a loan of KES 30,000, which she paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. Amani owns a retail shop, a business that he has been running for five years. Amani began the business through the funds he received from his friends. In this shop, he sells paraffin, sugar, flour, etc. 

He learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. The main challenge is price fluctuations.   

Amani is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to purchase paraffin, sugar, flour, etc. for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve on his living standard. He aspires to own other centers and to plan for his children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin, sugar, flour, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Don Diego es una persona emprendedora, con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, el se define como una persona alegre, entusiasta y muy trabajador, Diego vive con sus dos hijos a los cuales les enseña valores que los engrandeceran como personas, diego se ha convertido en un ejemplo para sus hijos y para su comunidad ya que a base de trabajo y sacrificio ah logrado comprarse un bus de transporte rural.

El credito que Diego solicito a Fodemi es para invertir en la pintura del bus y en el arreglo mecánico del mismo, ya que es necesario y prioritario hacerlo para dar un buen servivio a sus clientes y mas que nada trasladarlos de manera segura un su bus.

El sueño que Diego tiene es seguir trabajando para lograr pagar toda la deuda de la compra del bus, y sentirse mas tranquilo para brindarles a sus hijos una buena educacion, diego sabe que la manera de cumplir su sueño es seguir trabajando con amor y agradecerle a Dios por cada dia que amanece con vida.
texts.en:
Diego is an enterprising person with a lot of will and desire to move himself and his family forward.  He is described as a happy, enthusiastic, and very hard-working person.  He lives with his two children, to whom he teaches values that will grow with them as they get older.  Diego has become an example for his children and for his community.  Through work and sacrifice he was able to buy a bus for rural transport.

The loan that Diego is requesting from FODEMI is to invest in a paint job and mechanical touch-up for the bus; this is necessary and he prioritizes to do it  in order to give a good service to his customers and more than anything, to transport them safely in his bus.

Diego's dream is to continue working in order to pay off the debt he has from buying the bus and to feel more calm in offering his children a good education.  Diego knows that the way to reach his dream is to continue working with love and thanks to God for every day that he wakes with life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of paint for the bus and in mechanical touch-ups, which is necessary to offer a good service to his clients.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba, une dame de la cinquantaine, est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait de la restauration depuis 4 ans et y associe aussi le commerce de divers produits. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et demande un troisième afin de pouvoir faire du commerce de draps de lits et de téléphones portables, qu’elle va revendre dans le voisinage. Bien qu’étant divorcée elle prend en charge les besoins de ses enfants et ses propres  besoins. Elle commence sa journée à 8h du matin pour la terminer à 13h. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle peut payer les frais scolaires et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. Dans l’avenir, elle veut avoir un grand restaurant à elle seule et disposer d’une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dieynaba, a 50-something woman, is divorced and the mother of two children. She has been working in the food services industry for four years and also sells various products. She has already benefited from two loans and is requesting a third in order to be able to sell bed linens and cell phones, which she will resell in her neighborhood. Since she is divorced, Mrs. Dieynaba sees to the needs of her children and her own needs. She begins her day at 8am and finishes at 1pm.

With the profits from her business, Mrs. Dieynaba can pay the school fees and improve the dietary conditions of the family. In the future, she wants to have a large restaurant on her own and be financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and bed linens to resell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además es amable y sociable sabiendo ganarse el aprecio de las personas con su carisma. Es conviviente con Maijo quien mototaxista y padre de sus 3 hijos de 15,14 y 11 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa que construyeron con sus esfuerzos. La actividad que realiza Estela es la costura oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional de  joven, pero a la cual no se dedicaba sino hace más de 10 que retomó recién su oficio. Iniciándose con una máquina y en la actualidad cuenta con más de 02 máquinas de coser para diferentes acabados brindando trabajos bien realizados a sus clientes que salen satisfechos y la recomiendan con otras personas. También vende ropas que compra en la capital o que ella elabora, teniendo en su negocio un espacio donde exhibe sus productos.
Estas actividades las realiza desde su casa, a donde llegan sus clientes y los atiende amablemente.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene sus productos, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola, pero en ocasiones le apoya su hija que está aprendiendo a coser.
Decidió empezar con su actividad  ya que dejo su empleo y necesitaba de un oficio para generar ingresos económicos, además de la solicitud de sus vecinas al ver sus buenos acabados en la costura. Pero ya por edad le resulta algo cansado estar en una misma postura para coser, por eso con las ganancias desea invertir en una bodega de abarrotes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos y otros, todos estos materiales piensa traer desde la capital buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Estela is 40 years old, she is a hardworking and diligent woman with the drive to get ahead in life, who is kind and sociable and knows how to gain the esteem of the people around her with her charisma. She lives with her partner, Maijo who is a motorcycle taxi driver and a father to her 3 children of 15, 14 and 11 years of age. They live together comfortably in their own home that they built with their hard work. Estela works as a seamstress, a trade that she learned by studying in an occupational educational center as a young woman and has only recently returned to her work after a 10 year absence. She began with a sewing machine and at present has more than two machines for different finishes and her customers are satisfied and highly recommend her to other people. She also sells clothing that she buys in the capital or that she makes and has a space in her business to display her products.

Estela works from her home where her customers visit and she cares for them very nicely.

She considers her business to be very profitable by the money she earns and the demand she has for her products. At present she works alone but sometimes her daughter helps her as she is learning to sew as well.

Estela decided to start her job since she left her previous one and needed someway to have some income she also had the demand from her neighbors who saw her work. However her age is a factor since it is a bit tiring being in the same position while sewing which is why with her earnings she hopes to invest in a small grocery store. This will be her first loan with MFP and hopes for a small loan to be able to meet her goals. She notes that she is happy with her communal bank since she knows its members and considers them to be very united.

With the loan of 600 nuevos soles, Estela will use the money to buy sewing materials like fabrics, threads, elastic, and other items that will be bought from the capital as she looks for cheaper wholesale prices.

loans.use: buy sewing materials like fabrics, threads, elastic, and other items.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, de 31 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, alegre y carismática.
Es conviviente  con Marco Antonio  quien es transportista, fruto de esa unión tienen 2 hijos; Cristian de 14 años y Cristel de 8 años de edad respectivamente, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad la cual lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo. El negocio que tiene Alejandrina es la venta de comidas rápidas, como salchipapas, pollo brosther  y otros,  que lo realiza de lunes a viernes por las noches, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, instalándose en el frontis  de la casa de su hermana con un carrito de salchipapa, una mesa y algunas sillas. 
Realiza éste negocio  hace más de 4 años,  iniciándose con un capital propio y hasta el momento viene atendiendo ella sola, atendiendo de manera amable y cordial. 
Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues logra vender todo los que prepara a diario gracias a la acogida que tiene con sus clientes.
Le gusta que el lugar donde vende es transitado, además le gusta cocinar aprendió de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. No le gusta el cansancio físico ya que tienen que levantarse muy de temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio.
Por eso desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar las mesas y sillas donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Este es el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el crédito recibido para continuar con su negocio, desea seguir contando con más créditos,  por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera a sus miembros ser personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de un carrito salchipapero la cual está valorizada en 600 nuevos soles y con el saldo comprará víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas en mayores cantidades y a bajos costos, de esa manera espera tener mayor acogida de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 31, is hard working, determined, happy and charismatic. She’s in a common-law relationship with Marco Antonio who is a transport driver. Together, they have 2 children: 14-year-old Cristian and 8 year-old Cristel. They live in their own house which they were able to buy after much effort. Alejandrina is in the fast food business, selling sausage and French fries, roast chicken and other foods. She works Monday to Friday in the evenings, very kindly attending her clients whom she receives and fulfills their demand. She is located in front of her sister’s house with her sausage and French fries cart, a table and a few chairs. 
She’s had this business for more than 4 years. She started it with her own capital and until now has been running her business alone, being kind and cordial to clients. 
She considers her business to be profitable because of the earnings she’s made, as she sells everything she’s prepared every day thanks to her customer service.
She likes that her location is a high-traffic area. She enjoys cooking and learned her mother’s secrets for good seasonings. She enjoys her income as it allows her to pay her bills and household expenses. Although she is physically exhausted from waking up so early to prepare the day, she doesn’t let that deter her as she continues running her business.
That’s why she wants to expand her business. She’d like to add tables and chairs in order to attend clients in a more comfortable setting. 
This is her 6th loan with the MFP communal bank. She is grateful for the loans she has received to continue running her business. She’d like to count on more loans and that’s why she promises to be punctual with her payments. She feels comfortable with the communal bank and considers the members to be persons who are united and committed to their obligations.  
With the loan of 2000 Peruvian soles, she’ll invest in buying a sausage and French fry cart for 600 Peruvian soles and the rest will go to buying supplies and ingredients to prepare foods in large quantities and at low costs. With that, she hopes she can welcome more clients.

loans.use: buy supplies and ingredients to prepare foods in large quantities.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo, tiene 25 años, es un joven padre de familia muy amable, sencillo, trabajador y con la vitalidad que le impulsa a seguir adelante en el logro de sus metas, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su conviviente Mariela de 19 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, Ken de 4 y Andrea de 1 año de edad respectivamente, es por ellos que a diario trabaja arduamente ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Gustavo consiste en la compra y venta de pescado fresco, realiza ésta actividad desde hace 6 años con ayuda de 2 colaboradores quienes se encargan de apoyarlo en la selección, traslado y venta de los pescados, así puede mantener a su familia tranquila y brindándoles lo que necesita, su constante animo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocido, ya que él vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es un vendedor muy alegre, que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa, además alquila un mototaxi el cual le proporciona un ingreso adicional o en ocasiones el mismo lo maneja por las tardes, al principio le fue muy complicado adaptarse a la rutina porque no conocía bien el negocio, pero con el pasar del tiempo empezó a consolidarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas, considera que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que emana de los pescados, ya que este se le impregna en la ropa y el cuerpo, a pesar de ellos espera tener en el futuro un vehículo acondicionado que le permita transportar y conservar sus productos frescos por mucho más tiempo. Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/.1000), comprar pescados de diferentes especies y de los mejores tamaños para continuar vendiéndolos; por otro lado dará mantenimiento al vehículo que usa en su trabajo comprando algunas piezas y pagando al mecánico que le hará el trabajo.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 25, is a young father and very nice, modest, hardworking, and excited about reaching his goals. He lives is his parents´ home with his life partner Mariela, 19, and their two beloved children, 4-year-old Ken and one-year-old Andrea. They work hard each day to offer their children a better life. Gustavo sells fresh fish, work he has been doing with two partners for six years. They select, transport, and sell the seafood, and they are able to support their families this way. His desire to be successful encouraged him to get started, and slowly he has become known for selling the freshest and most delicious fish in the area. He is a happy vendor who always greets his customers with a smile.

He also rents a motor taxi to earn extra income, and some afternoons he is the driver. This was complicated at first because he had to adjust his schedule for an unfamiliar business; however, over time he has begun to make it work. He loves talking with his customers, but putting up with the smell of the fish is hard because it stays on your clothes and skin. Someday he hopes to have an air conditioned vehicle to transport and to keep his products fresher longer. 

This is his fifth loan cycle with MFP,  and he thanks the institution for the opportunity and confidence in him. He promises to make his payments on time. He is also pleased to belong to his communal bank because he has seen that the members are unified and responsible. With the loan of (S/.1000), he will buy different types and the largest fish to sell. He will also buy some replacement parts and pay a mechanic to repair the vehicle he uses for work.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 29 años, es una mujer amable y muy buena, trabaja mucho ya que desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo de 02 años y 08 meses, convive con Ricardo de 40 años y con el trabaja mucho para poder salir adelante, vive en casa de sus padres ya que está en proceso de comprar una casa propia. El trabajo de Margarita consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, para esto se compró un vehículo de segundo uso a bajo costo con un préstamo que recibió de MFP hace algunos meses, todos los días lo alquila a un chofer a cambio de un pago diario establecido como trato. Además, gracias al optimismo que siempre demostró y a su afán por superarse día a día a pudo comprarse hace algunos años un taxi que también alquila como vehículo de servicio de transporte público por las principales calles de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad 3 años y gracias a este trabajo su economía ha mejorado y  ha podido solucionar algunas carencias que antes existía en su hogar.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo como dueña de su vehículos, es que le permite generar sus ingresos económicos en la comodidad de su hogar, lo más difícil para ella es tener que madrugar para cumplir con los horarios de salida, a pesar de ello comprende que a mediano plazo cosechará los mejores frutos de su esfuerzo, más adelante espera comprar otro mototaxi y seguir en el camino del progreso. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000), comprará algunos repuestos y mandará su vehículo al taller automotriz para su revisión y refacción general.
texts.en: Margarita is 29 years old. She is a kind and good woman who works a lot because she wants to provide a better quality of life for her son, who is 2 years and 8 months old. She is in a domestic partnership with Ricardo, 40 years old, and together they work hard so that they can improve. She lives in her parents’ house while she is in the process of buying her own home. Margarita rents a motorcycle taxi for a living. She bought this second-hand motorcycle for a low price with a loan she got from MFP a few months ago. She rents it out to a driver every day and in exchange charges a daily fee. Thanks to her permanent optimism and desire to excel, she bought a taxi a few years ago, which she also rents out as a public transportation vehicle used in the main streets of the city. Margarita has been doing this for 3 years and thanks to this activity her finances have improved and she could meet some of the needs she had at home. What she likes best about her business as a vehicle owner is that it allows her to generate income from home. The hardest part is having to wake up very early to get the day started, but she understands that in the medium term she will have the best results from her effort. She hopes to buy another motorcycle taxi later on and continue improving. This is the 8th loan she takes from the MFP. Margarita is very happy to know that she has financial support because she can confidently continue her work. Again, she is committed to making the payments on time, as she did before with previous loans. She is also very happy to be part of the communal bank, since all its members are very responsible and help each other out. The amount requested (S/ 2000) will be used to buy parts and to send the vehicle to a repair shop for a full check-up and update.

loans.use: To buy parts for the motorcycle and take it to the repair shop

loans.name: Michael Elizabeth

texts.es: Michael de 28 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de 7 años, originaria de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Chinandega es un lugar con gente muy acogedora, trabajadora, responsables. La actividad económica de  Michael es brindar servicio de costura, desde hace 5 años que desempeña dicha actividad. La cual inicio por  la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su pequeño hijo. Por falta de fuentes de trabajo fijas. El negocio consiste en elaborar prendas de vestir  variadas como camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos,  juegos de cama, piyamas de niños. Michael necesita el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar material de costura como: sedinas, telas, carretes, agujas, encajes, botones, forros, cintas, aceite, carretes. Michael es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable  con ganas de superación personal el cual lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores con el cumplimiento de sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Michael agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Michael is 28 years old and a single mother with a 7-year-old child. She is from Chinandega, a place located in the western part of the country. Chinandega is a place with people who are very welcoming, hard-working and responsible. Michael's economic activity is providing tailoring services. She has done this work for 5 years. She started it because of the need to have a source of income to support her small child, due to the lack of sources of steady work. In her business, she makes a range of garments such as shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, nightgowns and children's pajamas. Michael needs the loan to invest in working capital, buying tailoring supplies such as satin, fabrics, spools of thread, needles, lace, buttons, linings, ribbons, and oil. Michael is a very hard-working and responsible woman with a desire to grow as a person. She has demonstrated this in her previous loans, with the fulfillment of her payments on time and in the right form. Michael is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people with few resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can find ways to make a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy materials for her work such as satin, fabrics, spools of thread, needles, lace, buttons, linings, ribbons, and oil.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Eva has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a devoted mother with the desire and the urge to move forward. She always strives to reach success since she knows that it is through hard work that she will reach it. Fatuma is grateful for the support she received and that she is receiving now. Since the previous loan, her living standards have greatly improved. Her goal is to have a prosperous life and see that her children become professionals. She says that she was able to open a retail shop recently, which she plans to expand. It is for this reason that she is requesting this loan to add to her stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sodas, snacks, among other instant goods.

loans.use: to add to her stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sodas, snacks, among other instant goods.

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa is fifty five years old. He is married and the father of two children, one boy and one girl, ages seventeen and nineteen years old. For a long time Nebojsa has worked in agriculture business. His wife is a teacher in a primary school. They all live in a minority community of Kosovo. To earn a living, Nebojsa works the agricultural land with his tractor for the others and for his land. 
Now Nebosa needs a loan for his tractor to repair his motor engine and to buy a seeder machine. The loan will help him to continue his business, which brings him a lot of profit. He said he can also save the money from this business for his family's future. He hopes in the future to involve his son to help him so that he won't have to pay for outside help. His goal is to have better living conditions for his family.
Nebojsa wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to repair his tractor motor engine and to buy a seeder machine.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 46-year-old married man. He is a father to three sons and one daughter; all of them are school students. Issam is a taxi driver who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay for education expenses.
Issam wants to improve his family's home living conditions, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture and bedroom furniture for his children in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Issam and his family comfortable and suitable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.
Issam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a green grocer that she has been operating for seven years. In this business, Rehema sells vegetables like tomatoes, kale, etc. She began the business through the savings she had made from casual jobs.
Rehema learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations, inflation, and purchasing stock.
Rehema is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to buy vegetable in wholesale, such as cabbages, tomatoes, bananas, carrots, pepper, onions, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase a piece of land and build a residential house in addition to helping educate her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, bananas, carrots, pepper, onions, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 37, is a single mother. Her two children are between the ages of 13 and 20; they live with their mother in the Congo Town community and are currently in school. Victoria stopped her education in the eleventh grade. She is a hardworking mother who has been operating a restaurant for the past 6 years. She sells six days a week, ten hours every day. 

She prepares palm butter, cassava leaves, palava sauce (a type of stew), fufu (starchy dumplings), and soup made from cassava. She makes profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her children. She purchases her goods from the general market and transports them by commercial vehicle.

She thanks the lenders for empowering her in her business, because with the business she feels self reliant. She is requesting this loan to purchase more ingredients for her business. Her dreams is to have a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Mame Coumba est une femme mariée qui vit au Sénégal.  Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et pratique  la  vente d’habillement depuis plus de 4 ans.  Elle achète des habits   d’enfants, des  sacs, de  chaussure pour les  revendre à sa clientèle.  Les revenus  qu’elle gagne de son activité  lui permettent de supporter les charges de sa famille avec  et aussi d’entretenir son  enfant.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 350,000 frs prévu pour augmenter son  fonds de roulement dans le but d’acquérir des produits  supplémentaires. Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité et disposer d’un grand magasin de vente d’habillement d’enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Coumba is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She participates in the business sector and has been practicing the sale of clothing for more than four years. She purchases children's clothing, bags, and shoes to resell them to her customers. The profits she earns from her business allow her to assume her family expenses and also to care for her child.

Mrs. Mame Coumba is seeking a loan of 350,000CFA francs intended to increase her working capital, with the goal of purchasing additional products. Her goal is to better grow her business and to have a large shop selling children's clothing.

loans.use: To purchase bags, shoes, and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Dina Maria

texts.es: Dina María de 53 años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Dina se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Dina tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 32 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se venden productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de champoo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leña, leche, huevos, detergentes, jabón, tiste. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener fuente de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.  Dina María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Dina María, 53, is married with 2 children who are independent. She’s from the Chinandega department, an area located in the west of the country. Dina is a hard-working, responsible woman with the desire to succeed. Dina has been running a corner store business from her house for the last 32 years. In her corner store, she sells daily consumption products in small quantities like, coffee, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, firewood, milk, eggs, detergents, soap and tiste (a refreshing beverage made of toasted corn, cacoa, annatto and sugar). The business came out of needing a source of income to help with the household expenses. The object of the loan is to invest it in business capital and stock her store in order to generate more income. Dina María is grateful for the help Kiva investors offer those of few resources -- and poor countries like Nicaragua -- so that they can have a dignified work environment.

loans.use: invest in business capital and stock her store with products of daily consumption like coffee, shampoo, rice, beans, sugar, firewood, milk, eggs, detergents, soap and tiste (a refreshing beverage made of toasted corn, cacoa, annatto and sugar).

loans.name: Wilser

texts.es:
Wilser de 21 años, un joven con mucho talento y dedicación forma parte de una familia cuyos padres siempre dieron lo mejor de si para su futuro.
A su corta edad es poseedor de una vivienda a base de madera. Optó desde joven instruirse en la rama de mecánica automotriz llegando a culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente.
Viene 1 año laborando en una mecánica cuyo propietario es su tío llegando a ser de gran ayuda su aporte como practicante.
Es considerado por muchas personas un joven emprendedor y de confianza, motivo por el cual muchos conductores de la zona le confían su vehiculo para los servicios que el brinda.
Hasta el momento siente que es su vocación y espera seguir aprendiendo lo necesario.
Para el normal desempeño de su actividad debe contar con herramientas de calidad así como repuestos menores para ser usados de manera inmediata puesto que al proveedor directa e inmediatamente logra generarle ganancias extras.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a ser propietario de un taller y darle oportunidad a otros jóvenes que se iniciaron como el esperando así formar una familia a la cual pueda brindarle lo mejor a través de su abnegada labor. Requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de algunas herramientas como desarmadores, llave maestra y repuestos menores.
texts.en:
Wilser is a 21-year-old young man with a great deal of talent and dedication. He comes from a family with parents who always did their best for their children's futures. At his young age, he already owns a house made of wood. He chose early on to educate himself in the field of auto mechanics, managing to succeed in completing his studies.

He has been working in his uncle's auto mechanics shop for one year, and his contribution as a mechanic has become a great help.

Wilser is considered by many to be an enterprising and trustworthy young man, which is why many drivers in the area trust him him to service their vehicles. So far, he feels that being a mechanic is his calling and he hopes to keep learning what he needs to know.

In order to perform his everyday work, he needs to have quality tools as well as replacement parts on hand for immediate use, given that as a direct supplier he can immediately generate extra earnings.
 
His future plan is to own his own mechanic's shop and offer opportunities to other young people like him who are just getting started. He hopes to build a family that he can provide for through his selfless labor. He needs to have 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) for the purchase of some tools like screwdrivers, a master wrench, and replacement parts.

loans.use: to purchase tools like screwdrivers, a master wrench, and spare parts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, a 54-year-old mother of five children, two of whom are are in school, has been fattening pigs in the Philippines for 10 years. Having received and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF, she has requested a new one for PHP 20000 loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ciciliah

texts.en:
Ciciliah is married and she has 3 children. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Ciciliah operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a viable business environment and her primary customers are local residents. Ciciliah describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

Ciciliah will use this KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to be used by her five family members for lighting at night. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Ciciliah previously took out a loan of KES 50,000, which she repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Viliginie

texts.en: Viliginie, aged 41, is married and has three children aged between 7 and 10, all attending school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past 20 years. The loan requested will be used to buy more beans to sell. Viliginie will use the profits from the business to pay the children's school fees and to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: Anani est un jeune homme  marié et  âgé de 29 ans. Il est père d’un enfant de 01 an non encore scolarisé. Il a démarré son  activité qui consiste à l’achat et à la revente des produits de rafraichissement ‘‘Fan Milk’’ en 2010. Il dispose d’une boutique où il  emploie une personne pour l’aider dans son activité. Il sollicite son second prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter des produits laitiers. il voudrait une deuxième boutique et assurer l'auto suffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Anani is a young man, married and 29 years old. He is the father of a one-year-old child who does not yet attend school. He began his business, which consists of purchasing and reselling "Fan Milk" refreshment products, in 2010. He has a shop where he employs one person to help him with his business.

Anani is seeking his second loan from WAGES to purchase dairy products. He would like a second shop and to ensure the family's dietary self-sufficiency.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products.

loans.name: Candida Del Rosario

texts.es: Cándida de 53 años de edad, soltera sin hijos, ella es originaria de Chichigalpa, lugar que se encuentra en la zona de occidente del país. Chichigalpa es un lugar que se caracteriza por sus ingenios de caña de azúcar, el cultivo de la caña. Cándida tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general que consisten en vender productos como pantalones, faldas, vestidos, camisetas, camisolines, ropa interior, ropa de cama, piyamas. Cándida se ha caracterizado por ser trabajadora, responsable de buenas costumbre, buena paga en tiempo y forma. El negocio lo distribuye de forma ambulante, la rutina diaria de Cándida es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias, bajo el intenso sol, con un bulto de unos 20 kg donde lleva sus productos a ofrecer a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir negocio para ofrecer mejor servicios a sus clientes. Cándida agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Cándida is 53 years old, single and has no children.  She is a native of Chichigalpa, an area in the west of the Nicaragua.  Chichigalpa is known for its sugar cane factories and crops.  Cándida's business is selling general merchandise, such as pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, camisoles, undergarments, bed clothing and pajamas.  Cándida is known for being hardworking, responsible and for having good habits.  She repays her loans on time.  Cándida sells her merchandise on foot.  Her days consist of working ten hours under an intense sun carrying about 20kg. of merchandise.  She sells to both established and occasional customers.  The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock up her business and offer a better service to her customers.  Cándida is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are offering to low-income people from poor countries, like Nicaragua, so that they can earn a dignified living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her business by purchasing merchandise like pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, camisoles, undergarments, bed clothes and pajamas.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina  de 48 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de 22,26 años  originaria del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Rosalina es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Rosalina tiene por actividad económica un cafetín es un lugar específico de la localidad. El negocio consiste en vender refresco, gaseosa, café, repostería, sanguches, pizza. Tiene 6 años de experiencia en el negocio. El negocio inicio con un poco de ahorros propios y por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Rosalina ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, el objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles como: pan, gaseosas, jugos, mortadelas, reposterías, café, piza. Rosalina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 48 years old, is a single mother with two sons, who are 22 and 26. She is a native of the department of Chinandega, a place located in the western part of the country.

Rosalinda is a hardworking, responsible woman who is eager to succeed. She has a small café in a specific area where she sells soft drinks, coffee, pastries, sandwiches and pizza. She has had her business for six years and started it with a few of her own savings because of the need to have a means of helping with household expenses.

Rosalinda has already worked with Fundación León and has demonstrated her sense of responsibility by making her payments in full and on time. The objective of her current loan is to invest working capital in her business by buying food products such as bread, soft drinks, juices, bologna, pastries, coffee and pizza. She is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to poor countries such as Nicaragua and to people with scarce resources so that they will have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in her cafe by buying food such as bread, soft drinks, juices, bologna, pastries, coffee and pizza

loans.name: Pianika Group

texts.en:
Rinawati is a leader group of 8 people, called Pianika. They live in Jatinegara in the East part of Jakarta. Rinawati is 37 years old and married, but her husband passed away.  Rinawati has one child who is already in college now. She also has one adult dependent, and her cousins live together with them.

Rinawati has a kiosk in front of her house in which she sells some kinds of instant drinks. She started her business 1 year ago. At first, she only sold some sachets, but now she can sell almost 1200 sachets a week. From this income she can pay for electricity, school fees, and her family's  daily needs.

Rinawati and the other members of the Pianika group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the second time so that they can increase their working capital. Rinawati will use it to buy items like chocolate chips, sugar, cheese, and cookies to sell in addition to her instant drinks. She has a dream to see her child work in the embassy.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, chocolate chips, and cheese.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 44-year-old married man with no children yet. He is employed and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all of his expenses. Khaled is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Khaled and his wife comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar, 42 years old, is married and has two daughters. He has been a farmer for 16 years. He produces milk and trefoil (a forage plant), selling them at the local market. He plans to specialize in dairy farming in the next several years.

Alasgar's eldest daughter is getting married. He is requesting a loan from VFAC for 1,200 AZN, which he will use to purchase dotal property for her. Dotal property is property which the wife brings in order to assist the husband with the marriage expenditure.

loans.use: To purchase dotal property for his daughter

loans.name: Shahab Group

texts.en:
The Shahab group consists of 6 women who live in Aden, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 280,000 YER.

Hadia, 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. She owns a small house which she would like to renovate. Hadia has applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to own a big house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Darwin Enrique

texts.es:
Darwin Enrique tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el el recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Darwin Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. Con el credito podra comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El credito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño comprar un solar para construir una casa para algun dia casarse y tener un hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta descarnsaar y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Darwin Enrique, 23, is single and has no children. He lives together with his parents in a village called El Jobo, located in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. He is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Jerusalén, located in El Jobo. He works both in agriculture and in stockbreeding.

Darwin Enrique grows corn and rice. With the loan, he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost and insecticides to prevent plagues and diseases. He will buy these supplies in the city of Ventanas.

The loan has helped him to increase his income and improve his plantations. His dream is to buy land to build a house, and some day get married and have children. During his free time he likes to rest and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost and insecticides to prevent plagues and diseases in his crops.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene de 34 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad de 18,16 años, los cuales están estudiando. Ella es originaria de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país,  la  Sra. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, de buenas costumbres, esta mujer tiene por actividad económica venta de mercadería en general como pantalones, faldas, vestidos camisas, ropa interior zapatos, perfumes, cosméticos, y también tiene un gimnasio en su casa de habitación. Tiene 12 años de tener el negocio. el cual lo realiza de forma ambulante ofreciendo su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales cargando diariamente un bulto de unos 20 kg. Ya que hasta hoy ha sido su forma de vida. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir  en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio  para satisfacer a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. Marlene agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recurso y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Marlene is 34 years old and the single mother of two dependent children.  Her children are 18 and 16 years old and go to school.  Marlene is a native of Chinandega, which is in the west of Nicaragua.  Marlene is known for being a hardworking, responsible woman who has good habits.  Her business is selling general merchandise, like pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, undergarments, shoes, perfumes and cosmetics.  She also has a gym in her home.  This has been her business for twelve years.  She sells her products on foot to both regular and occasional customers.  She carries about 20 kg. of merchandise daily.  This has been her way of life up until now.  The object of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock up her business to the satisfaction of her regular and occasional customers.  Marlene is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders are offering to low-income people from poor countries, like Nicaragua, so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital by purchasing merchandise for re-sale, like pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, undergarments, shoes, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Saxavat

texts.en:
Saxavat is 46 years old. He is married. Saxavat has a child. He is an internally displaced person (someone forced to flee their home, but who remains in their native country) from Fizuli town. Now he lives in the Baku region. 

Saxavat has been in the poultry business for five years. He needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) loan to buy chickens and ducks to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks for his poultry business.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad, 29 years old, is married and has one child. He is a youth client from Iraq. Muhammad is the only provider for his family. He is a librarian. Muhammad established his business in 2006. He has developed good experience in this field, is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Muhammad is requesting a $3,000 youth loan to pay the bookstore's yearly rent and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and to increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the bookstore's yearly rent and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is a 21-year-old single man who has been working as an electrician since 2009. He is well known in the region with his special talent and good quality of work. Eddy is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for his engagement expenses. He is very anxious to take this step forward and hopes it will be a good luck sign for future improvements and developments.

This is Eddy's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he has a good standing repayment history. His previous loan helped him greatly to increase his tools and income at the same time. Eddy is willing to keep on improving his business and to open a special electrician services company in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his engagement expenses

loans.name: Vivianne

texts.en: Vivianne is 40 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past three years. She has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs, such as bananas and sorghum. With the profits from the business, Vivianne will make savings and pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale, such as bananas and sorghum.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad, casada con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, 13,20 años los cuales están estudiando. Ella es originaria de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Maria se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer luchadora, honrada, trabajadora lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores en cuanto a su forma de pago en tiempo y forma. Maria tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consisten en vender productos como pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, camisolas, vestidos, cosméticos, zapatos. El negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante, desde hace 16 años que desempeña dicha actividad. La rutina de  maria es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias bajo el intenso sol con un bulto de unos 20  kg para poder ganarse la vida y el sustento de sus hijos. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para satisfacer a sus clientes  y mejorar sus ingresos y aprovechar la temporada navideña. Maria agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María, 45, is married and takes care of two children, ages 13 and 20, who are students.  She's from Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  María's known for being an honest and hardworking woman and a fighter.  She has shown this in her previous loans by repaying them punctually.

María's job is selling general merchandise, which consists of products such as pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, shirts, dresses, cosmetics, and shoes.  She works as a street vendor and has been doing this job for 16 years.  María's routine for earning a living to support her children is to work about 10 hours a day in the intense sun with a package that weighs some 20 kilograms.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business to satisfy her customers, improve her income, and take advantage of the Christmas season.

María's grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have decent jobs.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri is a very hard-working woman and a member of Focus Women's Group, a group under VEP. Njeri wishes to purchase a biodigester. Currently she has four cows that produces milk and a vegetable kiosk at her community trading center. She supplies milk to a nearby tea factory and her church every Sunday.

She is very determined to construct a biodigester to reduce her reliance on expensive and dangerous kerosene when cooking. With income from her milk and vegetable businesses, she will have no trouble paying off her loan.

loans.use: To purchase a biodigester

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham, who appears in the picture, is a 25-year-old, married man. He is a father to one son. Adham is employed and gets a small salary which is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Adham is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the cost of purchasing a refrigerator and an oven for his house. Taking this loan will facilitate Adham's family's living conditions in their house.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. 

In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see in fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. 

As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and an oven for his home.

loans.name: Edwin Marbely

texts.es:
El señor Edwin tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, reside en compañía de su madre en una comunidad del Municipio de La Morazán, Departamento de Yoro.
Edwin Anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajar como jornalero asalariado,  desde hace 8 años se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y renta de pastos. 
En este momento ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 7,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra en la producción de 2 manzanas del cultivo de maíz.
El espera obtener buenas ganancias que le permitan ampliar el área de cultivo en la siguiente cosecha.
texts.en: Edwin, 26, is single living with his mother in a community in La Morazán municipality, Yoro Department.  Edwin used to work as a salaried day laborer but for the last 8 years had been growing basic grains and renting out pastureland.  At the moment, he’s asking for a 7,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to plant two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of corn.  He hopes to earn good profits that will make it possible for him to enlarge his planted area for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria  con su anterior crédito compró hilos, botones telas cuellos puños broches y felpa  y respondió oportunamente a los pedidos y eso fue gracias a Kiva. Maria dice a sus financiadores que gracias pues con su apoyo están apoyando a muchas familias a construir un mejor futuro. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito, con el cual comprará materiales para elaborar muñecos de felpa que le han pedido sus clientes, para acompañar los regalos de navidad de sus hijas; así mismo comprará una fileteadora para mejorar los tiempos productivos y perfeccionar la calidad de sus productos.  Con ello aumentará su capital de trabajo y estará adquiriendo mayores ingresos en época de fiesta, para hacer las celebraciones de las festividades navideñas que llegan con muchos regalos para su familia.
texts.en: With her previous loan Maria bought thread, buttons, fabric, collars, cuffs, clasps and plush. She met her orders in a timely fashion and that was because of Kiva. Maria gives thanks to her lenders, because with their support they're helping several families to build a better future. She's currently requesting a new loan which she'll use to purchase supplies for making plush dolls that her customers have ordered as an addition to their daughters' Christmas gifts. She'll also purchase a filleting machine so she can improve production time and perfect the quality of her products. That way she'll increase her working capital and obtain better profits during this holiday season, so that she can celebrate the approaching Christmas festivities with many presents for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and sewing materials.

loans.name: Ericka De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ericka de 36 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 17,9 años de edad, del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en  la zona de occidente del país. Ericka es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, de buena costumbre. La Sra. Ya ha trabajado con fundación  León 2000 y ha demostrado su responsabilidad  de pago en tiempo y forma. Ericka tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, y en uno de los mercados de la localidad tiene dos años de tener el negocio. El negocio consiste en vender productos como leche en bolsa, queso amarillo, cuajada, leche agria, mantequilla, queso. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar queso al por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de diciembre. Ericka agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Ericka, 36, is married and has two children who are 17 and 9 years of age; she lives in Chinandega Department, a place in the west of the country.  Ericka is a very hardworking, responsible woman of good habits.  She’s been working with Fundación León 2000 and has shown her responsibility making her payments on time as scheduled.  Ericka’s economic activity is selling dairy products, a business located at home and in one of the local markets.  She’s been in business two years.  It consists in selling products like bags of milk, yellow cheese, milk curd, buttermilk, butter and cheese.  The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital to buy cheese at wholesale to take advantage of December sales.  Ericka is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified ways of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is a single, 25-year-old, female living with her entire family in the southern part of Kosovo. She has been running a boutique since 2010. She sells mostly men’s clothes of different styles. 

Emine's business is going very well. She has many customers that like her boutique and this helps her to make a profit. In the beginning, she started with low sales and now she has increased her capacity. At the moment, she is running the business alone, but she hopes to hire an employee in the future.

The boutique is usually open Monday through Saturday. However, Emine extends her schedule, when needed. Emine is requesting a loan to buy a larger variety of men's clothes for the winter collection, such as jeans and sweaters to sell, so as to meet her customers' needs. 

Emine's goal is to further expand her business. She is thinking of adding different men’s clothes in order to have more customers and to increase her income. She hopes to own a big boutique shop in the future and to get married soon. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy men's clothes, such as jeans and sweaters, for her boutique.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 29 years old. She is married, with two children. She sells charcoal and has spent six years in the business. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fausto Jose

texts.es: Fausto, tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Don Fausto desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva ya 25 años de hacer sus propios cultivos de maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local del municipio.  El tiene actualmente un cultivo de maíz de dos manzanas de terreno y quiere sacar buenas cosechas, para ello ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras, con los cuales va comprar fertilizantes y pago de limpieza del maíz. Este préstamo le ayudara a capitalizarse para dar un buen mantenimiento al cultivo y obtener buenas ganancias de la cosecha. Sus planes es cultivar más área cada vez con la ayuda de Dios, de ODEF y de Kiva para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Fausto, 58, is married and has three children; he lives in Morazán municipality, Yoro.  Fausto has worked in agriculture since he was very young; he’s been growing his own corn and bean crops for 25 years and he sells them in the local municipal market.  He currently is growing two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of corn and he wants to get good harvests.  To do so, he’s decided to request a 7,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer and pay to weed the corn fields.  This loan will help him inject capital to provide good crop care and earn good profits from the harvest.  His plan is to cultivate more land each time with God’s, ODEF’s and KIVA’s help to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to provide corn crop maintenance.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Doña Fabiola es sin duda un ejemplo para la comunidad de Cotacachi, a sus 36 años sigue trabajando airosa y siempre con una sonrisa la cual le ha caracterizado durante toda su vida. Ella tiene 4 hijos pero actualmente, a los cuales le enseña el valor del trabajo y enseña valores espirituales que les ayudaran a ser mejores personas.

El crédito que doña Fabiola solicito a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de consumo masivo como arroz, azucar, papas, aceite, para luego venderlos en la tienda que tiene, esta es una oportunidad de crecer y de salir a adelante para poder ayudar a su esposo en las necesidades que tiene su familia.

El sueño que la Sra. Fabiola tiene es la de ver junta a toda su familia que las enseñanzas que dio a sus hijos ellos los den a los suyos, sueña con comprarse una casa y ponerse ahí un supermercado para que la gente de su comunidad no vaya a la ciudad sino ahí haga sus compras. Sabe que el único medio para cumplir su sueño es el trabajo y la unión familiar que ella ha mantenido durante toda su vida.
texts.en:
Fabiola is undoubtedly a role model for the community of Cotacachi. At age 36, she keeps on working gracefully, always with the smile she has been known for her entire life. She has four children whom she teaches the value of work and the spiritual values that will help them become better people.
The loan that Fabiola has requested from Fodemi will be used to purchase products of mass consumption such as rice, sugar, potatoes and olive oil for selling in the store she owns. This is an opportunity for her to grow and get ahead so that she can help her husband afford the things her family needs.
Fabiola's dream is to see all of her family together and that her children may teach their own children what she has taught them. She dreams of buying a house and setting up a supermarket, so that people from her community can shop there instead of going into town. She knows that the only way to achieve her dream is to work and to keep a united family as she has done her entire life.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (rice, sugar, olive oil, butter) for selling in her store.

loans.name: G.s.montiel Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Montiel está conformado por cinco integrantes cuatro mujeres y un hombre, todos con familias y responsable de 12 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios de  Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Este grupo se caracteriza por tener integrantes trabajadores, responsables. Reyna es la coordinadora del grupo solidario la cual se encarga del cumplimiento de sus integrantes en cuanto a las cuotas en tiempo y forma. Reyna tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general  la cual consiste en vender pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, toallas, juegos  de camas, zapatos, cosméticos. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes fijos y eventuales y aprovechar la temporada navideña. El grupo solidario Montiel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Montiel” communal bank has five members, four women and one man.  All have families and are responsible for a total of 12 children.  They are from Chinandega, a place located in the west of the country.  This group is noted for having hardworking, responsible members.

Reyna is group coordinator; she’s in charge of seeing that each member makes payments on time as scheduled.  Her economic activity is selling general merchandise consisting of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, towels, bed linen, shoes and cosmetics.  The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock up on new merchandise to offer her regular and occasional customers and take advantage of the Christmas season.  The Montiel group is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified sources of employment.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Bibiana Frank

texts.es: Bibiana de 56 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos mayores de edad, de la localidad de Chinandega, Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país  tiene por actividad económica el servicio de alquiler de sillas plásticas, que consiste en alquiler de sillas para todo tipo de eventos. Tiene 15 años de tener el negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina diaria de Bibiana es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias el objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar más sillas el cual se las están vendiendo a buen precio, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo digno para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad ha sido su medio de vida y de sus hijos. Bibiana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Bibiana, 56, is married with five adult children; she’s from Chinandega, a place located in the west of the country.  Her economic activity is leasing plastic chairs; she leases them out for all types of social events.  She’s been in business for 15 years and it’s located at home.  Bibiana’s daily routine is to work about 10 hours.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to buy more chairs that are being sold to her at a good price to meet customer demand.  The business arose because she needed to have a way to earn household income in a dignified way.  Currently, it’s become her and her children’s means of support.  Bibiana is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignifies sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs to lease for events.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 60 años de edad, casada y tiene 7 hijos, ella vive con su esposo y una de sus hijas en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Ella toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio, hace aproximadamente 20 años de vender variedades, venta de achinería, cosméticos, lociones, cremas, ropa adornos y otros. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y en forma ambulante. Ya tiene su clientela establecida. Ha decidido solicitar este préstamo por 14000 para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de mercadería para incrementar las ventas, comprará cosméticos, ropa, cremas, lociones, adornos y achinería en general.  Su sueño es que el negocio crezca y que su familia se supere.
texts.en: María, 60, is married and has seven children; she lives with her husband and one of her daughters in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She’s spent her entire life in commerce.  For the last twenty years she’s been selling various merchandise, low-cost novelty items, cosmetics, lotions, creams, clothes, decorations and others.  She sells both at home and from place to place.  She has an established clientele.  He’s decided to request a 14,000 loan to buy a variety of merchandise to increase sales.  She will buy cosmetics, clothes, creams, lotions, decorations and low-cost novelty items in general.  Her dream is that the business grows and her family improves always.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
Sadek is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Sadek is the only provider for the family. 

Sadek is a cowman. He established his business in 2004.  He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to install a new cowshed. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a new cowshed

loans.name: Deka

texts.en: Deka is a 28-year-old single mother living in the Congo Town community with her child, who is 2 years old. For the past five years Deka has been selling children's slippers in the market. She sells for ten hours a day.  She sometimes transports her goods by taxi or wheelbarrow. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit, and with the profit she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her child. She is also grateful to the lenders for their continued support toward her business. Some difficulties she faces are the low sales during the rainy season, and learning to sell from her friends. She is requesting this loan to purchase more children's slippers to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more children's slippers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is aged 25 years and single. She owns a retail business. She wants to use the loan for buying more sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale. She will use the profits from the business to make more savings, so that she can have a more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is taking out another loan to expand her business. She relates that since the previous loan, her living standard has improved. Mwanamkasi is requesting this new loan to buy raw potatoes and coconuts. Her goal is to open a kiosk.

She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy raw potatoes and coconuts.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 64 years old and lives in a small village of Tianeti district. He lives with his son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. His son works as an artisan and gets monthly income. 

Zaur is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 15 sheep and sells lambs locally. Zaur is very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing a sheep. After purchasing an additional sheep, Zaur will be able to expand his livestock. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income he will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Zaur awaits your support

loans.use: to purchase a sheep

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 24 years old. He owns a bar in which he sells soft drinks and beer. He has spent four years in the business. 

With the loan, Eric would like to add more beer and soft drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to create savings and to build his home.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 48 years old. She is married with five children. She owns a retail shop. She sells different products, and she has been running her business for one year. With the loan, she wants to add more items to sell such as rice, cooking oil, and utensils. She plans to use her profits for providing food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, and utensils to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, an area that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. She is 23 years old, single and has three children between the ages of 3 and 12 years, who live at home. 

For the past five years, Patience has been selling fruits and vegetables, like cassava, potatoes, eddoes, plantains and bananas, at the front of the supermarket. She established this business with a small loan from her father. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegatables, to expand her business. She wants to build a house and to expand her business, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits, like cassava, potatoes, and bananas, to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy mobile recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Goodness Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two partners, Victoria and Salomey. They have been together since 2011. 

Salomey is a 38-year-old trader, who has three children and is married to David, a 39-year-old auto mechanic. She has been with ID Ghana for a year and is doing very well with both her business and family.

She has been selling cloth for ten years. She works from Monday to Saturday, every week. Because there is no competition around her, she is able to sell more of her product. She also uses some cloth to sew for her customers in the community. Thanks to ID Ghana’s training on savings, she has cultivated the habit to save.  

This is her third loan, and she needs 800 GHS to buy more sewing accessories to sell to the customers. With earnings from her business and the help of her husband, she has been able to educate their children to the junior high school level. She wishes to help them go further. 

Salomey and Victoria need a total amount of 1,200 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more dressmaking supplies for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for one year. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To add more beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Tite

texts.en:
Tite, who is 46 years old, lives in a village in the Sachkhere District, which is in West Georgia, with his wife, 18-year-old son, and his retired father. The family owns a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Besides this, the family runs a small dairy farm of four milk cows and produces dairy products. In addition, Tite is a mini-bus driver and transports passengers if there are any orders.

Tite has requested a loan to begin a trading business. He will purchase cattle in the villages of his district, transport them with his own car, and sell them at the local open market for a profit. The family's income will significantly increase, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions. Also, in the future, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

Tite's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and follow-up loans to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor de 46 años de edad, casado con Ernestina De 44 años tiene actualmente tres razones de vida que son sus hijos Rosmery, Kelly y Lizet. Como un buen padre responsable se siente muy orgullo de saber que es el gran sustento de su hogar puesto que hasta hoy ha logrado concretar al construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. Desde niño brindo apoyó a sus padres en el oficio de la venta de ropas, es así que adquirió los conocimientos necesarios para iniciarse como vendedor independiente desde hace 20 años. 
Comenta  que optó seguir con el oficio ya que las ganancias son buenas y es posible recuperar el capital de la mercadería siempre.
Desarrolla su actividad junto a Ernestina así como con sus hijos en actividades menores. Le agrada ser parte del pequeño emporio en el cual labora puesto que ha logrado ganar muchas amistades y le han valido para consolidarse como un buen referente de prendas para caballeros.
Con motivo de las fiestas para fin de año desea ser partícipe del buen momento para los negocios locales y surtir su mercadería con nuevos modelos.
Sus planes a futuro dirigen a adquirir un establecimiento en la capital de su región para crecer como comerciante y brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación superior. Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y complementar su capital para la compra de polos, pantalones y demás prendas para caballeros.
texts.en:
Victor is 46 years old, married to 44 year old Ernestina and has three reasons for living; his children, Rosemary, Kelly, and Lizet.  Like a good, responsible father, he is proud to know that his is the supporter of the household and that he has managed to build his house with solid materials.  Since he was a boy he has helped his parents in their clothes selling business and it was this way that he learned what he needed to know to become an independent businessman 20 years ago.

He says that he decided to continue with this trade because the profits are good and it’s always possible to recover the cost of the merchandise.
