She sells sausages and has done so for a month.  She says that she works from her home and started offering her sausages by word of mouth.  Now her customers visit her in her home to buy in large amounts.

She buys what she needs in San Carlos, where she buys in quantity, at low cost and therefore financially convenient.

She will use the money from this loan to buy sausages in quantity.

One of Luisa’s goals is to continue in her field to attract more customers and supply her business with sausages so that she can generate more income and improve her quality of life.  Luisa lives with her husband and four children, ages 20, 15, 12, and 9.  Her personal dreams are to study hairstyling and beauty and provide a good financial atmosphere for her family. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza because it allows her to invest in her business.  She says that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her own personal development because she has learned to organize and distribute her investments and revenues in a better way.  As far as her communal bank, she says that there is good communication among the members.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobío river, one of the largest in the country, located in southern Chile, in the Biobío region.  It’s the center of important battles and significant settlements, especially during the Arauco war on the border of the Mapuche territory.  The city currently has the most important economic, demographic, managerial, financial, and commercial developments in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to buy sausages in bulk.

loans.name: Onisa

texts.es: Luisa desde que recibió su crédito  se encuentra más feliz, porque pudo ampliar su producción de raíces chinas, e incursionar en el comercio de los supermercados. Luisa considera que su negocio es una de sus grandes satisfacciones, porque le ha permitido consolidarse  y con sus códigos de barra, lograr ventas superiores a las acostumbradas, aplicando el capital de crédikiva  a sus productos y aumentando el  bienestar de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará semillas, empaques, fertilizantes, que mejorarán la calidad de sus raíces, y logrará con ello aumentar sus niveles de comercialización, también realizará adecuaciones locativas que le permitirán trabajar adecuadamente. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “   Me considero afortunada, por su respaldo, y espero de la mano de ustedes, fortalecer mi negocio, y consolidarlo como una gran empresa”
texts.en: Luisa is very happy after receiving her loan because she is able to expand her production of Chinese roots and begin selling them in supermarkets.  Luisa considers her business to be one of her greatest satisfactions because it has allowed her to consolidate and make greater sales than normal by applying her new Kiva loan and improving her family’s wellbeing.  She is asking for a new Kiva loan to buy seeds, packaging, fertilizers that will improve the quality of her roots and allow her to increase her sales.  It will also allow her to make other improvements that will allow her to work adequately.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “I consider myself to be fortunate for having your backing and I hope that by your hand I will strengthen my business and consolidate it like a great company.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Roxana Eloisa

texts.es:
ROXANA ELOISA tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

ROXANA ELOISA se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realizarà en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crèdito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la agricultura. El sueño es tener otro negocio para que haya otro ingreso. Los desafìos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar para la playa.
texts.en:
Roxana Eloisa is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter.  She lives with her husband and daughter in the city of Ventanas, within the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the La Victoria communal bank, located in the Recinto wetlands, part of the Ventanas settlement.  The people here are farmers and raise livestock.

Roxana Eloisa raises corn and rice and makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy weed killers, urea, fertilizers, and insecticides.

She will invest the money from the loan into farming.  Her dream is to have another business so that she can have another income.  Her challenges are crop plagues and disease.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es: En su credikiva pasado Martha compró juguetearía y ropa para atender la temporada de fin de año y ganó dinero el cual reconvirtió aumentando su capacidad de compra y su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad programó el crédito para el mismo mes del año anterior y comprará juguetearía y ropa en mayor volumen,  pues conoce bien su mercado sus proveedores la esperan para hacerle buenos descuentos y ganará una vez mas,  dinero con el cual beneficiará a su familia. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores de Kiva: " Estoy feliz, por la ayuda recibida. Mi negocio y toda mi familia nos hemos beneficiado . Muchas Gracias de todo Corazón.
texts.en: Martha used her Kiva loan to buy toys and clothing to be able to handle the year end season and she earned money which she used to increase her purchasing power and working capital.  She planned the loan for the same month last year and will buy toys and clothing in quantity.  She knows her market well and her suppliers wait for her to give her good discounts so that she will earn more money to benefit her family.  She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders,” I’m happy for the help you have given me.  My business and my entire family have benefitted.  Thank you very much will all of my heart.”

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Carlos Dario

texts.es: Cuando Carlos y su esposa hace 4 años,  quedaron desempleados y sin ingresos, debieron buscar alternativas para responder a los gastos de su  hogar, en el que existen 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 10 años;  Inicialmente compraron un plan de celulares y decidieron vender minutos en su barrio a los vecinos, que se trasladaban a lugares no muy cercanos para lograr comunicarse. Con este negocio y  observando su mercado le surgió la idea de alquilar lavadoras, para que las familias satisfacieran las necesidades de mantener limpia la ropa  del hogar, con menos esfuerzos y sobre todo resguardados del candente sol de Caribe.  Carlos atiende si negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a domingos, con el fin de hacerlo crecer y aumentar sus ingresos, para beneficiar cada vez más a su familia. El servicio de alquiler de máquinas lo realiza vía telefónica  la solicitud y el envía sus lavadoras donde la necesiten, para posteriormente ir por ellas de acuerdo a las horas pactadas en la solicitud. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante  el cual  adquirirá  planes ofrecidos por operadores de teléfonos y comprará más lavadoras, debido a que su clientela se ha incrementado y  muchos de ellos no pueden acceder al servicio, porque se  las maquinarias estas alquiladas cuando lo requieren , perdiendo así posibilidades de aumentar sus ingresos y ganar un poco más. Su sueño de prosperidad es tener su propia casa y fortalecer su negocio cada vez más, pues sabe que apuntándole a su crecimiento muchas de sus metas son probables de lograr.
texts.en:
When Carlos and his wife became unemployed and without an income four years ago, they decided to look for alternatives to pay the household expenses, where they have three children, from ages eight to ten.  Initially they bought a cellular plan and decided to sell minutes to their neighbors who would travel to faraway places and wanted to be able to communicate.  With this business, and by watching their market, they got the idea to rent our washing machines so that families could have the means to wash clothing in their homes.

Carlos tends to his business from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday.  He wants to grow it and increase his income in order to benefit his family.  He provides his rental services via telephone and he sends his washers to where they are needed and picks them up in accordance with the number of hours agreed to.  He is asking for a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will acquire plans offered by phone service providers.  He will also buy more washing machines, because his number of customers is increasing and many of them can’t access the service because the machines are rented out when they need them.  He loses the opportunity to increase his revenue and earn a little more.  His dream of prosperity includes having a home of his own and strengthening the business.  He knows that by focusing on growth, many of his goals are within reach.

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Gibrilla  S.

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Gibrilla. He is married and has two children, ages seven and one. One is a school-going child. In 2009, Gibrilla established his clothing business, which sells jeans, shirts, polos, Lacoste, crepe, coats and other items. He began his business because he dropped out of school at Form V because of lack of sponsorship. His mother-in-law gave him some money to start business, and the business has grown from a stall to a boutique.  

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 2,200,000 Sierra Leonean leone (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Gibrilla has already received and successfully repaid one loan. He now requires a new loan in order to buy jeans (two dozen @ Le 440,000); shoes (12 @ Le 170,000); polos (two dozen @ Le 336,000); and shirts (2 dozens @ Le 420,000).  The balance of Le 68,000 will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Gibrilla plans to build a house, open another outlet, provide quality education for his children, and to become an international businessman.  The loan will help him to accomplish some of his future plans. He is hardworking and honest businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for his business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. Concepcion earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as sugar, flour, margarine, and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more to the people thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Concepcion hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as sugar, flour, margarine, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Hawa O.

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Hawa O. She is married with eight adult children. In 1980, Hawa O. established her food stall. She started it because she did not go to school, and her parents were traders who trained her in their business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 in order to purchase cake flour - 5 bags @ Le150,000, sugar - 4 bags @ Le250,000, vegetable oil - 5 rubbers @ Le150,000, eggs - 5 cartons @ Le320,000, couscous (wheat) - 2 cartons @ Le200,000. In the future, Hawa O. plans to expand her business and save enough money for her retirement. The rainy season is a major problem. She is hardworking and needs enough capital to buy more stock in order to yield profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy eggs, Maggie, and tomato ketchup for her food stall.

loans.name: Jaya Ram Group

texts.en:
Mahulpada village in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India is a remotely located rural village. In this village, there is a separate hamlet called the Mahar community. The main source of livelihood of this community is weaving bamboo baskets. In the year 2010, six poor, illiterate rural women of this hamlet formed a Joint Liability Group named Jaya Ram with the objective of taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family and the improvement of their existing businesses. Basanta, about 43 years old, is the featured member who is sitting in the middle with her hand raised. She is married and resides in a small hut with her husband, one son age 15 and one daughter age 12. Her children are continuing their studies. All members of this group belong to a very poor background far away from all basic needs like education, shelter, health facilities etc.  

The business of Basanta (weaving bamboo baskets) is a traditional business in her community. Basanta and her husband do the processing work and weave baskets of different shapes and sizes. They sell their products in the nearest weekly market in their town. Some traders also regularly come to this village to purchase bamboo products. Basanta earns a monthly profit of Rs 2,000/- from her business. As there is a growing demand for these products to supply to various parts of the country, Basanta wants to purchase more raw bamboo with this loan amount to work for a longer period without any interruption for more output. This will help her to earn some extra income to manage the family smoothly. Basanta hopes to construct a house in the near future.

The other five members of the group are Udia, Sushama, Balamati, Tarulata and Subidha who are doing similar businesses.

loans.use: To purchase raw bamboo

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Rugiatu earns about 2,980,000 Sierra Leonean leone (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase mayonnaise (three cartons @ Le 400,000); eggs (three cartons @ Le 280,000); garri (five bags @ Le 140,000); vegetable oil (five rubbers @ Le 280,000); and ketchup (three cartons @ Le 340,000). The balance (Le 40,000) will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to build a house, educate her child, and open a restaurant. The loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans. She is hardworking and trustworthy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil, garri (cassava flakes), eggs, ketchup, spaghetti and mayonnaise, and to pay laborers to transport the goods.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.en: Crisologo is a 47-year-old fisherman from Ubay, Bohol. He is a father of nine children. Crisologo has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. Crisologo is a asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, hooks, buckets, and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Crisologo dreams of improving his business. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks, buckets, and fuel for the boat for his fishing business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
This is Jorge; he previously accessed a PHP 15,000 loan that he utilized to purchase more sacks of rice. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another PHP 22,000 loan. He will be utilizing this loan to buy more sacks of rice. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jorge hopes to expand his business and dreams to have good health. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more sacks of rice needed in his business.

loans.name: Osman  Malam

texts.en: This is 59-year-old Osman Malam. He is married, and has seven children aged 29, 28, 26, 19, 11, 9, and 6 years. Three are school-going children. In 2008, Osman Malam established his bags (school bags, traveling bags, casual bags) business. He began his business because as a teenager he was farming with his parents in the village because of his poor background; he was not fortunate enough to attend school. When he grew older, he decided to start a petty trading business. His father wanted him to be a farmer, but he had to leave the village for the main town because farming does not yield any profit. He was dealing local produce. In 2008, he changed his business into bags. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 606,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Osman Malam has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy school bags - 50 pieces @ Le25,000, traveling bags - 50 pieces @ Le35,000, casual bags - 30 pieces @ Le15,000, and computer bags - 15 pieces @ Le70,000. In the future, Osman Malam hopes to sponsor his children's education. The loan will help as it is the source of income. The rainy season is a problem as it reduces sales. He is hard working. He has successfully paid the previous loan and he will make sure he repays this loan in order to acquire subsequent loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags for his consumer goods business.

loans.name: Jaya Laxman Group

texts.en:
Five poor, illiterate, rural women of Mahulpada village in the Titilagarh Block of the Bolangir district of Odisha, India formed a Joint Liability Group named Jaya Laxman in the year 2010 with the objective of supporting their traditional business of bamboo basket weaving by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family. Manju, about 36 years old, is sitting on the extreme left with her hand raised. She hails from the Mahar community. This community does bamboo weaving work. Manju is married and resides in a small mud house with her six family members: her husband, three sons (19, 15 and 5 years old) and one daughter (10 years old). All members of this group are below the poverty line. The Mahar community to which Manju belongs, has a separate hamlet in her village.  

Manju runs a business weaving bamboo baskets, which is the traditional business of her community. Manju and her family do the processing work and weaving of baskets like “kula, tupa, kurli, bhuga, kulei, garna, talei, parla etc." in different sizes. During the marriage season, there is a heavy demand for these products. They sell the products once a week in the weekly market in the nearby town. Some traders also regularly come to this village to purchase bamboo products. Manju earns a monthly profit of Rs 2,500/- from her business. To meet the growing demand for these products, Manju wants to purchase more raw bamboo with his loan to work for a longer period without any interruption. She also wants to procure some ready-made products from other weavers. This will help her to earn some extra income to bear the regular expenses of her family in a smooth manner and to materialize her future hope of constructing a house.

The other four members of the group are Nira, Pushpa, Baidehi and Lalita who are doing similar businesses.

loans.use: To purchase raw bamboo

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Lamrana. She is a widow, and has four children aged 20, 18, 15, and eight years. All are school-going children. In 1992, Lamrana established her rice, beans, millet, and groundnut business. She began her business because her father did not value a female child's education then.  Being that her mother was a trader, she had to join her trade because she did not have the opportunity to go to school.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 684,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Lamrana has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy groundnut - 5 bags @ Le 350,000, millet - 5 bags @ Le 320,000, beans 2 1/2 bags @ Le 575,000. In the future, Lamrana plans to finish her incomplete building and educate her school-going children to whatever level they choose. Shortage in supply of goods and changes in prices are her major problems. She is hardworking and committed to her business. The loan will help her achieve her future plans because she will be able to buy more stock, which will yield profit for her. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local food stuffs for her business.

loans.name: Aminata Issa

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Aminata. She is divorced, and has four children who are 10, 14, 16, and 19 years old. In 1996, Aminata established her cosmetics, toiletries, baby clothing, and jewels business. She began her business because she learned from her mother. She used to help her mother after school hours by selling in the market. She later began her own little business, and now this business is the main source of her income for the support of her children. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase wax cotton - 20 pieces @ Le 80,000, body spray - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, bio-clear body cream - 40 pieces @ Le 10,000, gel - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, earrings - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Aminata hopes to build a house and improve her business in order to support her children's education. Rise in transportation costs and the inflation rate are her major business challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase wax cotton - 20 pieces @ Le 80,000, body spray - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, bio-clear body cream - 40 pieces @ Le 10,000, gel - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, and earrings - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
The name of this Joint Liability Group is Maa Santoshi. It consists of four active women. All the entrepreneurs of this group belong to Bhawanipatna town in the Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Sabita, standing on the extreme left in a yellow sari in the photo, is one of the members of this group. She is 40 years of age and lives with her husband, one daughter (20 years old) and one son (22 years old). Her family migrated to this area 30 years ago to maintain their livelihood. 

Sabita has been running a grocery store along with a small restaurant attached to it for the last 15 years with the help of her husband. Both the wife and husband manage the business. To manage the restaurant, she has engaged three workers whom she pays 10,000 INR per month. Sabita earns a net monthly profit of 8,000 INR from the business. It is difficult on her part to manage the household as well as business expenses. Sabita has a desire to increase her income by adding some value-added items to her existing business. She wants to purchase a refrigerator for the grocery store for keeping soft drinks and she wants to repair the restaurant shed with the loan. Sabita has a dream of establishing herself as a proud owner of a quality restaurant and marrying her daughter in a respectable manner.  
 
The other three members of her group. Kuni, Manju and Budhamani, are running a tire reselling centre and barber shops.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and make repairs to her restaurant

loans.name: Ruksana-A Group

texts.en:
Nashaba has formed a Joint Liability Group named Ruksana-A in Bhawanipatna town in the Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Almost all the members of this group belong to a minority category and are below the poverty line. The lady standing on the extreme right in the photograph is Nashaba.She is 45 years old and resides with her husband, one son and one daughter.

Nashaba is running a ready-made clothing shop in the heart of the town. It has been running successfully with the help of her husband for the last 10 years. Her son also helps in her business at times. Nashaba’s husband purchases ready-made garments from a wholesale market 700 kms. away i.e. Kolkata. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR from her business, which is insufficient to maintain her family and to give proper education to her grown up children. With this background, she has decided to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to purchase some ready-made garments in a lot, which will save her time, money and energy and contribute some profit to her business. Nashaba has long cherished to construct a house of her own and give a technical education to her children.   

The other three members of her group are Ruksena, Najanin and Kusum, who are running an auto repairing centre, a cloth business and a tea and betel nut sho,p respectively.

loans.use: To purchase ready-made garments

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 63, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is a mother and lives with her children to help them manage their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, beverages, and piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells palm sized rugs for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria hopes to have the strength to continue working because she doesn’t want to depend on her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Eroolthuu

texts.en: Mr.Eroolthuu is 33-years-old lives with his wife and two sons in a small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Ganchimeg, aged 33, works with her husband with transportation service business in the Russian and Mongolian boarder town. His son, Togoldor, goes to local school, and his younger son, Javhlantogs, goes to the local kindergarten. He and his wife have been running this business of transportation service in that town since 2005. They have already built closer relationships with suppliers in the Russian town. They also connect new businesses to Russian wholesalers. Mr.Eroolthuu has just built new house for his family's use and is asking for MNT 3,000,000 loan to install heating system and insulation. He is a responsible, well-organized, and hardworking person.

loans.use: to install heating system and insulation in his newly built house for his family.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 48, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is single and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Lolita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, beverages and piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lolita hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 45 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. His wife is a trader who makes 200,000 SLL in sales per day. In 1990, Mohamed established his used handbags, schoolbags, and purses business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 6,744,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Mohamed is requesting his third loan of 4,000,000 SLL, which he will use to purchase used handbags, school bags, and traveling bags. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to engage in the wholesale business. 

Mohammed feels good about the loan because it helps both in his domestic and business affairs. He wants to educate his children and these loans enable him to generate more income. The shortage of goods is his major business problem. His competition is great as several people are in the same business line. He goes for quality sales to better his competitors.  

Mohammed began doing business when he was a boy.  He was not able to attend school because he was from a poor home.  He serves about 50 people per day mostly peddlers and ladies. His business is popular because he has customer care strategies. He has one assistant, a distant cousin, who usually goes to Freetown to buy his goods twice per month.  

Mohamed saved his profits to build a house and he is now looking forward to expanding his business through the help of this credit service.

loans.use: to purchase used handbags, schoolbags, and traveling bags for his retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en: Batsuuri, 52 years old, lives with his wife and niece in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter has passed away so he and his wife care for her child. He has been running a candy and sweets business since 1998 at a local market. He takes his goods from wholesale food centers. Also he has retired from the police organization and gets a pension. Due to diabetes, his left leg has been replaced with an artificial leg, but he has still difficulty walking and uses a crutch. He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on electricity and emits less smoke. As winter comes to Mongolia, the air in Ulaanbaatar is greatly polluted and encouraging the usage of environmentally friendly cars is essential in reducing air pollution. Issuing this loan to the borrower means he can work enthusiastically and also more importantly it will contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on electricity

loans.name: Ruksana-B Group

texts.en:
Ruksana-B is a Joint Liability Group formed by four active women from Bhawanipatna town in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Kanak, sitting on the extreme left wearing a sky colored sari and holding turmeric powder, is the featured member. She is 29 years of age and lives with her husband and one daughter who is three years old.

Kanak is running a unit processing forest produce like turmeric, arrowroot, honey, mustard and jhuna. Her husband helps in her business and collects the forest produce from different places in the state and outside the state. After collection, Kanak processes the raw products, makes packets and supplies them to the retailers. She has also tied her business with a govt.agency called ORMAS and sold them at a lump sum for a high margin of profit. Her husband also used to go to different district and state level festivals where there is a congregation of persons to purchase her finished products by hiring a stall. Her monthly net income from the processing unit is around 12,000 INR.There is a heavy demand for her products but due to lack of funds, she could not meet the demands of the market. So with the present loan, Kanak planned to procure a bulk quantity of forest products for processing and selling in the market to earn more profit. She has a dream of providing better education to her child and constructing a house of her own in due course.  
 
The other three members of her group are Hasina, Gitanjali and Snehalata. They are running a cloth business, an auto repair center and a Tiffin hotel, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase turmeric, honey, arrowroot etc.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
This is Nemia, 43, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Bienvenido, a driver and a father to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nemia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, beverages, and  piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nemia hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
This is Albina; she previously accessed a PHP 25,000 loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to buy different products such as belts, towels, umbrellas, flashlights, hammers, and other products needed in her general merchandise store. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Albina hopes that all her children will finish their studies and dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her home products business.

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en:
This is Ernesa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw ingredients and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients like rice, beef, pork, chicken and condiments and utensils like spoons, chopping boards, knives, pans and casseroles needed in her growing business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ernesa simply dreams of having a happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients like rice, beef, pork, chicken and condiments and utensils like spoons, chopping boards, knives, pans and casseroles needed in her business.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Narangerel is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ger in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife Ganzul, age 28, helps her husband and stays home taking care of their two sons. His son Bilguun, age 11, goes to a local school and son Naranzul, age 2, stays home. He has been running his  retail clothes business in a local market since 2005. He has already built a strong relationship with his customers and suppliers. He imports inventory from China once or twice a month. He needs a car to reduce his transportation service expense by purchasing a car which is also an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming one. He is now requesting 5,250,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for both business and family use. He is a hardworking, communicative and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for both business and family use

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah, a 40-year-old married woman, and her husband are supporting seven family members. To help improve their living conditions, Najah used to make pastries by order. Later, she began making trays and some decoration pieces from hay and sackcloth. She applied for this loan to buy some raw materials like hay, glue, and others to increase her productivity and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy some raw materials such as hay, glue etc...

loans.name: Kairkul

texts.ru: Каиркул 58 год, разведена, воспитывает четверых детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 1997 году Каиркул начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодня в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 3 дойные коровы, 12 овец и 23 козы. Т В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каиркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров . Доходы Каиркул планирует вложить в увеличение своего хозяйства и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Kairkul is 58 years old, divorced, and has four children.  As a source of income for her family, in 1997 Kairkul began a business in animal husbandry.  Having started with 5,000 som (KGS), today her farm brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  Today,  she has three milk cows, 12 sheep, and 23 goats on her farm.  

With the goal of further deveoloping her business, Kairkul applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two cows.  Kairkul is planning to invest the income in enlarging her business and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Fareeda's Group

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is jobless, both of the daughters are married, and a son works as a salesman. 

Fareeda herself has been running a beauty salon for two years which is a very successful business for her family. Currently she is in need of purchasing some cosmetic products for her beauty salon. For that as a member of a seven-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial creams, makeup kits etc.

With the profits, she will first pay back her loan to Kiva, and then she will purchase a variety of cosmetic products for the salon. 

Fareeda’s dream is to open a new beauty parlor and to get good profits from that, so that she can provide a better future to her children. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products like facial creams,  lipsticks and makup kits etc for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nazi's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nazi is a 35-year-old woman and a mother of three children. Her husband lives abroad and all of the children are students. 

Nazi is very talented and excels in the work of sewing clothes. Since 2009, she has been operating a tailoring business at her home. In this way she manages to provide for her children. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she needs to purchase a new tailoring machine. But due to the lack of money, she is unable to purchase it. 

Therefore, as a member of seven-person lending group, Nazi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to cover the cost of purchasing a new tailoring machine. In this way, she will be able to complete the orders on time. 

Nazi intends to utilize part of the profits on the betterment of her family members and on providing quality education to her children.

Note: In the picture Nazi holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bacha

texts.ru: Бача 44 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей - школьников. Бача работает в школьной учительницей в школе села Ак-Суу и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS) 15 лет назад. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Бача сумела развить свой бизнес с хозяйством, насчитывающим 2 коров с приплодом, 5 голов овец и ежемесячным доходом около 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бача обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скот для откорма. Доходы от кредита Бача планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, а в будущем мечтает купить машину для семьи.
texts.en:
Bacha is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children.  Bacha works as a school teacher in the village of Ak-Suu and, as a source of additional income for her family, she has a business in animal husbandry and farming.  She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS) 15 years ago.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Bacha was able to develop her business and now has two cows and their young, and five sheep, which bring in a monthly income of about 7,000 som (KGS).  

With the goal of further developing her business, Bacha applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional cattle to fatten for resale.  Bacha plans to invest the income from the loan in the develpment of her business, and she dreams of one day buying a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru: Анварчон житель города Исфара. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Анварчона домохозяйка. Анварчон занимается торговлей. Он арендует магазин, где продает стройматериалы. Торговлей Анварчон занимается 20 лет. Он берет кредит для покупки стройматериалов с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Anvarjon is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  Anvarjon's wife is a homemaker.  Anvarjon is in the building supplies business, selling from a rented store.  Anvarjon has been in business for 20 years.  With the goal of increasing his assortment of goods, he is taking out a loan to buy building supplies.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 64 years old and is married. She has 5 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. 
She has run a general store in her house for 8 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and she intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her family's emergencies.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She has engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years now.
Elva is asking for a loan to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow and produce healthy pigs.
Elva hopes of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to sell from her stall. Binh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of higher quality food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.ru: Фахридин проживает в городе Исфара. Он женатый 36 - летный мужчина. Фахридин является отцом четверых детей. Он занимается купле - продажей сухофруктов. В основном на протяжении пятнадцати лет Фахридин занимается торговлей кураги. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Сейчас Фахридин берет кредит для покупки других видов сухофруктов, чтобы расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Fakhridin lives in the city of Isfara. He is a married 36-year-old man, and a father of four children. Fakhridin buys and resells dried fruits. Over the past fifteen years, he has been mainly trading in dried apricots, and has acquired a wealth of experience in this area. Fakhridin is taking this loan to purchase other types of dried fruits in order to expand his business activity.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds of dried fruits

loans.name: Quoc

texts.en:
Quoc is 39 years old and married with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income by running a food stall to sell meals for breakfast to people in their community. 
He started this activity 12 years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business, by buying a greater variety of food and quality ingredients, to make different kinds of meals to sell at his stall and better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food and good ingredients to make meals for selling.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 40 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband earns money by selling spare parts for vehicles. Thao has been running a general store in front of her house for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 
Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock in her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that with the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock in her store.

loans.name: Amarbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Amarbaatar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a manager in a private construction company for the last five years. His wife works as a stylist at the same company when workload is high. He has begun building his own house but due to finances hasn’t completed it. As winter come to Mongolia, the family is in urgent need to complete and insulate the house. So he is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to buy construction and insulating materials. As a result, the family can live in a warm and comfortable place and will also burn less coal.  A decrease in consumption of coal has positive impacts on efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy construction and insulating materials to finish the family house before winter.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang would like to take another loan to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks and coffee to sell from his cafe. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks and coffee.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy pork to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in her current business by purchasing pork for resale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 47-year-old married man and father of five children from Ubay, Bohol. Felix has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now.
Felix is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish at the market.
Felix dreams of improving his fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru: Маруф молодой и энергичный человек с большими планами будущим. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Он очень любит свою семью и старается обеспечить их с лучшим условием проживания. С целью получения дохода и обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами уже несколько лет он работает в авто колоне. Так как он хорошо воспитанный благодаря его родителям, его коллеги очень любят и уважают его. Маруф старается из-за всех сил, чтобы получить больше дохода. Однако его доход не позволяет для покупки всех не обходимых средства для проживания.  Данное время у него нет сбережения для покупки угля и дров для зимовки. Если он не будет покупать угль и дров, то в его доме будет невозможно проводить зиму из-за холода. Его дети маленькие и очень быстро простуживаются. Маруф запрашивает займ на сумму 2200 сомони для покупки угля и дров. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Maruf is an energetic young man with big plans for the future.  He is 26 years old, married, and has two children.  He loves his family very much and tries to provide them with all the best living conditions.  In an effort to earn an income and to provide his family with all the necessitites, he has worked for several years now as a long-haul driver.  Since he is good mannered, thanks to his parents, his colleagues like and respect him very much.  Maruf tries as hard as he can to earn more money.  Nonetheless, his income isn't enough to purchase everything necessary for living.  

At the present time, he doesn't have any savings for buying coal and wood for the winter.  If he doesn't buy coal and wood, the cold will make it impossible for them to make through the winter in their home.  His children are small and they get sick very easily.  Maruf is requesting a loan of 2,200 somoni to buy coal and wood.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood for using in winter

loans.name: Davlatoy

texts.ru: Давлатой 39 лет. Она очень заботливая мать и старается обеспечить своих 2 детей хорошим условием проживания. С целью получения дохода, несколько лет назад она уехала в Российскую Федерацию, но она не смогла найти подходящею работу и вернулась на родину. Возвратившись на родину, она поступила на работу в ферме. Уже 6 месяцев как она работает дояркой и успешно справляется со своей работой. Она хочет купить корову и обеспечить своих детей молоком, но ее зарплата не хватает для покупки коровы. Ее дети очень обрадовались, когда узнали о плане Давлатой, купить корову. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки коровы. Давалатой является повторной клиенткой и обещает погасить займ во время. Это займ поможет Давлатой улучшить питание детей и таким образом вырастить их здоровыми. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Davlatoy is 39 years old. She is a very caring mother and tries to provide good living conditions for her 2 children. Several years ago, Davlatoy went to Russia in order to earn a living, but was unable to find suitable work and returned home, where she found work at a farm. For the past 6 months, she has been milking cows and capably taking care of all her work responsibilities.

Davlatoy would like to have a cow of her own in order to provide her children with fresh milk. Her children were very happy to hear their mother's plan. However, Davlatoy's salary is insufficient for such a purchase, and so she is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to buy a cow. Davlatoy is a return client of IMON International, and promises to repay her loan on time. This loan will help her to improve her children's nutrition and ensure their healthy growth. Davlatoy is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 41 years old, and married with two children. Her husband earns money as a laborer for hire. She supports her family by sewing clothes and other products. She started this business twenty years ago to cover her expenses, and raise her two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Tam is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality sewing materials and fabric that she will use to increase the turnover of her business. 
She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives with her two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For twenty years, she and her husband have run a bakery to sell bread to people in their community.
Nam would like a loan to purchase better quality flour at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 
She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy better quality flour to make bread for selling.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is 40 years old and is married. She has a daughter and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Her husband is a security guard. She has run a beauty shop at her house for 14 years. She would like to take a loan to buy hair care products and tools to better meet her customers' demand.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy hair care products and tools.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is 49 years old, and divorced. She lives with her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns money to support her family by sewing clothes. Anh started this activity twenty years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying sewing materials and fabric to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and fabric.

loans.name: Meakra

texts.en:
Meakra (in the photo) and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, she also sells grocery items and her husband is a lathe operator. 
The couple has been married since 2005, and has one young daughter. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
Meakra had asked for a loan to supplement her family's income by starting a new business selling groceries. She is now asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Abdugani

texts.ru: Абдугани житель города Исфара. Он женат. Ему 53 года. У него четверо детей. Абдугани вместе с семьей занимается торговлей. Он рядом с домом открыл небольшой ларек, где продает продукты и необходимые хозяйственные товары. В этой области Абдугани 7 лет. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Abdugani lives in the city of Isfara. He is 53 years old, married, and has four children. Together with his family, Abdugani is engaged in retail. Near his home, Abdugani has opened a small stall where he sells food products and essential household goods. He has been working in this job for the past 7 years. Abdugani is taking this loan to stock up on food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишеру 47 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Его жена портниха и старается помогать мужу для обеспечения семьи. Алишер более 15 лет занимается купле продажей хлопка. Благодаря упорному труду и навыкам в сфере бизнеса, Алишер развивает свой бизнес год за годом. Он знает все аспекты своего дела. Алишер имеет хорошую репутацию среди бизнесменов. Его старший сын работает мастером по ремонту дома, и приносить доход семейному бюджету. Алишер и его семья решила купить мебель для дома. Их доход не позволяет им купить мебель, так как они используют свой доход для проживания. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки мебели. Он обещает погасить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Alisher is 47 years old. He is married and has 6 children in his care. His wife is a seamstress who tries to help her husband take care of their family. For over 15 years, Alisher has been buying and reselling cotton. Thanks to his hard work and entrepreneurial acumen, his business has steadily grown. Alisher knows all aspects of his work, and has earned a good reputation among other businessmen. Alisher's eldest son works as a home repairman, and also contributes to the family's budget.

Alisher and his family have decided to buy furniture for their home. Their income does not allow them to make this purchase, as all the money goes to their living expenses. Alisher is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to buy new furniture and promises to repay it on time. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his family's home

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Наргиза жительница города Душанбе. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем. Наргиза занимается производством и торговлей. Она арендует пекарню, где печет лепешки для торговли. В этой области Наргиза работает десять лет. Вместе с ней в пекарне работают ее работники, которые ей помогают. 
Наргиза берет кредит для покупки муки, угля и дров, чтобы продолжить работу и увеличить количество производимого продукта.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a resident of the city of Dudshanbe.  She is 26 years old and married.  She is in the business of production and sales.  She rents a bakery where she bakes flatbread that she sells.  Nargiza has been in this field for ten years.  Her employees work along side her and help her.

Nargiza is taking out a loan to buy flour, coal, and wood in order to carry on her work and to increase her produciton.

loans.use: to buy flour, coal, and wood

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Jeune Célibataire sans enfant, Kokou est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il commercialise les produits alimentaires glacés communément  appelé ‘‘Fan Milk’’ depuis 2006 dans une boutique. Il sollicite son troisième crédit auprès de WAGES pour acheter du stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Il veut renforcer son activité et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de sa famille. Il pense aussi à être économiquement stable pour accueillir sa future femme.
texts.en: Kokou is a 34-year-old, single man with no children. He has been selling frozen foods commonly called "Fan Milk" in a shop since 2006. He is requesting a 3rd loan from WAGES in order to restock on merchandise so that he can satisfy his customers. He would like to strengthen his business and ensure his family's food self-sufficiency. He would also like to be able to offer his future wife economic security.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits congelés et d’alimentation générale, Akouavi est une femme mariée, mère de 03 enfants est âgée de 57 ans. Elle possède une boutique et emploie 01 personne pour l’aider à servir les clients. Elle sollicite son second prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter des produits congelés et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle ambitionne de vendre des cartes de recharge avec ses profits supplémentaires. Elle souhaite agrandir sa boutique et devenir grossiste mais aussi d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Akouavi is a 57-year-old married woman and the mother of 3 children who sells frozen foods and grocery products. She owns a shop and employs one person to help her serve her customers. She is requesting her 2nd loan from WAGES so that she can buy frozen food and groceries. She plans to sell prepaid charge cards using her additional profits. She would like to expand her shop and become a wholesaler, as well as to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy frozen food & grocery products.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Jeune femme mariée de 28 ans, Dédé est mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier est âgé de 09 ans et le dernier a 05 ans. Elle pratique le commerce de pagnes et de doublures à son domicile  depuis 2007. Elle sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise et augmenter son stock de pagnes avec les profits supplémentaires. Elle désire avoir une grande boutique et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: A young, 28-year-old married woman, Dédé is the mother of 2 children who both go to school. The eldest is 9 years old and the youngest, 5. She has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) and linings from her home since 2007. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to buy merchandise. She will use her additional profits to increase her inventory of pagnes. She would like to have a large shop and to fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and linings.

loans.name: Mazalo

texts.fr: Mazalo est une jeune femme mariée âgé de 27 ans. Elle est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Elle revend des produits céréaliers depuis 2005 mais dispose pas encore d’employés à son compte. Elle sollicite son second prêt auprès de WAGES pour payer des stocks de céréales afin de le revendre. Elle désire augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et d’assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Mazalo is a young, 27-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. She has been selling cereal products since 2005, but does not yet have enough employees. She is requesting her 2nd loan from WAGES so that she can restock on cereals for resale. She would like to increase her turnover and ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy cereal products.

loans.name: Ibra

texts.fr: Ibra est un homme marié. Il tient un magasin alimentaire dans sa localité et vend des denrées de première nécessité comme le riz, l'huile et d'autres produits divers.Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses deux enfants.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un prêt de 400 000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile et des produits divers.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde alimentation.
texts.en: Ibra is a married man. He owns a grocery shop in his area and sells basic food items such as rice and oil. The revenue generated by his business enables him to meet his wife's needs and those of his 2 children. In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs so that he can buy rice, oil and other products. His ambition is to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and various other products.

loans.name: Shairbubu

texts.ru: Шайырбубу 51 лет, вдова мать 4 детей.Все дети у заемщицы взрослые, сын помогает ей по бизнесу. Образование у Шайырбубу  высшее, после окончания школы помогала родителям и вышла замуж.По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный, целеустремленный. Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Шайырбубу  её бизнес очень хорошо развивается. Она занимается откормом и последующей реализацией скота. Начав этот бизнес в 1985 году с 50,000 KGS сейчас у неё имеется 2 коровы и 4 бычка. Ежемесячный доход Шайырбубу  составляет 8,000 KGS Сом. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 100,000 KGS сом. На полученные средства она собирается закупить 10 голов овец и 2 коровы. Шайырбубу  поделилась с нами что в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить благосостояние семьи. Она хотела бы осуществить давнюю мечту сына купить машину.
texts.en:
Shairbubu is 51 years old, a widow, and a mother of 4 children. All her children are adults, and her son helps Shairbubu with her business. Shairbubu has post-secondary education. After graduation, she helped her parents and then got married. She is a kind, calm, and purposeful person. Thanks to Shairbubu's efforts and work ethic, her business is developing well. 

Shairbubu raises livestock for sale. She started her business in 1985 with 50,000 KGS, and presently keeps 2 cows and 4 calves. Her monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS). Shairbubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS. She plans to use these funds to purchase 10 sheep and 2 cows. Shairbubu has indicated that in the future she plans to repair her home and improve her family's well-being. Also, she would like to realize her son's long-time dream of owning a car.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and cows

loans.name: Umaraly

texts.ru: Умарали первый цикл кредитуется в нашей организации. Он очень добродушный и толерантный человек. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети Некруз и Лайло, им 2 и 4 года. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Умарали получил высшее образование благодаря родителям. Более 8 лет он работает в средней школе учителем литературы и родного языка. Он очень любит свою профессию и работает с удовольствием. Его ученики ждут его каждого урока, так как он проводит урок очень интересно. Умарали получает маленькую зарплату и не может копить деньги для покупки мебели. Его дети ждут в подарок  в праздник Нового Года мебель для их комнаты, и Умарали не может отказаться своим маленьким детям.  Он обратился за займом в сумме 1000 сомони для покупки мебели. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Umarali is borrowing from our organization for the first time.  He is a very good-natured and tolerant man.  He is 28 years old, married, and has two children, Nekruz and Lailo, who are 2 and 4 years old.  His wife is a homemaker and so he is the only breadwinner for the family.  Umarali received a higher education thanks to his parents and for more than eight years he has been a high school teacher of literature and their native language.   He really loves his profession and takes pleasure from his work.  His students are eager for every lesson because he makes them very interesting.

Umarali earns a small salary and cannot save up money for buying furniture.  His children are expecting a gift of new furniture for their room for the New Year holiday and Umarali can't deny his little children this gift.  He has applied for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy the furniture.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy home furniture

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло 29 лет. Он женатый молодой человек. Хабибулло проживает в городе Душанбе. Он является отцом троих детей. Хабибулло работает на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где в основном продает ткани. Этим видом бизнеса Хабибулло занимается четыре года. Он берет кредит для покупки тканей с вышивками и бисером.
texts.en: Habibullo is 29 years old.  He is a young, married man.  Habibullo lives in the city of Dushanbe and is the father of three children.  Habibullo works in the market.  He rents a kiosk and primarily sells fabrics.  He has been in this buisness for four years.  He is taking out a loan to buy embroidered and beaded fabrics.

loans.use: to buy embroidered and beaded fabrics

loans.name: Nasirat

texts.ru: Насират 52 года, замужем. Мать 4 детей. Насират начала заниматься животноводством и растениеводством, ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Насират начала свой бизнес со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) в 1998 году, и смогла развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее 6 коров и 10 баранов, с ежемесячной прибылью в 10,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока и перепродажи скота. Скот она откармливает и продает на местном скотском рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насират обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Насират планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем -мечтает дать хорошее образование младшему сыну.
texts.en:
Nasirat is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  Nasirat began a business in animal husbandry and farming, which has become the primary source of income for her family.  Nasirat began her business with 5,000 som (KGS) in 1998 and has been able to develop her business to where she now has six cows and ten sheep, which bring her a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and cattle.  She fattens the cattle and sells them at the local cattle market.

With the aim of further developing her business, Nasirat applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy additional head of cattle.  Nasirat plans to invest in further increasing the size of her herd, and she dreams of one day giving her youngest son a good education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 1500 kgs of seeds, 400 kgs of chemical fertilizer and manure, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Muhabatkhon

texts.ru:
Мухабатхону 56 лет. Она женщина со вкусом и добрым сердцем. Ее муж умер молодым, и она осталась с одним сыном. Она вырастила сына сама, женила его, и данное время имеет 2 внуков. Для получения дохода, чтобы помочь матери сын Мухабатхона уехал в Российскую Федерацию. Однако он не отправляет денег семье. После того как Мухабатхон не получила денег от сына она решила организовать свой бизнес переработкой косточки абрикоса. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь у нее есть навыки в сфере бизнеса. Она будет покупать косточки абрикоса, чистить косточки на специальном аппарате и продавать на местном рынке. Ее невестка будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих внуков и невестку со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для покупки аппарата для чистки косточки абрикоса, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhabatkhon is 56 years old.  She is a woman of good taste and she has a kind heart.  Her husband died young, leaving her with one son.  She raised her son alone, married him off, and now she has two grandsons.  To earn an income and help his mother, Muhabatkhon's son went to work in the Russian Federation.  However, he doesn't send any money to the family.  Having not received any money from her son, Muhabatkhon decided to start her own business in processing apricot kernels.  With this goal in mind, she studied in a course called "Achieve Success" that is organized by the Association of Business Women and she received a graduation certificate.  She now has business-related skills.

She will buy apricot kernels, clean them with a special machine, and then sell them at the local market.  Her daughter-in-law will help her with the business.  She plans to use the income she earns to provide her grandsons and daughter-in-law with all the necessities of life.  She is requesting a loan of 4,500 somoni to buy the machine for cleaning the apricot kernels so she can start her business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy equipment for processing apricot kernels

loans.name: Ameyovi

texts.fr: Professionnel spécialisé dans la restauration, Ameyovi est propriétaire d’un bar où elle vend des plats de riz, de foufou ignames etc. Elle est mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés et âgés respectivement de 09 ans et 07 ans. Elle pratique cette activité dans un espace aménagé à son domicile et a commencé depuis 2009. Elle sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter  du maïs, du riz et des ignames. Elle ambitionne de renforcer son activité et assurer l’autosuffisance
texts.en: A professional skilled in food preparation, Ameyovi owns a bar where she sells rice dishes, foufou, yams, etc.  She is the mother of two children who are 9 and 7 years old and both in school.  Ameyovi has been running this business from a specially fitted out location in her home since 2009.  She is requesting her third loan from WAGES to buy corn, rice and yams.  Her goal is to strengthen her business and ensure her own self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, yams, etc.

loans.name: Farida

texts.fr: Farida est une jeune fille célibataire sans enfant âgée de 29 ans. Elle s’est très tôt mise à son propre compte et a ainsi débuté une  activité commerciale en 2010. Elle revend des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique sise à son domicile. Elle sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour acheter des cartons d’huile, des sacs de riz et autres produits de premières nécessités pour étoffer sa marchandise. Elle souhaite acheter plus de marchandise avec ses profits et renforcer son activité pour devenir grossiste et également assurer l’autosuffisance de sa famille.
texts.en: Farida is a young woman of 29.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  She started her own business in 2010.  Farida re-sells food products from a shop located in her home.  She is requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy boxes of oil, bags of rice and other basic groceries to stock her business.  She would like to buy more merchandise with her profits and strengthen her business so that she can become a wholesaler and thereby guarantee the self-sufficiency of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries

loans.name: Khiraymon

texts.ru: Хираймон во второй раз берет кредит с целью расширения своей деятельности. В этот раз она берет кредит для покупки кондитерских и колбасных изделий. Хираймон очень благодарна Кива и кредиторам Кива.
texts.en: Khiraymon is taking out her second loan with an aim to broaden her business activities.  This time, she is taking out a loan to buy sausage and confectionary items.  Khiraymon is very grateful to Kiva and to Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: to buy sausage and confectionary items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Laylanie

texts.en:
This is Laylanie, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Paul, a seaman, and is a mother.   Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Laylanie operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  Her income is generated by getting supplies at wholesale prices, and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
