Laylanie hopes to have a happy and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from studing the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Épouse d’un transitaire au port, Victoire est une jeune dame âgée de 39 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la restauration et  commercialise de la nourriture préparée à une place aménagée devant son domicile. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 2007 et sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat des produits alimentaires de base. Elle compte investir ses revenus dans une activité parallèle. Elle veut développer son activité et participer financièrement et efficacement à l’éducation de sa famille.
texts.en: Victoire is a young, married woman of 39.  Her husband works as a forwarding agent at the port.  Victoire herself is skilled in food preparation and her business is selling prepared food from a suitably fitted out location in front of her home.  She has been in this business since 2007 and is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy basic ingredients.  She plans to invest her profits in a second business.  Victoire would like to develop her business and participate financially in educating her family.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Djadja

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de 03 enfants, Djadja est une dame âgée de 55 ans. Ses enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Elle est revendeuse des légumes et des produits d’alimentation générale au marché de Hédzranawoé et pratique cette activité depuis 1980. Elle sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle prévoit réinvestir ses profits pour payer des produits supplémentaires. Elle veut renforcer son activité et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djadja is a 55-year-old lady.  She is a widow and the mother of three children.  Her children did not attend school.  Djadja is a re-seller of vegetables and general groceries and works in the market in Hédzranawoé.  She has been in this business since 1980.

Djadja is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy stock for her business.  She plans to re-invest her profits in buying additional products to sell.  She would like to strengthen her business and ensure food security for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es: Martha de 54 años de edad tiene una pequeña miscelánea al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en edades adultas. Su experiencia de negocio inició desde hace 20 años, pues sus padres se dedicaron a la actividad comercial y viéndolos aprendió el oficio, así que cuando estuvo casada empezó a desarrollar esta misma tarea, con el fin de genera ingresos para su hogar y supervisarlo mas de cerca. En la actualidad en su miscelánea vende de contado de lunes a domingos, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, a clientes que ha logrado captar con sus estrategias comerciales personales,  aprendidas a lo largo de su trayectoria. Martha en su negocio vende ropa para damas, calzado y refrescos, en un local ubicado en su propia vivienda, donde los ofrece de contado, en el horario de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, calzado y ropa, pues quiere complacer a sus clientes que ya hicieron sus pedidos, para estar con sus familias bien elegantes en las fiestas de navidades y de año nuevo. Con sus anteriores financiamientos Martha logró ampliar su negocio, realizar mejoras en su local y aumentar su clientela con la cual trabaja día a día,  para ver cumplido sus sueños de prosperidad, entre los que está el que sus hijos tengan su propia casa.
texts.en:
Martha is 54 years old and has a small store in the south-west of the city where she lives with her family.  She is married and has two adult children.  Martha first started gaining business experience 20 years ago as her parents bought and sold products and she learned the trade by watching them.  When she got married she started selling products herself in order to make income for her household whilst, at the same time, being able to keep a close eye on her family.  Martha currently works in her store from Monday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She sells for cash to customers who she has managed to attract with personal selling strategies that she has learned throughout her business life.  In her business, Martha sells ladies' clothing, footwear and soft drinks.  She has a special location in her own home where she makes her sales.

Martha is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) which she will use to buy perfumes, footwear and clothing as she would like to please those customers who have already placed orders with her.  These customers want to see their family members well dressed at Christmas and New Year celebrations.  With her previous loans, Martha managed to expand her business, make some improvements to her premises and increase her customer base.  She never stops working towards her dreams of prosperity.  One of her dreams is for her children to own their own homes.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, footwear and clothing

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 18 лет. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. В этом году она окончила среднюю школу с отличными оценками и поступила в университет. Данное время она является студенткой 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции по специальности Бухгалтер и аудит. Шахноза учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Шахноза ходит на дополнительные уроки английского языка и компьютера. Родители Шахнозы простые рабочие и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Шахноза обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is 18 years old.  She is a very smart and hardworking young woman.  This year, she graduated from high school with excellent grades and she entered the university.  At the present time she is a first-year student at the Tajik State University of Commerce, with a major in accounting and auditing.  Shahnoza is an excellent student and she takes an active part in all university events.  Shahnoza is taking additional classes in English and in computers. 

Shahnoza's parents are ordinary working people and they aren't in a position to pay their child's tuition.  Shahnoza has applied to IMON International for a loan to pay her university tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: Madame Ndunva est  une femme ambitieuse de l’association de crédit ujamaa.  Agée de 52ans,  elle est  mariée  et mère de 9 enfants tous scolarisés.   Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagers  au  marché central depuis plus de 5ans. Elle demande ce credit pour acheter 20 paires de souliers. Son objectif pour l’avenir est de construire une maison d’habitation familiale ; ainsi elle  remercie Hekima pour ces prêts.
texts.en: Ndunva is an ambitious woman who belongs to the Ujamaa loan group.  She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of nine children who have all received an education.  Ndunva's business is selling used shoes in the central market and she has been doing this for 5 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes.  Her future goal is to build a family home.  She is thanks Hekima for these loans.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Risalat

texts.ru: Рисалат 48 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей. 4 детей работают в РФ, младшие двое учатся в школе. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Рисалат начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начатое с земли выделенной государством после распада СССР, хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от животноводства и полеводства. Благодаря упорному труду Рисалат , ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рисалат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку быков и коров. Доходы Рисалат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес за счет увеличения поголовья скота. В её планах дать хорошее образование младшим детям и женить среднего сына.
texts.en:
Risalat is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children.   Four of her children work in the Russian Federation; the youngest two are in school.  As a source of income for her family, Risalat took up animal husbandry and farming.  She started with the piece of land alloted to her by the government after the collapse of the USSR, and today her business brings in about 5,000 som (KGS) from animal husbandry and farming.  Because of Risalat's hard work, she now has four milk cows.   

With an aim to further develop her business, Risalat applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls and cows.  Risalat plans to invest the profit in further growing her business by increasing the size of her herd.  Among her plans are to give her youngest children a good education and to marry off her middle son.

loans.use: to purchase cows and bulls

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: Byabagula est une cliente courage. Elle est présidente du groupe de crédit  Shukrani  depuis 4mois.  Mariée  à un homme d’affaire, elle est  mère de  12 enfants tous scolarisés.  La cliente sollicite ce nouveau credit pour s’approvisionner en  200 paires des souliers usagers.  Elle travaille durement pour réaliser son rêve qui est celui de construire une maison d'habitation. Elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir abondamment.
texts.en: Byabagula is a courageous client who has been president of the Shukrani loan group for four months.  She is married to a businessman and has 12 children who are all in school.  Byabagula is requesting this new loan to buy 200 pairs of used shoes.  She works hard to achieve her dream which is to build a house.  She thanks Hekima and prays that God will bless them greatly.

loans.use: to buy 200 pairs of used shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru:
Ганна – из Виноградово. Она занимается торговлей канцтоварами. Наемных работников у неё нет, работает сама. Очень любит своё дело, занимается им уже 20 лет. 
Ганна хочет вложить полученные от КИВА средства в закупку дополнительной партии товара. Она недавно получила выгодное предложение на закупку товара из Венгрии по сходной цене и очень надеется, что сможет воспользоваться этой возможностью.
texts.en:
Ganna is from Vinogradovo.  She is in the office supplies business.  She has no employees and does everything herself.  She loves her business and has been doing it for 20 years now.

Ganna wants to invest the loan proceeds from Kiva in an additional shipment of goods.  She recently received profitable offer from Hungary for goods on very reasonable terms and she is hoping that she will be able to take advantage of this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy an additional shipment of goods

loans.name: Atabek

texts.ru: Атабек проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 53 года. Атабек женат. У него пятеро детей. Атабек вместе с женой занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он в основном выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности Атабек занимается несколько лет. Он берет кредит для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Atabek lives in the Rudaki region.  He is 53 years old, married, and has five children.  Atabek and his wife are in the farming business.  Primarily he grows vegetables and wheat.  Atabek has been in this line of business for several years.  He is taking out this loan for planting wheat.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина, которая живет далеко от центра области. Ей 41 года, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 11 лет она занимается купле продажей продуктов питания, как конфеты, печенье и т.п. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет своих клиентов. Ее муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Она привозит товар с центра области и стараются обеспечить местных жителей высоко- качественными товарами. Полученный доход она используют для покупки всех продуктов питания для проживания. Однако ее доход не хватает на образования и одежд для детей.  Для получения больше дохода она должна увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки разнообразных конфет и печений. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Firuza is a hardworking and conscientious woman, who lives far from the center of the region. She is 41 years old, married and raising four children. For more than 11 years she has been engaged in selling food products, like candy, biscuits and so on. She sells her products at the local market and has many clients. Her husband helps her in managing the business. She brings products from the center of the region and tries to provide the local residents with high quality products.

Firuza uses the income to purchase food for living. However her income is not enough for education and clothing for the children. To get a higher income she should increase the working capital. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni for the purchase a variety of candies and biscuits. She sets her hopes with you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of candies and biscuits

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда уже несколько раз пользовалась финансовыми услугами КИВА, которые каждый раз существенно содействовали развитию и росту её бизнеса. За счёт получения дополнительной прибыли от предыдущих кредитов Надежда смогла продержаться на плаву во время спада торговли в летнее время, а также позволила себе отдохнуть с семьей на побережье Азовского моря. 
В этот раз Надежда обратилась за суммой в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить дополнительную партию товара, расширить ассортимент представленной группы товаров и продолжать тем самым развивать свой бизнес. Также Надежда надеется сделать ремонт в доме за счет оставшихся свободных средств.
texts.en:
Nadezhda has already taken advantage of Kiva's financial services several times, and each time they have contributed significantly to the development and growth of her business.  Nadezhda used the additional profits from her previous loans to keep her business afloat during a fall-off in sales during the summer, and to allow herself to get some rest with her family at the Sea of Azov.   

This time, Nadezhda has applied for a loan of 21,000 hryven to buy an additional shipment of goods to further develop her business by broadening the range of products she offers for sale.  Nadezhda also hopes to do some home repairs with any funds left over.

loans.use: to buy an additional shipment of goods

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

NWTF is relisting Angelie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nayyar's Group

texts.en:
Nayyar is 26 years old and a hardworking and responsible housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, 2 sons and 2 daughters. Since 2008 her husband has been running a garment shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. Currently he is interested in purchasing some warm clothes for his garment shop, like mufflers, sweaters, school jerseys, babies' warm clothes, etc., but due to financial constraints he is facing some problems. 

For solving that, Nayyar, as a member of a 6-persons' lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband in purchasing clothes for the shop. This will help him to offer a variety of warm clothing to his customers and to increase his net income as well as savings.

Note: In the picture Nayyar holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase warm clothes for her husband's garment shop.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

She has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending. Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap for her scrap selling business.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.en:
Betsy is 28 years old and married with 2 children who currently go to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing. In the future, Betsy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses, footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more rice to sell. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is 35 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She has been in business for two years. She was previously employed in a salon. She is a very hardworking lady. She has learned how to save her money and manage her charcoal business through the help of Faulu Kenya. She hopes to expand her business. She requires a loan of 20,857 KES to increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.use: to increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is a 47-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two young children. He has been engaged in a rice farming business for several years now. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to enhance and produce a good harvest. In the future, Fernando hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 47 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sugar, flour and other ingredients for her food business. In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and other ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 46 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for 3 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Charito aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a 33-year-old business lady who owns a boutique. She has one child and has been in business for two years. She is very hardworking and profit oriented. Her business has grown tremendously since she became a client of Faulu Kenya. She desires to open other boutiques in different areas. She requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy more shoes and clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes for selling.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy sugar, flour and other ingredients for her bakery business. NWTF is re-listing Cherry's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and other ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Beatriz to improve her business. She is making cakes and distributing them to the supermarkets. With the loan she will buy what she needs to make the cakes, such as flour, sugar, oil and other things.

She has been doing this business since 2001 with a working capital of $200. She is making a good income from distributing cakes to supermarkets. She lives in her simple house made of bricks, with zinc for the roof, and she hopes to run a bigger business and improve her living conditions in the future with her income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and other things to make cakes.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Mutalegwa est une femme  entrepreneur âgée de 56 ans.Elle est  membre du groupe de crédit Amani et mère de 13 enfants  tous scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse des habits usagers depuis sa jeunesse raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour lui permettre d'acheter 1 ballon de friperie en terme d'approvisionnement. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir  et finir leurs études. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions et prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en: Mutalegwa is a 56-year-old entrepreneur. She is a member of the loan group Amani and the mother of 13 children who all attend, or have attended, school. She has been selling second-hand clothes since her youth and is requesting this new loan so that she can buy a bale of second-hand clothing for her inventory. She would like to see her children grow up and finish their studies. She thanks Hekima for its help and prays to God to bless the agency.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rikiatou

texts.fr: Rikiatou est une femme de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge du premier est de 25 ans et du dernier 12 ans. Elle a ouvert un mini stand de restauration dans un quartier de la ville qu'elle gère depuis 15 ans et se debrouille bien.  Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des denrées alimentaire telles que haricot, riz, pate alimentaire, huile etc... Ce qui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice non seulement pour augmenter son capital et activité et de satisfaire la clientèle. Elle voudrait ainsi avec ces derniers pouvoir aider son époux à supporter les charges domestiques dans le futur.
texts.en: Rikiatou is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 25 and the youngest, 12. She opened a small stall selling food in a district of town 15 years ago and has been running it successfully since. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy groceries like beans, rice, food paste and oil. This will allow her to make a profit, to increase her working capital and business activities and to satisfy her clientèle. She would also like to use her profits to support her spouse with the household expenses in future.

loans.use: to buy food for her business.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей выращивает огурцы и помидоры в селе Великая Знаменка. Этим бизнесом он занимается вместе со своей семьей уже 5 лет. До того, как Сергей стал заниматься сельским хозяйством, он 11 лет проработал на судостроительном заводе. Потом какое-то время водителем маршрутки. После того, как Сергей потерял руку на работе и ему оформили инвалидность, работы не стало. Тогда-то семья Сергея и решила переехать в село, чтобы прокормиться. За короткое время построили хорошее хозяйство и стало работать на участке все вместе. 
Сергей хотел бы вложить дополнительные средства в размере 10 000 гривен в установку отопления в теплице, в частности в приобретение котла для отопления. У Сергея на участке есть ещё место для теплицы, поэтому он хочет развиваться дальше со временем.
texts.en:
Sergei grows cucumbers and tomatoes in the village of Velikaya Znamenka.  He and his family have been in this business for five years already.  Before he took up farming, he worked 11 years in a shipyard.  After that, he worked for awhile as a taxi bus driver.  He lost his hand at work and, once the disability was officially recorded, he lost his job.  It was then that Sergei's family decided to move to the village so they could at least grow their own food. 

Before long, they had built up a nice farm, and now everyone works the land together.  Sergei would like to invest an additional 10,000 hryven (UAH) in installing a heating system in their greenhouse, in particular buying a boiler for the system.  Because Sergei has room on the land for another greenhouse, in time, he would like to expand further.

loans.use: to install heating in a greenhouse

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa compró en mayor volumen  víveres, ranchos, frutas y verduras,  gracias  a su anterior credikiva., con el que le fue muy bien y ahora está planeando su nueva inversión, por eso acude a un nuevo financiamiento con Kiva, mediante el cual comprará refrescos y bebidas, aceite, arroz, café azúcar, detergentes, que son los artículos que más rotan y le permiten generar una utilidad muy pronto y  por eso no deben faltar en su estantería, especialmente en el mes de Diciembre cuando mas lo solicitan sus clientes. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores: “ Estoy agradecida y feliz por la ayuda recibida , mi negocio y mi familia hemos progresado gracias al apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
With her previous credikiva, Rosa bought supplies in bulk, like different groceries, fruits and vegetables. She did very well and is now planning her next investment. This is why she is requesting a new loan with Kiva.

Rosa will buy beverages, oil, rice, coffee, sugar and detergent. These products have the highest inventory turn, which means that she enjoys the profits more quickly. For this reason, she must have them available all the time, especially during December, when her customers demand them the most.

She says to lenders: “I feel happy and appreciate the help I have received; my business and my family have progressed thanks to the support we have received.”

loans.use: to buy beverages, oil, rice, coffee, sugar and detergent.

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es: Leydi compró mercancía variada, mediante sus guías especializadas de productos y las vendió rápidamente, porque su inversión la hizo sobre pedido y porque tuvo un credikiva a la mano para lograrlo. Hoy se prepara para atender la mejor época comercial del año y es el mes de Diciembre, que llega con todas las festividades familiares, en las que su clientela gasta mucho dinero, para hacer esta celebración en familia y consume justamente los productos que vende Leydi, como perfumería, colonias, cremas faciales y corporales, artículos de aseo personal entre otros.Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, porque su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a su demanda, por eso comprará nuevamente todos estos articulos para satisfacer las necesidades y deseos de su clientela. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva :" !Gracias! por su apoyo, así mismo deseo que sigan desarrollando estos programas de ayuda, para los microempresarios de bajos recursos en Colombia"
texts.en: Leydi used her previous loan to buy a variety of merchandise through her specialized product guides and sold everything quickly because she invested in pre-existing orders and had a Kiva loan on hand to help her achieve her goal.  She is now getting ready for the best commercial season of the year: the month of December.  This month is full of family celebrations on which her customers spend a lot of money so that they can enjoy the season with their families and consume the products that Leydi sells such as perfumes, colognes, face creams, body creams and other personal care items.  It is with this in mind that Leydi is applying for a new Kiva loan.  She does not have enough working capital to meet her demand and so she will use her loan to buy all the products necessary to satisfy her customers' needs and wishes.  She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for your support.  I hope that they continue developing this type of aid program for low income micro-businesspeople in Colombia".

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, face creams, body creams and other personal care items

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр живёт и работает в селе Водяное. Он вместе с женой занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке, а именно выращивает огурцы, помидоры и редис. Тепличный бизнес – основной источник дохода для Александра. Он вкладывает много средств в его развитие и расширение. В этом году Александр делает отопление на втором участке, который недавно приобрел для расширения своего хозяйства.   
Александр планирует вложить сумму в 20 000 гривен в закупку плёнки, семян и удобрений для нового тепличного сезона. Он – очень трудолюбивый, за 6 лет развил большое хозяйство. Видно, что серьезно относится к бизнесу и финансам.
texts.en:
Alexander lives and works in the village of Vodyanoye.  He and his wife grow vegetables on their own land.  In particular, they grow cucumbers, tomatoes, and radish.  Alexander's main source of income is from greenhouse farming.  He invests a lot of resources into its development and expansion.  This year, Alexander is installing heating on a second plot of land, which he recently acquired to expand his farm.  

Alexander is planning to invest 20,000 hryven (UAH) in the purchase of greenhouse film, seed, and fertilizer for the coming greenhouse season.  He is very hardworking.  In six years he has developed a large farming business.  Clearly he's serious about business and finance.

loans.use: to buy greenhouse film, seed, and fertilizer for the coming season

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья – из Великой Знаменки. Она занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом в своем селе. Уже на протяжении 5 лет Наталья выращивает овощи на собственном участке вместе с мужем. В основном это помидоры и огурцы. В начале приходилось много трудиться, чтобы построить теплицы. Последние три года были успешными в бизнесе, потихоньку строились теплицы, развивалось хозяйство и увеличивались доходы. 
Кредит в размере 15 000 гривен понадобился Наталье для того, чтобы построить дополнительную теплицу, предварительно закупив арматуру на 15 000 гривен. Со временем Наталья хотела бы построить третью теплицу, провести отопление в остальных теплицах и построить дом такой, какой хочется иметь их семье, потому что пока они все живут в маленьком доме.
texts.en:
Natalya is from Velikaya Znamenka.  She is in the farming business in her village.  For five years already, Natalya and her husband have been growing vegetables on their own land.  Primarily they grow tomatoes and cucumbers.  At the beginning, they had to work very hard to build greenhouses.  In the last three years they have been successful in their business, little by little building greenhouses, developing their farm, and increasing their income.

Natalya needs a loan of 15,000 hryven (UAH) to finish building a greenhouse, for which she already paid 15,000 hryven for the framing.  In time, Natalia would like to build a third greenhouse, install heating in the others, and to build the house that their family would like to have, since for now they are living in a small house.

loans.use: tofinish building an additional greenhouse for which she already bought the frame for 15,000 hryven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva José compró un carricoche y en mayor volumen víveres para la preparación de sus comidas. Hoy da a conocer sus productos de manera mas elegante y con mayor cobertura de barrios, razón por la cual sus ingresos están creciendo y esto es justamente gracias a su credikiva. Comparte la alegría de haber terminado de pagar su casa y puede brindar un mejor vivir a su familia. Por eso envía el siguiente mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva: " Que sigan apoyando a los pequeños microempresarios a seguir y con esto poder cumplir parte de sus sueños. " Su meta hoy es continuar con el mejoramiento de sus medios de transporte (los bicicoches) y adecuar la cocina además de aumentar su volumen de compras, para ganar descuentos. Esto es justamente en lo que invertirá su nuevo credikiva, al cual aplica y con el que tiene muchas expectativas de crecimiento.
texts.en: José used his previous Kiva loan to buy a three-wheeled vehicle and a large quantity of ingredients for preparing the food that he sells.  He is now able to sell his products in a more elegant manner and reach a larger number of neighborhoods.  For this reason, his income is growing.  All this is thanks to his Kiva loan.  He would like to share the joy he feels at having finished paying for his house and being able to provide his family with a better life.  He sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Please continue supporting micro-businesspeople so that they can fulfill some of their dreams".  José's current goal is to continue improving his means of transport (three-wheeled vehicle), do some work on his kitchen and increase his purchasing power so that he can earn discounts.  This is what he will invest his Kiva loan in.  He is very hopeful of growing his business.

loans.use: to do some work on his kitchen and his old three-wheeled vehicle, and to buy ingredients in large quantities

loans.name: Njoroge

texts.en:
Njoroge is 45 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. For the past 12 years, Njoroge has owned a butchery, and he also earns an income by selling groceries. Through the financial help of Faulu Kenya, he has thus far been able to finance his children's education to the secondary school level.

Now requesting a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy more meat to sell, Njoroge desires to buy a piece of land, build a house, and expand his butchery.

loans.use: to buy more more meat to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 44 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Cristina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 29,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items such as rice, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.  In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 52 years, married and has three children. He owns a butcher shop, which he has been doing for 12 years. He also earns additional income through farming. He was previously employed in a retail shop. He is very hard working and responsible. 

Patrick is requesting a loan for 84,442 KES, which he will use to buy cows for slaughter. Faulu Kenya has helped him learn how to save his money. In the future,  he hopes to expand his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Tusimame Group

texts.fr: Madame Espérance  est  une femme dynamique et  trésorière du  groupe  de credit Tusimame. Elle est âgée de 33 ans avec  4 enfants tous scolarisés.Mariée à un homme sans emploi, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour s’approvisionner en 4 ballons des draps de lit afin d'assurer la survie de sa famille.  Elle souhaite la croissance de son entreprise et ainsi la cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en: Espérance is a dynamic woman and the treasurer of the loan group Tusimame. She is 33 years old and has 4 children who all attend school. Married to an unemployed man, she is requesting this new loan so that she can buy 4 bales of bedsheets for resale to ensure her family's survival. She would like her business to increase, and thanks Hekima for its actions.

loans.use: to buy 4 bales of bedsheets.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Mercancía variada, como cubrelechos, ropa interior y hasta bolsa de agua para vender, fue lo que compró Rosalba gracias a su credikiva, con el cual aumentó sus inventarios, vendió mucho más y también generó mayores ingresos que lo acostumbrado. Su negocio ha crecido y siente en su vida mucha estabilidad, por eso da gracias a Kiva por el favor de prestarle dinero, con el que obtuvo esos logros. En la actualidad se prepara para atender la temporada de navidad y de año nuevo,  época en la cual sus ventas se incrementan y debe tener buenos inventarios para impactar a sus clientes y despertar su atención, interés, deseo y su acción de compra. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el que comprará,  ropa interior y exterior, que ya está encargada por su clientela y hará de su credikiva un total éxito.
texts.en:
Rosalba used her previous Kiva loan to buy a variety of goods such as bedspreads, underwear and even bags of water.  She managed to increase her stock, sell a lot more products and make more income than usual.  Her business has grown and she feels like she now has a lot more stability in her life.  She thanks Kiva for having loaned her the money which allowed her to make these achievements. 

Rosalba is currently getting ready for the Christmas and New Year season.  This is a time of year when her sales increase and she must have good stock available if she wants to impress her customers and draw their attention, interest and desire to buy.  This is why she is applying for a new Kiva loan which she will use to buy clothing and underwear.  She already has orders for these items from her customers which means her Kiva loan will be a complete success.

loans.use: to buy clothing and underwear

loans.name: Lexi Leticia

texts.es:
Lexi Leticia tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil soltera  tiene cuatro hijos vive con los hijos en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el el recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias. 

Lexi Leticia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. Con el credito podra comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El credito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es comprar un sistema de riesgo para el tiempo de verano para poder sembrar mas. 

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Lexi Leticia, 39, is single and has four children.  She lives with her children in the El Jobo area in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She belongs to Nuevo Jerusalén Communal Bank in El Jobo, Ventanas Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Lexi Leticia makes a living growing corn and rice.  With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.

She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy an irrigation system for the summer to be able to plant more.  In her free time she likes to play sports and clean the house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
It is common in Bali for women to raise pigs at home in order to supplement the husband's income. Apart from farming, raising livestock, especially pigs, can help meet the needs of daily life. There are several obstacles to developing the business, such as limited knowledge of business management as well as limited access to capital. To overcome these problems, the Pudak Sari Wangi group was created to communicate among members and to acquire funding.

Ni Luh is 47 years old and is the head of the Pudak Sari Wangi group, which runs a pig breeding business. To increase the bussines, Ni Luh invited group members to participate in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. This loan will be used to buy two piglets and feed. In a period of five months, pigs are ready to sell. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family economy.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase leather and shoelaces for shoe making business.

loans.name: Timoleon

texts.fr: Timoleon est un camerounais de 55 ans, marié et père de 03 enfants. il possède et gère une boutique de vente de poulets dans un coin de la ville depuis 5 ans. C'est grace à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Expérimenté dans ce domaine, la bonne connaissance de ses fournisseurs lui permet d'acheter à de bon prix pour pouvoir ameliorer son activité. Il sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de poulets (reformé et nettoyé). les bénéfices générés par ce crédit lui permettront d'agrandir son activité et économiser le reste pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition, santé, scolarité)
texts.en: Timoleon is a 55-year-old Cameroonian who is married and the father of 3 children. He has owned and run a store selling chicken in an area of town for 5 years. It is thanks to this business that he can meet the needs of his family. He has good experience in this area of work and knows his suppliers well, which allows him to buy goods at low prices so that he can improve his business. He is requesting this loan so that he can increase his inventory of chicken (cull hens - hens which do not lay anymore, cleaned). The profits generated thanks to this loan will enable him to increase his business, and he will save the rest of the money so that he can take care of his family's needs (food, health, education).

loans.use: to buy chicken for resale.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Elise est une femme de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants. elle a un petit stand de vente de vivres secs dans un quartier de la ville depuis 8 ans qu'elle gère avec serieux.  Elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des marchandises telles que les arachides, le maïs, le riz etc.. pour pouvoir satisfaire non seulement sa clientèle mais aussi accroitre ses revenus. le benéfice tiré de ce prêt lui permettra d'agrandir son activité avec le temps, de subvenir à ses besoins, mais aussi aux besoins grandisssants de ses enfants.
texts.en: Elise is a 43-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 2 children. She has had a small stall selling dried food in a district of town for 8 years, which she runs diligently. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise like groundnuts, corn and rice, in order not only to satisfy her clientèle, but also to increase her income.The profits she earns thanks to this loan will allow her to increase her business over time and to meet her needs and the growing needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy food for resale.

loans.name: Marcia Mercedes

texts.es:
Marcia Mercedes tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene dos hijos vive con los hijos en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el el recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias. Marcia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. 

Con el credito podra comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El credito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es compara un terreno para seguir sembrando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y ver la televesion
texts.en:
Marcia Mercedes, 34, is single and has two children.  She lives with her children in the El Jobo area of Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. She belongs to Nuevo Jerusalén Communal Bank in El Jobo, Ventanas Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Marcia Mercedes makes a living growing corn and rice. With the loan she'll be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.

She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land to continue growing crops. In her free time she likes to rest and watch television.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живёт и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на крупном местном рынке женской одеждой. У неё своё торговое место, опыт работы – 12 лет. 
Надежде важно закупить товар к зимнему сезону, особенно перед праздниками, когда многие приходят на рынки за подарками. Она надеется вложить сумму в 22 000 гривен в приобретение изделий из трикотажа и халатов под последующую реализацию.
texts.en:
Nadezhda lives and works in Melitopol. She sells women's clothing at a large central market. She has her own sales stall and 12 years of experience in the work. 

It is important for Nadezhda to purchase goods for the winter season, especially before the holidays, when many people go to the market to get presents. She hopes to invest 22,000 hryvnia in purchasing knitted goods and gowns to sell.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in the winter season

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий – из Хуста. Он торгует женской обувью и одеждой в своём регионе. Раньше Виталий занимался выездной торговлей по сёлам. Потом купил стационарно оборудованное место на одном из рынков своего города, заплатив за него 14 000 гривен. 
Виталию необходима сумма в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести зимний товар по сезону. Полученную прибыль Виталий надеется вложить в развитие бизнеса и образование старшей дочери. Виталий очень любит свою семью и заботится о том, чтобы у них было всё необходимое.
texts.en:
Vitaliy is from Khoost.  He sells women's shoes and clothes locally.  Vitaliy used to travel village to village selling, but he bought a stall for 14,000 hryven (UAH) at the local market that is not equipped for travel.

Vitaliy needs 20,000 hryven in order to buy inventory for the winter season.  Vitaliy hopes to invest the profit he earns in developing his business and in his eldest daughter's education.  Vitaliy loves his family very much and he makes sure that they have all the necessities.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ma.elena

texts.en:
Ma.elena is 47 years old and married, with two children.

Ma.elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 19 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma.elena aspires to save money to expand her business and buy farmland.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines, and other groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 50 years old, married, and has children.  She is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Marilou earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Marilou is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilou faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from Gods.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es: Con su credikiva, Ruby compró una vitrina y la surtió de accesorios y celulares, mercancía que ha rotado rápidamente, ha generado muchos mas clientes y le da la oportunidad de reinvertir y ganar un poco mas. Se acercan las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo, temporada en la cual las ventas de estos productos se incrementan y necesita está dispuesta a vender lo que sus clientela necesita; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva con el cual comprará una nueva vitrina exhibidora y en mayor volumen accesorios para celulares que le generan mas ingresos. Ella envía un mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva " Agradecemos la colaboración a todas las personas que nos apoyaron, porque gracias al crédito el negocio ha crecido poco a poco."
texts.en:
With her Kiva loan, Ruby bought a display case and stocked it with cell phones and cell phone accessories.  This merchandise has turned over quickly, attracted many more customers and given her the opportunity to reinvest and improve her earnings.  With the Christmas and New Year holidays approaching, sales of these products increase, and she needs to increase her inventory in order to meet customer demand.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan with which she will buy a new display case and greater quantities of cell phone accessories, which generate more income for her.

Ruby sends this message to Kiva lenders:  “We are grateful for the collaboration of all those who supported us, because thanks to the loan our business has grown little by little.”

loans.use: to buy a new display case and to buy cell phone accessories in larger quantities.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel  tiene 26 años es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con la mamá en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Es integrante de la VRC EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Miguel Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra y vende los productos en Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, liquido mata monte abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. El sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar màs maìz.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte y participando en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 26 years old, single and has a son who lives with his mother. He lives in the rural community of Aguas Frías de Mocache, in the canton of Mocache.
He's a member of the "El Progreso" communal bank, which is located in the rural community of Aguas Frías de Mocache, in the canton of Mocache. The communal bank works in short cycle farming such as growing corn and rice.
Miguel Ángel works in agriculture and grows corn and rice. He buys and sells the produce in Mocache.
He requested the loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, urea, herbicide and compost for his crops. The loan helped him to increase his profits so that he can support his family and invest in his crops. His dream is to buy plots of land in order to sow more corn.
He greatly enjoys spending his free time playing sports and being involved in his community.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, urea, herbicide and compost for his crops.

loans.name: Gulshair

texts.ru: Гулшайыр 63 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Гулшайыр средне- специальное образование. Характер у заявителя трудолюбивый и целеустремленный, предприимчивый и перспективный. Главной ценностью жизни считает своих детей.  На сегодня в хозяйстве Гулшайыр имеется 2,4 га, где она выращивает эспарцет. В животноводстве она добилась того, что у нее в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы. Животноводством начала заниматься 1996 году начальный капитал был в размара 3,000 KGS сом.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса за счет животноводства, Гулшайыр обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Гулшайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulshair is 63 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Gulshair has vocational education. This is a hardworking and purposeful entrepreneur, who is prospective and enterprising. The most valuable thing in her life is her children. Gulshair currently has 2,4 hectares at her farm, where she grows sainfoin (a crop type). She has also managed to get three cows on her farm. She started working with livestock breeding in 1996, and the starting capital was around 3,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business through livestock breeding, Gulshair turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle. Gulshair plans to invest the income in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. У нее есть свои теплицы в Великой Знаменке, где она выращивает в основном огурцы и помидоры вот уже 6 лет. 
Надежда планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 20 000 гривен в строительство дополнительной теплицы, а именно в приобретении арматуры для неё. Так как есть свободная земля на собственном участке, хочется использовать и её под теплицы. В своё время Надежда переехала из Киева в Знаменку. Она любит жизнь в селе и совсем не боится сельской жизни и тяжёлой работы.
texts.en:
Nadezhda works with farming. She has her own greenhouses in Velikaya Znamenka, where she for 6 years has been growing mainly cucumbers and tomatoes. 

Nadezhda plans to invest the loan from Kiva, in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia, in building additional greenhouses, more precisely armature for them. As there is free land at her own plot, she would like to use it for greenhouses as well. 

Nadezhda moved from Kiev to Znamenka. She loves life in the village and is not afraid of rural life and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase armature for building additional greenhouses

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина использовала предыдущий кредит КИВА для того, чтобы построить дополнительную теплицу. Построив её, семье удалось после хорошего сезона увеличить доход с огорода до 130 000 гривен за сезон. Более того, они смогли также благоустроить двор, сделав летнюю площадку, купили автомобиль для бизнеса, а муж приобрёл ценные и дорогие электроинструменты для работы: дрель и бетономешалку. 
В этот раз Ирина надеется вложить сумму, полученную от КИВА, в размере 24 000 гривен в постройку трёх новых теплиц на своём участке, сделав их под отоплением. В результате этого доход может увеличиться в два раза. 
Примечание: на фотографии Ирина стоит рядом со своим мужем, который активно помогает ей в бизнесе.
texts.en:
Irina used her previous loan from Kiva to build an additional greenhouse. Having built it, the family managed to increase the income from the garden after a great season, to 130,000 hryvnia for the full season. Moreover, they were also able to landscape the yard, making a summer pavilion. They purchased a vehicle for the business, and her husband purchased valuable and expensive power tools for his work: A drill and a cement mixer. 

This time, Irina hopes to invest the amount received from Kiva, in the amount of 24,000 hryvnia, in building three new greenhouses at her plot of land, making them heated. As a result of this, the income may increase up to double. In the picture, Irina stands next to her husband, who actively helps her manage the business.

loans.use: to build three new greenhouses at her plot of land

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун родилась в селе Светлая поляна (Ыссык- Кульская область, Кыргызстан). Мать троих детей - двух дочерей и сына. Разведена и проживает со младшим сыном. Турсун родилась в простой семье фермера. Она с детства помогала маме по хозяйству и любила заниматься домашними хлопотами. После окончания школы устроилась в местном колхозе в качестве чабана. В настоящее время занимается сельским хозяйством и животноводством. Основным источником для семьи является животноводство.Характер у заявителя очень хороший и спокойный. Начали они свой бизнес в 1996 году с 2,000 KGS.На сегодня данный бизнес приносит около 8,000 KGS. Турсун обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)на приобретение дополнительных голов скота, в целях откорма и посл едущей реализации. На доходы полученные от данного проекта она планирует женить сына и улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Tursun was born in the village of Svetlaya Polyana (Issyk Kul Province, Kyrgyzstan).  She is the mother of three children:  two daughters and a son.  She is divorced and lives with the youngest child, her son.  Tursun was born into a ordinary farmer's family.  Beginning in her childhood, she helped her mother around the farm and she loved to attend to all the household chores.  After she finished school, she got a job as a shepherd on the local collective farm.  Currently, she works in farming and animal husbandry.  The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry.  She has a very good and calm temperment.   They began the business in 1996 with 2,000 som (KGS).  Today, the business brings in about 8,000 KGS.  

Tursun applied ot Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional cattle, which she plans to fatten and later sell.  With the profit from this project, she plans to marry off her son and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 22 years of age. He owns a retail shop. He used his previous loan to buy soda, baking flour, and cooking fat. His business did very well and he successfully repaid his loan. He has been in business for three years. 

He describes his business as very busy and he faces lots of competition from other shops. Faulu Kenya has helped him buy furniture and he has also improved his living standards. He hopes to own a wholesale shop. 

Kelvin requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 26 years old and she is married. She has been working hard for the past few years, but she is still having a lot of difficulties in the family. 

Adelia has a kiosk in front of her house. This is the only way she can generate income, but she does not have enough working capital to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $400.

She is applying for a loan of $1,000 USD to buy some additional items, such as coffee, sugar, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other stock to keep in her kiosk. She lives in a town near the city; it is easy for her to make her way to buy things from the market.

She is happy with Tuba Rai Metin (TRM) activities that offer loans to poor people, especially women. With the income, she hopes to make her business bigger in the future and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other stock for her kiosk.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 42 years old, married, and has two children.

Erlyn works hard to provide for her children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Erlyn has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Erlyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is 62 years old, married, and has three children. He used his previous loan to rent business premises and add a stock of clothes. His business did very well, and he repaid his loan. He sells second-hand goods and is also involved in dairy farming. He has been in business for 22 years. Faulu Kenya has enabled him learn how to save. He describes his business as very good and his customers as loyal. He is very hard-working and responsible.
He hopes to open another outlet for second hand goods and to increase his profits in the future. He has requested a loan of 63,585 KES to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 44 years old, married, and has three children.

Erna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more bread, soft drinks, rice and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Erna has been in this business for 14 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Erna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bread, soft drinks, rice and other miscellaneous items for her store.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 53 years old, married, and has five children. Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Elma has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Elma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old, married, and she supports a family of eight. She runs a retail shop in Marigat. This has been her income-generating business for the last four years, where she gets an average monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES after successfully paying her previous loan. With this loan, she intends to purchase more stock for her retail shop and a solar panel for lighting. 

She anticipates getting profits which she will use to expand her business by increasing the stock of items for sale to meet her clients' demands. 

Joyce hopes to improve her living standards and to be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her retail shop and a solar panel for lighting.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 66 years old, married, and has seven children. She owns a shop, which she has had for 30 years. She also earns additional income through farming. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for 20,857 KES, which she will use to buy soda, cooking fat, baking flour, maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. She hopes to expand her business and buy more land for arming. She is very hard working and thanks to Faulu Kenya she has learned how to save her money.

loans.use: to purchase soda, cooking fat, baking flour, maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan to again buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She also has a cellphone loading station, and part of the loan will be used in buying cellphone load credits. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmen dreams to be successful in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 58 years old and the married mother of six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Edna has a general store business in the Philippines. Edna requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like rice, bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

Edna has been in this business for two years. In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is aged 45. She is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and five children who are all schooling. Lucy has been in farming for the past six years, producing maize, vegetables and milk, which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She will then sell the poultry products and earn extra income that will help her uplift her livelihood and pay for her children's schooling. She wishes to own a posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour) in the next five years.

Poor prices for products, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He owns rental houses from which he earns an income, which he has been doing for 17 years. He was previously employed as an electrical contractor. He is very hard working and committed to his work. 

Robert is requesting a loan for 105,300 KES, which he will use to construct more rental houses. He hopes to excel in life and expand his business. Faulu Kenya has made him disciplined and he has learned how to save his money.

loans.use: to construct more rental houses.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Eufemia runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

Eufemia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more grocery items to sell to her customers.  In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ukumbusho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida est présidente de l’association de credit Ukumbusho. Elle est âgée de 49 ans et mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés.  Le credit sollicité va lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 8 sacs de braises qu’elle revendra. Son souhait  est  que son entreprise grandisse pour assurer la survie de sa famille.  Ainsi elle remercie Hekima infiniment d’avoir encouragé les femmes  au travail.
texts.en:
Faida is the president of the Ukumbusho credit group. She is 49 years old and is the mother of seven children - all in school. The loan will be used to purchase eight bags of charcoal which she will resell. Her hope is that her business will grow to ensure her family's survival.
Thus she is grateful to Hekima for assisting working women.

loans.use: to purchase eight bags of charcoal.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Erbina

texts.es:
Maria Erbina tiene 62 años de edad de estado civil esposa tiene un hijo vive con los padres en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el el recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias. 

Maria Erbina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y arroz. Con el credito podra comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El credito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es tener dinero para comprar una casa y mas terreno para seguir sembrando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Erbina is 62 years old. She's married and has a son who lives with his parents in the rural community of El Jobo, in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.
She's a member of the "Nuevo Jerusalén" communal bank, which is located in the rural community of El Jobo, in the canton of Ventanas. The communal bank works in farming and raising animals.
Maria Erbina works in agriculture and grows corn and rice. With the loan she'll be able to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, compost and insecticide in order to avoid pests and diseases. She buys the supplies in the town of Ventanas. The loan helps her to increase her profits and expand her crop.
Her dream is to have enough money to buy a house and a larger plot of land in order to keep on growing her crops.
In her free time, she enjoys cleaning the house.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, compost and insecticide in order to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca de 53 años de edad, soltera con  hijos mayores de edad. Originaria de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Juana se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora, de buenas costumbres.  La actividad económica de Juana es un molino ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 20 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio consiste en prestar el servicio para moler, maíz, trigo, cacao, semillas. El negocio surgió de su familia y con el tiempo ha sido el medio de vida para ella y sus hijos. Y por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo digno. Juana Francisca agradece la ayuda  que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Juana Francisca is 53 years old, single, and her sons are all grown up. She comes from Chinandega, in the western part of the country. She is responsible, hard-working, and has good morals. She has been providing milling services at her house for 20 years. She grinds sweetcorn, wheat, cacao, and seeds. She inherited the business from her family, and it has supported her and her sons all these years. Juana Francisca is happy to have honest work. She thanks Kiva lenders for the help they give to those who have a low income in poor countries such as Nicaragua, because it makes it possible for them to have honest work.

loans.use: to have a working capital and do maintenance work on her grinders.

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.ru: Сохибджон кредитуется третий цикл. Он очень добросовестный человек. Он женат и его жена домохозяйка. Его младший брат и родители живут с ним и поэтому у него очень большая семья. Сохибджон более 7 лет занимается перевозкой грузов своим грузовиком. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов на местном рынке пиломатериалов. Полученный доход он использует для содержания большой семьи. Он собирается отремонтировать дом, так как их дом не отвечает стандартам жилья. Сохибджон не имеет денег для покупки строительных материалов, чтобы сделать ремонт.  Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000  сомони для покупки строительных материалов, цемент и древесину для ремонта дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sohibjon is taking out his third loan. He is a very conscientious man.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  He has a very big family as his parents and younger brother live with him.  For over seven years Sohibjon has been in the hauling business and he has his own truck.  He has regular clients at the local lumber market.  He uses his income to support his large family.  He is getting ready to remodel his house because it doesn't meet the standards of a house.  Sohibjon doesn't have the money for building materials needed for the remodel.  

He is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy building supplies, cement, and lumber for remodeling his house.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building supplies, cement, and lumber

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan from TRM, which she will use to buy second-hand t-shirts, skirts, jeans, and bags. She sells second-hand clothes in front of her house near the main road and earns good money from her business.  In the future, Maria hopes to improve her living conditions with the income.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand t-shirts, skirts, jeans, and bags.

loans.name: Kwagalana Group

texts.en:
Annet is a 25-year-old single mother who started a hairdressing business in Nansana, a suburb of Kampala, after dropping out of school when her disabled single mother failed to take her for further education. She then decided to start working as a hairdresser, a job she has done for over four years.

Annet has recently been enrolled in a UGAFODE group, where she has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings to buy hair relaxer oil and artificial hair for her salon business. She will be able to make some good profits since most women will be treating their hair to look good during Christmas. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house where she can stay with her disabled mother.

Annet is the second from left in the first row.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, artificial hair and hair oil.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 55-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and ten children. Three of the children are still in school. Daniel has been in farming for the past eight years, producing eggs and milk which he sells at the local market.

Daniel is requesting a 45,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He will later sell the eggs and earn extra income that will help uplift his livelihood. He will use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling. Daniel aspires to have 3,000 poultry birds and be the leading supplier of eggs at his local market.

The high cost of feed, along with pests and diseases for the poultry are Daniel's major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beads and other material for jewelry making.

loans.name: Margarita Rosa

texts.es:
Margarita  de 43 años de edad, es una mujer casada, que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 21 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en profesionales de éxito. Su esposo ha sido el patrocinador de su emprendimiento, pues con sus ahorros suministró el primer capital semilla, para que Margarita diera curso libre a su aptitud emprendedora y comercial, pues desde sus abuelos se han dedicado por tradición a ser comerciantes. Cuando inició su negocio,  lo hizo vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinos, poco a poco éste  fue creciendo,  debido a que  concentró mucha clientela y hoy no solo vende ropa,  sino todo tipo de electrodomésticos que le encarguen.  
En sus 7 años de experiencia  en su negocio, ha logrado ahorrar para levantar su vivienda, y para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el hogar. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito diariamente, mientras sus compras las hace de contado y en almacenes mayoristas, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche con una frecuencia diaria. La meta de su negocio es abrir un almacén  donde pueda ofrecer diversidad de sus productos, a su distinguida clientela y ganar  el mercado de los compradores potenciales que la circundan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado y electrodomésticos sobre los pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, pues es época de navidad y de año nuevo,  y hay dinero circulante dispuesto para el consumo entre  las familias que le compran, situación que ella aprovechará teniendo todo lo que ellos necesitan gracias a la obtención de un credikiva.
texts.en:
Margarita, 43, is a married woman who has two children, ages 13 and 21.  She dreams of seeing them become successful professionals.  Her husband has sponsored her undertaking because his savings provided her first seed capital.  This way Margarita was able to give free reign to her entrepreneurial and business aptitude, because since her grandparents there's a tradition of being merchants.

She started her business selling clothing to her neighbors.  Little by little this grew and she brought together a lot of customers.  Today she sells not only clothing but every type of electrical appliance they request.

In her seven years of experience with her business she has managed to save to build her house and has helped her husband support the household.  She makes her sales on credit every day, while she makes her purchases in cash in wholesale warehouses.  She works from 7 in the morning until 7 at night every day.
