Her business goal is to open a store where she can offer a variety of products to her distinguished customers and earn the market of potential buyers around her.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she'll buy clothing, footwear, and electrical appliances for the requests her customers have made.

This is the Christmas and New Year season and there's disposable income among the families who buy from her.  Thanks to getting a Kiva loan she'll make the most of this situation by having everything her customers need.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and electrical appliances

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет 57 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей.После развала СССР, настали тяжелые времена для всех и каждый выберал свой путь обеспечения семьи едой. Получив свой участок и коллективного колхоза в 1990 году Бермет начала занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 3,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бермет имеется 3 дойная корова, 6 овец, 3,42 га поливной земли где ежегодно сеет  пшеницу,экспарцет и картофель. Приоритетной целью на сегодняшний день для Бермет,  создать необходимую материальную базу для детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и бычков, для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и построить дом на своем участке.
texts.en:
Bermet is 57 years old, married, and she raised four children.  With the collapse of the USSR, difficult times began for everyone, and each chose his own way to provide food for his family.  Having received her own plot from the collective farm in 1990, Bermet began a business in animal husbandry and farming with 3,000 som (KGS).  Today, Bermet has three milk cows, six sheep, and 3.42 hectares of irrigated land where she grows wheat, sainfoin, and potatoes.  Nowadays, Bermet's main priority is to provide her children with a firm foundation.

With plans to further develop her business, Bermet applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and bulls, which she will fatten and later sell.  Bermet plans to invest the profits in further growing her business and in building a home on her own land.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and bulls

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old, married, and has six children who attend school.  She is a  farmer in Kitale. Kenya, which she has been doing for 15 years.  She produces milk, vegetables, and maize, which she sells at the local market in her area.  Poor infrastructure and high competition are her major challenges in farming. 

Rose is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 62,400 KES, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow.  This loan will result in more produce and increase Rose's income, which will improve her livelihood and also help her pay for her children's schooling. She hopes to have five dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 76 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Felicidad has a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years.   

Felicidad is requesting a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items such as snack foods, sardines, and other groceries. In the future, Felicidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, sardines, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen used her prior loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more quantities of dried fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Helen is requesting another loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more chickens. The more chickens displayed at her stall the better. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

As a CCT community partner, Helen faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to be sold in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, age twenty-seven, is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children. Both her children are in school. She has been in farming for the past ten years, producing horticultural crops, poultry products, and maize, which she sells at the local market in her area. She owns a motor bike for transportation as an additional source of income. 

Joyce is requesting a 70,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She will sell the products and earn extra income, which will help her uplift her living standards and pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have doubled her farming in the next five years.

High costs of production, an unreliable market, and unreliable rains are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rickshaw body for transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is a hard-working woman who takes the responsibility of generating income for her family by running a kiosk in front of her house. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with working capital of $600.00. 

Ermelinda is applying for a loan from TRM to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as noodles, biscuits, candles, and rice. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, such as noodles, biscuits, candles, and rice

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. She is requesting another loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more vegetables. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Virginia would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to purchase more vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She also has a direct-selling business for additional income.

Virginia dreams that her children will be entrepreneurs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violate is 61 years old and married with six children.

Violate works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, school supplies and various groceries.

Violate has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Violate aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, school supplies and varoius groceries.

loans.name: Al-Wafa Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Wafa which consists of four ladies who live in Haja, Yemen. Saleha is 40 years old and is the leader of this group. She works hard  to offer a good life for her family. She has 10 children who live in Haja. She would like to complete the building of her house. She has saved money but  is not enough to build. So, she applied for a loan of 50000 YER to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her home.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan to purchase merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in meeting their personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evelyn hopes to give her children a quality education and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members* to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall. NWTF is presenting Teresita's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 35 years old and she works in a hospital. She lives with her family in a town near the city.

Jacinta has a taxi that helps her to generate a good income in addition to her salary. Now she is applying for a loan of $600.00 to repair her taxi. She hopes to buy a new taxi in the future.

loans.use: to repair her taxi

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. NWTF is presenting Susana's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El señor Eloy vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja como grafico en una imprenta, la casa está ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de la Paz.

Eloy, percibe solo un sueldo donde trabaja  más de ocho horas, el crédito que solicita es para terminar la obra fina de su habitación. Es decir poder poner puertas y ventanas arreglar el piso que aun es de tierra, para que en navidad tenga un ambiente agradable su vivienda.

El sueño de Eloy es tener su imprenta propia, y en el futuro generar más ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la tercera vez con IMPRO  y la primera con KIVA, que tiene los créditos, y está muy satisfecho con el crédito.
texts.en:
Eloy lives in his parent's house.  He works as a graphic designer for a printer.  His house is located in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz. 

Eloy earns only his salary from his job. He works more than 8 hours a day.  He will use this loan to do some finishing work on his house, specifically, to put in doors and windows and to fix the floor which is currently made of dirt.  This way, he will have a nice environment in his home for Christmas.

Eloy's dream is to have his own printing press, so that in the future he could generate more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his house

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, reside  el Señor Luis Javier,  estado civil acompañado,  con 45 años de edad,  posee un pequeño negocio de venta de disco  y  una pulpería  que la tiene desde hace 6 años,  debido a dificultades económicas decidió emprender estos negocios, gracias a sus empeño por salir adelante, siente que le han funcionados sus negocios. 

El  negocio de venta de disco consiste en vender  discos de películas y músicas para DVD, este negocio lo atiende él en las tardes. La pulpería la tiene en su casa quienes atienden en ausencia de el, es su esposa e hija. 
Esto lo hace con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hija que se encuentra estudiando en la universidad y quiere una buena formación para su futuro que espera le ayude a superarse. 

solicita a Ceprodel un financiamiento que le permita re abastecer con más productossu negocio; comprara Películas DVD, limpiadores de disco, gaseosas coca cola, arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel  scouts. y así poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Javier, 45, lives in the department of Masaya with his live-in partner. For six years, he has owned a small business selling DVDs and a grocery store. Facing financial troubles, he decided to open the businesses. His hard work has helped him get ahead, and the businesses are successful. In the afternoons, he sells DVD films and music. The grocery store is in his house, and when he is not home, his wife and daughter wait on customers. 

His purpose is to help his daughter, who is a college student, succeed, and he hopes she receives the training necessary to have a bright future. He applied to Ceprodel for a loan to stock more inventory and buy DVD films, disc cleaners, sodas, rice, sugar, oil, and paper towels to offer his customers better service.

loans.use: to buy DVD films, disc cleaners, sodas, rice, sugar, oil, and paper towels.

loans.name: Mehroj

texts.ru: Мехроджу 19 лет. Он молодой, красивый и умный человек. Он не женат и живет вместе с родителями. Он учится на 2 курсе Таджикского Экономического Института по специальности налогового дела. В дальнейшем хочет стать хорошим специалистом, но для этого он должен окончить университет. Если он не заплатит за учебу, то его исключат с университета. В этом году его родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебу. Мехродж запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mehroj is 19 years old.  He is a handsome and smart young man.  He isn't married and lives with his parents.  He is a second-year student at the Tajik Economics Institute, majoring in matters of taxation.  He wants to someday be a proficient expert, but to become one he has graduate from the university.  If he doesn't pay his tuition, he will be expelled from the university.  His parents aren't in a position to pay for his studies this year.  Mehroj is requesting a loan for paying his tuition.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his tuition

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, soap, canned goods, and other groceries for her store.

NWTF is re-listing Fima's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, soap, canned goods, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling salt and fermented fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to buy more salt and fermented fish to sell to customers.

NWTF is re-listing Gloria's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy salt and fermented fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rosita works hard to support her family. She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and a variety store business. 

Rosita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers. Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 36 years old. She lives with her husband in the small village of Akhmeta district, East Georgia. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows and a calf. The milk is used in cheese production. Naira sells cheese locally in an open market at a good price. They also have a vineyard and sell wine locally. Naira is a very hard-working woman and has rich experience in her business. 

Naira has requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing calves she will be able to expand her dairy business. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Naira awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es: Katerine de 28 años de edad vive en un barrio tradicional de la ciudad de Barranquilla al sur de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Allí se dedica  desde hace 7 años, a la venta de productos variados como colonias, perfumería productos capilares y de uso personal. Negocio que nació de su propia iniciativa de apoyar los gastos de su hogar y con el que poco a poco ha logrado aumentar el bienestar del mismo. Los productos los ofrece mediante guías especializadas, que le suministra una empresa ala que está afiliada y desde donde toma sus pedidos producto de la preventa. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito con una frecuencia diaria y sus compras las realiza de contado, actividades derivadas de su negocio por las que trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su clientela está conformada por vecinos, amigos, compañeros de estudio y todo a quien conoce y lo identifica como su cliente potencial, observa su necesidad o deseo y le ofrece producto a producto. Su meta es organizar un almacén donde ofrecer todos los productos que su vecindad  necesita o anhela comprar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, con el cual comprará cremas faciales y corporales, productos de tocador, etc.  Con ello incrementará su capital de trabajo para comprar en mayor volumen y obtener descuentos especiales que beneficien a su clientela que desde ya ha hecho sus pedidos y con los que ella ganará un poco mas.
texts.en: Katerine is 28 years old and lives in a traditional neighborhood south of the city of Barranquilla with her spouse and their four-year-old son. She has worked there for seven years selling a variety of products, such as lotions, perfumes, skin products and personal use products.  She started this business out of her own initiative to help with the home expenses and with it she has been able to improve the condition of her home.  The products she offers are in a specialized catalog, which is provided by a company that she is affiliated to and from which she takes the orders from the sales she makes.  Sales are frequently made on credit terms and purchases of merchandise are made on cash terms, she works on business activities from 7 AM to 9 PM.  Her clients are neighbors, friends, classmates and anyone that she can identify as a potential customer; she pays attention to their needs or wishes and offers them products.  Her goal is to organize a store where she can offer products that her neighbors want or wish to buy.  She is currently applying for a Kiva credit, with which she will buy facial and body lotions, cosmetics, etc.  With this she will increase her working capital to buy more volume and get special discounts that will benefit her clients that have already put orders in and that she will make a bit more money on.

loans.use: to buy facial and body lotions, cosmetics, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Manuel is an enterprising 38-year-old man, who lives with his wife.  He is currently seeking a loan to buy supplies such as fertiliser and fumigant.  He wants to protect his coffee plants, so as to keep them in good condition during their growth and, thereby, obtain a high-quality product.  The only thing stopping him is the fact that he lacks the money to continue production.  He and his wife depend on the business for their livelihood and it is for this reason that he is applying for a loan.  This FUDECOSUR loan is his first; he has no other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted him the loan with better loan facilities and with much lower interest rates...

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gustavo es una persona de temple, muy trabajador, honesto y emprendedor, Don Gustavo es padre soltero, vive con su hija a la cual ama con toda su vida, y le enseña valores cristianos para que sea una buena mujer, don gustavo se define como una persona alegre, muy carismatico y solidario con la gente que lo necesita, son estas cualidades que le han hecho merecedor del carino de su comunidad y de sus colegas de trabajo.

El credito solicitado a Fodemi, se lo va a invertir en la pintada y en el arreglo mecanico del taxi, especificamente el motor, ya que como el taxi es antiguo tiene algunas falencias, Gustavo dice que es importante tener en perfectas condiciones su taxi para dar seguridad y confort a sus clientes.

El sueño que Don Gustavo tiene es seguir trabajando dia a dia para brindarle la mejor educación a su hija, para que sea una buena profesional que es lo que mas gustavo sueña todos los dias.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a steady person, very hardworking, honest and enterprising. Gustavo is a single father and lives with his daughter that he loves with all his heart. He teaches her Christian values to make her a good woman. He is a cheerful person, very charismatic and is united with people that need it. These qualities have earned him the affection of his community and colleagues.

The loan requested through Fodemi, will be used to paint his taxi and with the maintenance, specifically the engine since it is old and has some flaws. Gustavo said that it is important to keep perfect conditions for the safety and comfort of his clients.

Gustavo's dream, that he continues working everyday to have, is to provide his daughter with the best education so she can be a good professional.

loans.use: to paint and with the maintenance of the taxi, to provide better security and service to his clients.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es una mujer con 37 años de edad, recién se casó y es madre de tres hijos.Dos de ellos son mayores de edad y solo uno menor vive con ella y su esposo. Es una mujer esforzada y con grandes deseos de salir adelante para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, debido a que vive en una zona rural y no tiene competencia. En ocasiones ha sido integrante de algunos banco mujer. Su negocio es una pañalera en donde vende varios productos de uso doméstico y personal. También tiene tres hectáreas de plátano sembrada. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más variedad de productos y materia prima para las hectáreas de tierra que tiene.
texts.en:
Aurora is a 37 year old woman. She is newly married and is the mother of three children, two are older and only one is a minor that lives with her and her husband. She is a courageous woman with a great desire to move forward and improve the quality of life for her and her family. 

Since she lives in a rural zone, she has no competition. On occasion, she has been part of some groups. Her business is a baby store where she sells various domestic and personal products. She also has three hectares of planted bananas. The loan is needed to buy more varieties of products and raw materials for the hectares of land that she has.

loans.use: to purchase goods and raw materials.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica de 25 años convive con Nilton, de 30 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 5 años y uno de 5 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en una casa alquilada en una localidad de la selva central. Jessica es una joven entusiasta y trabajadora. Le agradece a su padre la enseñanza de trabajar en un taller de fabricación de cajones de madera, ideales para contener y trasladar frutas. Hace 5 meses, que adquirió sus propias maderas, e instaló máquinas en un espacio de su hogar. “Ahora ya tengo un negocio propio y es rentable, por eso mi esposo y yo trabajamos”,  comenta.
Los agricultores, después de cosechar sus productos deben encajonar sus productos, y es ahí donde Jessica entra a tallar, con la venta de sus cajones. Ella ha encontrado en el campo una actividad rentable y reconfortante. De igual manera, tiene sembrado plátanos, los que cosecha cada 15 ó 20 días. Además cultiva café.
Jessica sueña con tener una casa propia, por eso no duda en seguir esforzándose día tras día, y confía que con esfuerzo lo logrará. Éste es su préstamo número 6 con MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por eso menciona que será puntual y responsable en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además se encuentra satisfecha con su banco comunal llamado “Luz  del Futuro”, por su trabajo solidario.
Con los 1000 soles solicitados podrá adquirir más madera, como roble, palta, pino, etc., para elaborar sus cajones.
texts.en:
Jessica, 25, lives with Nilton, 30, and they have two children, ages 5 and five months. They live in a rented house in the central forest. Jessica is enthusiastic and hardworking. She thanks her father for teaching her how to make wood crates that are perfect for packing and shipping fruit. Five months ago, she bought her own woods and set up machines in her house. “Now I have my own business, and it's profitable, which is why my husband and I work," she says. After the harvest, the farmers have to pack their crops, and this is where Jessica's workshop comes in: selling crates. She finds the work profitable and reassuring. She also grows plantains, which she harvests every 15 to 20 days, and coffee.

Jessica doesn't hesitate to work hard each day because she dreams of owning her own home. This is her 6th loan cycle with MFP, and she thanks the institution for its support. She will be punctual and responsible with her monthly loan payments. She is satisfied with the united efforts of her communal bank “Luz  del Futuro.” With the loan of 1000 soles, she will be able to buy more wood such as oak, avocado, and pine to make her crates.

loans.use: to buy oak, avocado, pine and other woods.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes, 31, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronnie, a vendor, and is a mother. She and her husband share the responsibility in attending to their young children, and at the same time, earning an income for their daily needs. 

Gertrudes is a Balut vendor. In the Philippines, Balut is well-known egg that is sold on the sidewalk. Balut is an duck egg that has not been hatched; instead it is cooked as a boiled egg with a delicious small amount of soup inside. It is a highly nutritious food that Filipinos love, especially when they feel tired as it revitalizes their energy and strength. About 450-600 Balut eggs are being boiled and sold every night. She and her husband do the boiling to lessen expenses for the vendors that will sell it. They earn 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales per day.  

Gertrudes is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000 that she will use to buy additional Balut eggs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gertrudes dreams of giving her children a good, quality education. For now, she and her husband will just continue to lean on each other to make their small business grow for the sake of their children’s future. She never fails to attend weekly fellowship*, as it inspires her to go on with their life no matter what are the obstacles because she has a big God Who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy Balut (an egg snack sold in the Phillippines) for her business.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rhodora is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Rhodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is 65 years old and married, with seven children. Ramona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 22000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ramona has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin was able to renovate some of his rental houses using his previous loan of 1,000,000 UGX. However, the money was not enough to do all he wanted to do. Because he wanted a payment that would fit into his budget, he has waited until now to request another loan of 1,000,000 UGX to renovate the remaining part of his houses. He wants to make them a comfortable environment during the festive season. He will be able to plaster and work on the plumbing for some of the leaking parts of the house. He is excited and thanks Ugafode for standing with him up to his old age. He is an honest and social person who has made many friends within the organization.

loans.use: To renovate his rental house.

loans.name: Al-Hayah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hayah and consists of three ladies and a man who live in Haja, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 190,000 YER. 

Nadia is a 28-year-old married woman who has three children. She is requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy a refrigerator. She hopes to improve her family's living standard in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for personal use.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

NWTF is presenting Ruby's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ochildy

texts.ru: Тяжелая условия проживания заставила Очилди покинуть свою родину и стать трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации. Он там работал несколько лет и из-за тяжелого труда, потерял здоровье. Он вернулся на родину больным, и у него не было средства для лечения. Так как он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей, ему пришлось поступить на работу в алюминиевый завод. Уже 5 лет он работает на этом заводе и на полученную зарплату обеспечивает семью. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Очилди единственный кормилец в семье. Его единственный сын еще не трудоспособный и он не может поддержать своего отца. Его 2 дочерей тоже учатся в школе, а старшая дочь еще не нашла работу. Состояние Очилди ухудшается год за годом, и никто из членов его семьи не могут поддержать его. Он обратился за займом в сумме 1600 сомони для лечения. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется только на вас.
texts.en:
Difficult living conditions forced Ochildy into becoming a migrant workier in the Russian Federation.  He worked there for several years and lost his health to hard labor.  He returned to his motherland a sick man and he didn't have the means to pay for treatment.  Since he is married and has four children, he had to go to work in an aluminum plant.  He has been working at this plant for five years now, and his salary provides for his family.  His wife is a homemaker, so Ochildy is the only breadwinner for the family.  His only son isn't able to work and can't support his father.  Two daughters are also in school, and his oldest daughter hasn't been able to find work.

Year after year Ochildy's condition worsens and none of the members of his family is able to support him.  He has applied for a loan of 1,600 somoni for treatment.  He anticipates your kindness and is relying only on you.

loans.use: to pay for treatment

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо человек искусства. Она имеет творческий подход каждой ситуации и всегда выполняет на «класс» свои задачи. Ей 34 года. Она не замужем и живет в родительском доме. Мархабо окончила  Художественный колледж по специальности педагог по рисованию. Уже несколько лет она работает на 2 местах педагогом. Она работает в средней школе и в музыкальной школе. Ее коллеги очень уважают ее, потому что она порядочная и добрая женщина. Полученную зарплату она использует для содержания семьи и поэтому она не может делать сбережения. Его брат скоро женится и у него свадьба. Мархабо хочет сделать свадебный подарок любимому брату, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки свадебного подарка. Она кредитуется первый цикл и обещает погасить займ во время. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marhabo is a woman of the arts.  She takes a creative approach to every situation and always completes her tasks with class.  She is 34 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home.  Marhabo graduated from the Arts College receiving a degree in teaching drawing.  For several years now, she has been holding two teaching positions.  She works in a high school and in a music school.  Her colleagues respect her very much because she is such a good and decent woman.  She is not able to save any money because she uses her salary to support the family.

Her brother is going to marry soon and there will be a wedding celebration.  Marhabo wants to give her beloved brother a wedding present, but she has no money.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy a wedding present.  This is her first time borrowing and she promises to repay the loan on time.  She anticipates and is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy wedding present for her brother

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel  tiene 55 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los 3 hijos. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Miguel Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra y vende los productos en Mocache.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, urea, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es tener una camioneta para transportar los productos.

Los desfíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y plagas en los sembrìos.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo turismo y haciendo deporte.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel, 55, is married. He lives with his wife and three children. He lives in the Aguas Frías area of Mocache, Cantón Mocache. The communal bank El Progreso is located in the Aguas Frías area of Mocache, Cantón Mocache. This communal bank works in short-cycle farming of corn and rice. Miguel Ángel works cultivating corn and rice. He buys and sells the products in Mocache. He is applying for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and manure for the crops. The loan has helped him to increase his income for his family's consumption and to invest in the planting. His dream is to have a truck to transport his products. The challenges that he faces are diseases and plagues in the plantings. In his free time, he likes being a tourist and playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and manure for the crops

loans.name: Cruz Mercedes

texts.es:
Cruz Mercedes tiene 23 años es madre soltera, vive con los papás y el hijo. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Cruz Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra y vende los productos en  Mocache.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. El sueño es seguir aumentando los cultivos, comprar una casa y dar un buen estudio al hijo.

Los desafìos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades en los cultivos, el mal clima y las plagas.

En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar manualidades y ejercicios.
texts.en: Cruz Mercedes, 23, is a single mother. She lives with her parents and her son. She lives in the Agua Frías area of Mocache, Cantón Mocache. The communal bank El Progreso is located in the Aguas Frías area of Mocache, Cantón Macache. This communal bank works in short-cycle farming, growing corn and rice. Cruz Mercedes works in agriculture, planting corn and rice on her own land. She buys and sells the products in Mocache. She is applying for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure for the crops. The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family and to invest in the planting. Her dream is to keep increasing her crops, to buy a house, and to give her son a good education. She faces the challenges of diseases in the crops, the poor weather, and plagues. In her free time, she likes to do handicrafts and exercise.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure for the crops.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, y no tiene hijos. El vive en fila tigre con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas doble prosito, para cría y leche. El quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener más posibilidad de vender más crías. El se ha dedicado con su familia al cultivo de granos básicos complementado con la ganadería Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 57 years old. He is married and has no children. He lives on the fila tigre with his wife.

With the loan, he wants to purchase cows for raising and milk. He wants to slightly increase his amount of animals to have the chance to sell more offspring. He and his family have been dedicated to the cultivation of basic grains supplemented by animal husbandry.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans before this at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan more easily and with lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Seilyen

texts.es: Seilyen tiene la edad de 23 años, está casada y vive con el esposo. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de papa que quieren iniciar. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Doña Seilyen trabaja desde hace muchos años a la agricultura sobre todo a la siembra de granos básicos y desea poder iniciar en la siembra de papa. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. . Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Seilyen is 23, married, and lives with her husband. The loan will be used to buy manure to fertilize the potato plantings she wants to start. She wants to provide good conditions for growing the crop so that the production will be better and her earnings will be higher. Seilyen has been farming for many years, in particular growing basic grains, and she would like to start planting potatoes.

She hopes to provide her family a better life and financial stability and to keep maturing as a person and producer. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. Though she has no previous loan history with other state banks, FUDECOSUR has offered her good terms and a low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es:
Kattia, es casada y tiene una hija que está en etapa escolar, viven en casa de su madre, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió solo hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida rápida: salchipapas, hamburguesas, hot dog, mini pollo. Su esposo es chofer asalariado en un sindicato de choferes de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para adquirir  insumos por mayor como ser: papa, arroz y aceite, así podrá obtener un poco más de ganancia ya que comprando por mayor el precio de los productos disminuye.

El sueño de kattia, es tener una pensión donde pueda ofrecer a su clientela no solo comida rápida si no también almuerzo y cena. Así mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Kattia is married and has a school-aged daughter.  The family lives in her mother's house, which is located in the Rio Seco neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

Kattia has only a high school education.  She currently works selling fast food: sausages, fries, hamburgers, hot dogs, and chicken.  Her husband works as a salaried driver in a taxi driver's union in the city of El Alto.

Kattia needs a loan to buy supplies at wholesale, such as: potatoes, rice, and cooking oil.  This way she will be able to increase her earnings a bit, because by purchasing at wholesale she can get a lower price for her ingredients.

Kattia's dream is to have a catering service where she could offer her customers not only fast food, but also lunches and dinners.  This way, she could improve her family's quality of life and increase her income.

This is the first time that Kattia has requested a loan from IMPRO, and also her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, and cooking oil at wholesale

loans.name: François

texts.fr: François est un camerounais de 30 ans. il possède et gère un salon de coiffure pour homme dans un coin de la ville depuis 3 ans. dynamique et chaleureux, il a vu sa clientèle croître au fil des années et ne parvient plus à les satisfaire.ce crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant les produits de beauté et de parfumerie. Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir son salon de coiffure et de se marier dans quelques années.
texts.en:
François is a Cameroonian of 30 years old. He owns and operates a hair salon for men in a corner of the city, where he has been for the past three years. Dynamic and warm, he has seen his clientele grow over the years and can no longer satisfy their demand.

This loan will allow him to increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing cosmetics and perfumes. The income François earns will allow him to expand his salon and to get married in a few years.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his hair salon.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma de 51 años, está casada, con Ervin, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos: Lisbet, de 5 años, a la que educan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en una localidad de la selva central. Norma es una mujer como pocas. Hace 1 año y medio sufrió la pérdida de muchos bienes productos de una inundación. En éste tiempo consiguió juntar dinero y volver a levantar su hogar, así como abrir otra vez su negocio de bebidas, comestibles y comida.
“La venta de gaseosas y cervezas es rentable, por el sofocante calor de la zona y más aún los fines de semana”, comenta. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Norma; ya también brinda pensión alimentaria a docentes y trabajadores de su localidad. Los desayunos y almuerzos es lo que más vende.
Gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarles a sus hijos una educación decente. 
Sus metas enfocan en aumentar sus ventas, para ello deberá invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir su puesto de ventas. Éste es su crédito número 13 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Comenta que el agrada trabajar con su banco comunal “Luz del futuro”  por el apoyo desinteresado que obtiene de sus compañeros.
De obtener el crédito, comprará cajas de cervezas, gaseosas y otros comestibles, para surtir su negocio, así como insumos para preparar los alimentos que ofrece.
texts.en: Norma, who is 51, is married to Ervin, with whom she has 3 children.  Only one of the children, Lisbet, who is 5, lives with them and they raise and educate her in their own home which is situated in a village in the central rainforest.  Norma is a remarkable woman.  A year and a half ago she lost a large quantity of goods due to flooding, but managed to scrape together enough money not only to rebuild her home but also to reopen her drinks, foodstuffs and ready-meals business.  "Selling fizzy drinks and beer is profitable, since the heat in this region is suffocating, particularly at weekends", she comments.  But that is not the only service which Norma provides; she also sells pre-ordered meals, particularly breakfasts and lunches, to local teachers and workers.  Her efforts have enabled her to provide a decent education for her children.  Her ambitions are to increase her sales, which will mean investing in the purchase of merchandise to stock her stall.  This is her 13th loan from MFP, so she is committed to make her repayments punctually.  She says that she likes working with her communal bank, "Luz del futuro" (Light of the future), on account of the wholehearted support which she receives from her colleagues.  She will use the loan to buy crates of beer, fizzy drinks and other foodstuffs to stock her shop and will also purchase supplies for the preparation of the food which she serves.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, fizzy drinks and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera lives in Syuniq region with her husband and six-year-old daughter. The family earns a living through an agricultural business. More specifically they own a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables and fruits are grown. Together with her husband, Vera keeps livestock as well. Their farm currently includes 25 chickens, two cows and four oxen. As agriculture is the only income source for the family, it is very difficult for Vera and her husband to cover the family's basic expenses so Vera has applied for this loan to expand her farm. With the requested amount Vera will purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. She will use the cow's milk to produce cheese. This loan is very important for Vera to cover her family's expenses and ensure a better future for her little daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en alquiler ocupando una habitación con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de la Paz.

El estudió hasta la secundaria actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.

El crédito lo requiere para compra de una computadora que facilitará sus estudios y trabajos en la carrera de Computación.

El sueño de Gustavo es terminar sus estudios para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Es la primera vez que tiene el crédito  con IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gustavo is single and has no children.  He lives in a rented room that has walls made of bricks and a cement floor, in a home that is located in the Miraflores neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Gustavo has a high school education.  He currently works more than 8 hours a day, because he must cover his expenses for education, food, and utilities.

Gustavo needs a loan to buy a computer in order to facilitate his work studying for a degree in computer science.

Gustavo's dream is to finish his education so that he can improve his living conditions.

This is the first time that Gustavo has taken a loan from IMPRO, and also the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer to help him obtain a degree in computer science

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz de 38 años, está casada con Orlando con quien tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad. Ellos habitan una casa propia ubicada en un distrito de la selva central.
Luz es una mujer responsable y confiable. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de cajones de madera, para contener frutas.
Para ello utiliza diferentes árboles como son: el cedro, el nogal, las paltas, el pino. Además, con el tiempo fue ampliando su taller (ubicado detrás de su vivienda), y ahora también construye muebles como mesas, sillas, o simplemente se encarga de vender tablas de maderas.
El negocio es rentable, con todos los ahorros obtenidos, consiguió abrir otro negocio en su mismo hogar, donde vende algunos comestibles.
“El negocio de los cajones es rentable, porque los pedidos que me hacen son por millares, ésta semana debo vender 2 millares de cajones sólo  aun comprador”, menciona.
Ella requiere de su apoyo, ya que tiene que cubrir éste pedido y necesita de capital para adquirir más madera.
Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del futuro” y se siente a gusto de trabajar con sus socios.
Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de troncos de árboles de nogal, roble, paltas y otros, para elaborar cajones.
texts.en:
Luz is 38 years old. She is married to Orlando and they have 2 children, 13 and 8 years old. They live in their own home in a district of the central forest.

Luz is a very responsible and reliable woman. For more than 10 years, she has devoted herself to making wooden crates to hold fruit. For this purpose, she uses different trees, such as cedar, walnut, avocado, and pine. In addition, over time she has expanded her workshop (located behind her home) and now also builds furniture such as tables, chairs, or simply sells pieces of wood.

The business is profitable, and with all the savings she managed to open another business in her home where she sells groceries.
She said "The business of crates is profitable, because orders that I do are in the thousands. This week I should sell 2 thousand crates to only one buyer."

She requires support since she needs to cover this order and needs capital to acquire more wood. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She gives her word to be on time with the payments. She belongs to the group "Luz del futuro" (Light of the future) and is happy to work with their partners.

She will invest the 2000 soles ($800) in the purchase of tree trunks walnut, oak, avocado, and others, to produce crates.

loans.use: to buy walnut tree trunks, oak, avocado, and others.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
This is May, She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her children’s education expenses and their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan for to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

May dreams of giving her children a high-quality education and hopes to have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta se dedica a la venta de queso, carnes frías, postres y cosméticos,  mediante una guía especializada de una empresa, a la que está afiliada, pues es esta la que le ofrece el catalogo y los productos para que desarrolle su labor promocional y de ventas. Con su anterior credikiva, ella logró comprar estos productos en mayor volumen y está muy satisfecha, porque ganó descuentos que sus proveedores le hicieron y porque agregó un nuevo producto: el postre, el cual le ha dado muy buen resultado, porque  lo  elabora  y distribuye desde los lunes y cobra su cartera los sábados. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “ Les doy gracias por prestarme el dinero para salir adelante y espero que sigan apoyándome y yo responderé bien al crédito”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará materiales como leche condensada, chocolate, galletas, para elaborar postres y comprar queso, pues son  los productos que mas se venden a final de año, debido a las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año y ella estará siempre dispuesta,  a servir a sus clientes y aprovechando la oportunidad que le ofrece el mercado para ganar aun mas dinero.
texts.en:
Marta works selling cheese, cold meats, desserts, and cosmetics, though the catalogue of a business with which she is affiliated. This business offers her the catalogue and the products so that she can carry out her work promoting and selling. With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to buy a greater volume of these products and she is very satisfied, because she got discounts from the providers and she added a new product: desserts, from which she has gotten really good results, because she makes it and distributes it starting Monday and collects the money on Saturdays. 

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for lending me the money to move forward and I hope that you continue to support me and I will respond well to the loan." She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan, with which she will buy ingredients like condensed milk, chocolate, and cookies, to make desserts and buy cheese. These are the products that sell most at the end of the year, because of the Christmas and end-of-year festivities. She is always ready to serve her customers and take advantage of the opportunity that the market gives her to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as condensed milk, chocolate, and cheese to make pastries

loans.name: Blanca Hortencia

texts.es:
Blanca Hortensia  tiene 22 años es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Blanca Hortensia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra y vende los productos en Mocache.

Solicita el crèdito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es comprar un terreno y cultivar en el.

Disfruta escuchando mùsica.
texts.en:
Blanca Hortensia is 22 years old, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

The PROGRESO (Progress) office is located in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, belonging to the canton Mocache. This office is dedicated to short cycle agriculture like corn and rice.

Blanca Hortensia is dedicated to agriculture through the sowing of corn and rice. She buys and sells products in Mocache.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and insecticides for cultivation. The loan will help her to increase her revenue for the well-being of her family. Her dream is to buy her own land and work it.

She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Amanda es indudablemente una persona de un corazón humilde, Amanda, dice que es una persona, honrada, luchadora y muy trabajadora que ama a su esposo, ya que juntos trabajan en la agricultura, tiene una hija de 7 años a quien ama, a ella le encanta la agricultura y lo importante para ella es sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo empleara en la compra de semilla de frejol y en la compra de fungicidas e insecticidas para el cuidado de las plantas de papa, ya que en estas fechas proliferan insectos que dañan las plantas, y las tienen que cuidar para no perder la cosecha en esta temporada. 

El sueño que la Sra. Amanda tiene es comprarse un tractor y así poder triplicar la producción que tiene en estos momentos, esta consiente que cumplir su sueño es posible pero tiene que trabajar, y es por ello que todos los días se levanta agradeciendo a dios un día más de vida donde pueda trabajar para poder cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Amanda is undoubtedly a person with a humble heart. She says she is honest, a fighter, hardworking, and loves her husband. They work together in agriculture and have a 7 year old daughter that loves agriculture. The most important things for her is for her family to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan from Fodemi to buy bean seeds, fungicides and insecticides for the care of the potato plants. These days the insects are proliferating and damaging the plants and they have to be careful not to lose the harvest this season.

Amanda's dream is to buy a tractor to be able to triple their current production. She knows the dream is possible, but she will have to work. That is why every day she gets up thanking God for one more day of life where you can work to fulfill your dream.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fungicides and insecticides for the care and protection of the potato crop.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza  46 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 15, 18, y 24 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de fritos y tortillas. Ella inicio trabajando con  su  mama en la producción de tortilla, luego ella se caso y decidió independizarse, poner su propio negocio de vender fritangas, con pequeños préstamo que le hicieron, ya que ella anteriormente dependía solo de los ingresos que le daba su esposo, pero no le ajustaba para el sustento del hogar.
Maritza solicita el financiamiento para comprar leña y  maíz procesado al  por mayor, etc. Toda la materia prima que necesita para  la elaboración de sus tortillas. Para aprovechar la temporada de ventas ya que tendrá un buen ingreso de lo vendido, tiene como planes en el futuro ampliar y diversificar su negocio en su casa, de esta manera poder incrementar sus ganancias para darle una buena presentación al local donde actualmente vende.
texts.en:
Maritza is 46 years old, she is originally from Granada. She is married and a mother to 3 children who are 15, 18 and 24 years old. Maritza is a salesperson, she sells fried food and tortillas, she began her trade with her mother by making tortillas and later on she got married she went on her own to set up her business selling fried fast food with a small loan. Before she used to depend on the income that her husband gave her but it was not enough to meet the household expenses.

Maritza needs a loan to buy firewood and wholesale processed corn, etc. All the raw materials are needed to make the tortillas. She wants to take advantage of the selling season since she will have a good income from what she sells. Maritza plans to expand and diversify her household business and to increase her income to give her place a good presentation to her customers.

loans.use: buy firewood and wholesale processed corn, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Glenda works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials. 

Glenda is borrowing 25000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, sugar, and other groceries for her store.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, sugar, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new autorickshaw body for her husband's rickshaw transport business.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is 47 years old. She lives with her husband in the small village of Kvareli district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf. Manana milks the cows and produces cheese, which is sold in an open market at a good price. Her husband has a horse, and goes to the forest and brings wood by horse to sell locally. In addition, they have a vineyard and 1.6 hectares of land, where maize is grown. Manana sells harvested maize and vines locally. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. Manana requested a loan for renovation of their house. After the house is renovated, they will be able to spend winters in better conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nancy works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Nancy is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 43 years old and married with 10 children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines and other groceries.

In the future Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, bread, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in rice farming for several years now. This is the source of their income. Flordeliza is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With these, they will be able to improve their farm, thus increasing their harvest and yield.

In the future, Flordeliza dreams of making her farming business a success. She also wants to save money to reinvest in the business and for future use.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 39 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Julie has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Julie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is involved in agriculture.  She breeds cattle and grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables.  Currently her farm includes 2 pigs, 10 chickens and 12 little pigs.  She cultivates wheat and tomatoes, as well as growing peach and pear trees with great love and care.  She has applied for this loan to expand her farm with special milk cows.  With the requested amount she will purchase 3 cows.  This will enable her to get milk and use it in cheese production.  

Anush lives with her husband and three children.  She is a very hardworking lady and together with her husband, they do their best to give their children a good and secured life.  The loan is very important for Anush to get high income and ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Ma. Cecil

texts.en:
Ma. Cecil is 44 years old and married with two children. 

Ma. Cecil is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  Ma. Cecil requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Ma. Cecil has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Cecil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Un mayor volumen de verduras compró Ramón a un buen precio y las vendió rapidamente y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. El dice a sus financiadores lo siguiente: "Gracias por el apoyo dado, ha sido de mucho beneficio para mi y mi negocio. hay un voto de confianza." En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevp credikiva, con el cual comprará verduras, frutas, como zanahoria, cebolla, tomate, lechuga entre otras verduras y pomelos, borojó, uvas y durazno, para venderle a otros negocios que preparan comidaas con estos productos como insumos y aumentar sus ventas. El se siente muy felíz con Kiva y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque además logró tener vida crediticia y está construyendo su reputación financiera.
En la
texts.en:
Thanks to his Kiva loan, Ramón bought a large quantity of vegetables at a good price and sold them quickly.  He has the following to say to his lenders: "Thanks for your help.  It has been very beneficial for me and my business.  It's a vote of confidence."

Currently he's applying for another loan to buy carrots, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and other vegetables, and grapefruit, borojó fruit, grapes, peaches, and other fruits.  He's going to sell to other businesses that prepare food with these products so he can increase his sales.

He's very happy with Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because he also managed to have a financial life and he's building his business reputation.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 28 años, está casada con Rudy. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jack, de 10 y Anahi, de 4 años. Margarita y su familia viven en la casa de su madre, ubicada en un distrito de la selva central. Margarita es una mujer muy laboriosa, se dedica a varias cosas. Desde la elaboración de cajones de maderas, o como jornalera. En todo este tiempo pudo juntar un capital de dinero necesario para poder abrir un  pequeño puesto de comida rápida donde vende anticuchos, hamburguesas y salchichas y papas fritas. Los que en todo este tiempo, tiene gran acogida. “Las personas ya me conocen por eso siempre vienen a comer, además en estas comidas no hay pierde”, comenta. 
Estos días no hay cosechas, ni mucho trabajo agrícola, por eso se enfoca en la preparación de sus alimentos. Tiene planeado aumentar sus ventas, por eso también quiere extender su espacio y colocar estantes y ofrecer más productos, tales como abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, por eso requiere de su ayuda. Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP. Por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. A la vez menciona sentirse contenta trabajando dentro de su banco comunal “Luz del futuro”, por la solidaridad y confianza de sus socios.
Con los 3000 soles podrá adquirir más carne e insumos para la preparación de alimentos, así también piensa comprar abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para extender su negocio en una pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Margarita is 28 years old and is married to Rudy. Together they have 2 children: Jack, 10 and Anahi, 4. Margarita and her family live in her mother's home located in the central district of the jungle. Margarita is very hardworking and is dedicated to several things including making wooden crates, or as a day laborer.

In all this time, she gathered the money needed to open a small fast food stand where she sells kebabs, burgers, sausages, and french fries. It was received very well. She says, "People already know me, that is why they come to eat. Also on these foods there is no loss."

These days there are no crops, and not much agricultural work. Therefore, she is focused on food preparation. She plans to increase her sales and wants to extend her space and put up shelves and offer more products, such as groceries and staples. For this, she requires your help.

This is her 12th loan with MFP. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with the payments. At the same time she mentioned she feels happy working with the “Luz del futuro” (Light of the Future) group, due to the solidarity and confidence of its partners.

With the 3000 soles ($1175) she will acquire more meat and ingredients for the food preparation and also plans to buy groceries and staples to extend her business in a small store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and staples.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata, de 31 años, está casada con Nilo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Noralei, de 16 y Jair de 10 años. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural de la selva central. Desde aproximadamente 10 años, Fortunata se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son café y cítricos.  Con los ahorros obtenidos logró abrir otro negocio en su hogar. “Esta actividad es más relajada y también es rentable, especialmente en la venta de bebidas”, menciona. En su casa se ubica el único teléfono de la zona, “estoy contenta con mis logros por que todo lo obtuve con sudor y esfuerzo”, explica. 
Desde hace 5 años  labora así. Ahora desea esforzarse más, pues su hija se encuentra estudiando una carrera universitaria. La  temporada navideña será provechosa, según sus cálculos, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir mayor mercadería.  Éste es su préstamo número 13 con MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Le agrada el trabajo con su banco comunal “Luz del futuro”, por encontrarse en un ambiente familiar y amical. Invertirá los 500 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, así como más gaseosas y cervezas, los que venderá en su tienda instalada en su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 31, is married to Nilo; they have two children, Noralei, 16 and Jair, 10.  This family lives in their own house located in a rural district in the central jungle.  For about 10 years Fortunata has been working in agriculture growing mainly coffee and citrus fruit.  With savings earned from this she opened another business at home.  “This activity is more relaxed and is also profitable, especially the sale of beverages,” she mentions.  Her house has the only telephone in the zone.  “I’m happy with my accomplishments because I accomplished all of them through my own sweat and effort,” she explains.

She’s been working like this for five years.  Now, she wants to put even more effort into it because her daughter has started university.  The Christmas season is very profitable according to her calculations so she needs help to acquire more merchandise.  This will be her 11th MFP loan so she commits to make her payments punctually.  She enjoys the work in her “Luz del Futuro” (Light of the Future) communal bank because of its friendly family atmosphere.  She will use the 500 soles to buy basic staples as well as soft-drinks and beer to sell in her home-based grocery store.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and beer.

loans.name: Alejandra De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Alejandra, de 32 años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de 1 hijos de 7 años de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante. Se dedica a trabajar en su pulpería. Esta actividad la empezó con ayuda de su mama, quien   la  motivo a tener su propio negocio, ya que su esposo es asalariado y con lo que gana no le ayuda mucho en los gastos familiares, fue allí que  decidió   invertir en el otro negocio como es  la venta de comida,  que  les vende a sus amigos del centro de salud. Actualmente tiene 7 años de estar funcionando y ha resultado rentable, ya que no hay días  en que no se vende, siempre tiene clientes.
Ella requiere el crédito para comprar  granos básicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc. Su propósito es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea  bien surtida, su meta próxima es ampliar su venta de comida para ofrecerles a sus clientes platillos de toda variedad.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 32, is from Granada; she’s married to a merchant and is the mother of a 7-year-old child.  She works in her grocery store.  She started this activity with help from her mother who encouraged her to have her own business because her husband is a salaried employee and she helps him cover household expenses with what she earns.  This was when she decided to invest in another business: selling food to her friends in the health center.  She’s been in business for 7 years now and is having profitable results since there are no days when she does not sell; she always has customers.

She needs the loan to buy basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, etc.  Her goal is to turn her grocery store into a well-stocked variety store and her next goal is to expand the food sales to offer all variety of dishes to her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rama Swami Group

texts.en:
Rama Swami is the name of this Joint Liability Group. All six active women entrepreneurs of this group belong to Bhawanipatna town in Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Pindar, sitting back in the group photo with a blue dress, is one of them.  She is 47 years of age and lives with her eight-member family comprised of her husband, two sons, two daughters-in-law and two grandchildren.
 
Pindar is running a refrigerator repair and air conditioner fitting workshop in her house and an auto repair garage in town with the help of her two sons. The refrigerator repair workshop has been running for the last seven years. People from the town and the periphery depend on her workshop. Her son also keeps orders for fitting air conditioners in the vehicles. He covers a distance of 100 kms radius for this work. She has engaged three skilled workers in her workshop @ 3,000 INR each per month.  Her monthly net income from these businesses is around 10,000 INR. But in the opinion of Pindar, it is insufficient to manage the workshop as well as the household expenses. Pindar depends on the nearest wholesale market 300 kms. away for purchasing materials like gas and other spare parts. With the loan, she has a plan to purchase gas and spare parts for refrigerator repairs. With this, she will add some extra income to her family to lead a better life. Pindar has a dream of constructing a house for her family as the present one is not comfortable for such a big family.
    
The other five members of the group are Umapriya, Sabita, Hem, Sorojinidei and Anusaya who run a cycle mart, a fancy store, a cycle store, a Tiffin hotel and a cloth business, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, gas and spare parts

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This is Michelle, 33, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she lives with her parents and helps them manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
